Reviews.Title: “Great location- horrible everything else.”
Reviews.Author: SensLarson
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Key West all ready to join in on a sunset cruise at 6. Since no valet was available when we pulled in to "La Concha," we had to leave one person with the car and scramble with our luggage. Unfortunately even though it was 4pm, our pre-paid room was unavailable. The general manager, when pressed for some option to refresh after 8 hours in the car, offered us the use of the public bathrooms by the pool. Eventually the one helpful person on staff, Marta, got us a room. There we found a toilet that was barely flushing, a towel rack falling off the wall, a moldy looking AC vent, outdated and gross carpets, rickety furniture and sheets that were literally hairy. There was construction going on above and below our room that sounded like it was about to tunnel right in. The fridge felt like a real luxury in contrast with the rest of the misery.

Reviews.Title: “March visit”
Reviews.Author: BurtandSheilaD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay while in Key West. The people who make this hotel good are the welcome and housekeeping staff. Desk help could use some tutoring from the rest of the hotel's staff. The front desk staff were somewhat understaffed and most seemed preoccupied.The Bell Boy, Phil, really made the stay great. He always greeted us with a smile and was happy to help with anything we needed. He seemed to know us from the first minute we arrived and was truly sad to see we were leaving. I look forward to taking my entire family here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated”
Reviews.Author: bozo9999
Reviews.Content: Check in unnecessarily delayed; dreadful noise from next rooms plumbing; leak from toilet ceiling; not informed of complementary breakfast ; phone temporarily out of service; wake up call ordered but not given; taxi ordered but not booked; mold on windows; no free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Need honest front desk employees.”
Reviews.Author: JenniferNaomi
Reviews.Content: The location was the best thing about this hotel. We arrived and were told that there were no king suites available, despite the fact that our reservation was specifically for a king. We were offered a queen but no sort of monetary compensation for the switch. We asked the Manager on Duty instead of the front desk girl, and he looked on the computer and voila! There was a king available. After checking in and getting ready for the evening, we learned why they were possibly not going to rent that room. The shower leaked- everywhere, all over the washroom floor. It was a mess. It wasn't an honest transaction from the start. Why tell someone that the room they reserved was unavailable? I am not a hotel person so I wouldn't know the motivation behind it. It was spring break so you would think that the hotel would get a few extra people working the front desk especially if they are sticking to their 4:00 pm check in time which means everyone is checking in at 4 and there is a ridiculous line and only one valet. Frustrating situation- after a long trip, everyone just wants what they paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Service is excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Kruses
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times before and will continue to do so. Visited this year (2012) for a special family event and the staff was very accomoadting to our needs. Property was booked solid for valentines day week and was very busy and I could tell a challenging time for front office personnel. Our party was always greated with a smile and all of our needs were addressed immediatly (thanks Chad & Marta!). La Concha undergoing partial renovations; I witnessed some unruly patrons giving the front desk a hard time and all staff involved handled the situation in a courteous & professional manner. Bellman and concierge were cheerful & helpful in every instance. I'm already looking forward to next winter if for no other reason than to return to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Richard C
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this property for many years and enjoy the central location, pleasant staff and really get the feel of Key West while staying there. Many of employees have been there for years and make you feel at home the minute you arrive; starting with Phil as you exit your car. The recently refurbished rooms are comfortable and furnished with all you need for your stay. The moment we leave we start planning for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Always wanted to stay here and finally did it.”
Reviews.Author: GammaMan
Reviews.Content: This historic and beautiful hotel makes a strong presence in the heart of old town. It's the best location on Key West. The lobby, rooms, and roof top are attractive assets. It's close to the historic seaport and Mallory Square. The best sports bar on Duval, Jack Flats, is right across the street. Cap't Tony's, Schooner Wharf, Green Parrot, and Smokin' Tuna Saloon are close by.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Get Away But Right On Duvall”
Reviews.Author: David J
Reviews.Content: I had read a number of reviews after already booking a 5 night stay with my Priority Club Points and was hoping that I had not made a mistake. Well, I am now on my way home and can say that it was a great stay. We had a room in the historic section of the hotel that had just recently been redone and they have done a great job of making it feel like the classy hotels of the past. The room was not large but had everything we needed with a very comfortable King Size Bed, Refrigerator, 42" flat screen TV, Coffee Maker and plenty of closet and dresser space for my wife and I to unpack everything. The room and the bathroom was immaculate and we love having a room with a walk-in shower (who bathes at a hotel anyway). The AC worked great and the shutters on the inside of the window were better than most draperies in keeping out the early morning light. Housekeeping was wonderful and attended to any special requests we had. The toilet flush is a little loud but efficient. The lobby is a beautiful opening presentation for the hotel and was a great place to sit and read in the evenings. The courtyard is a wonderful getaway from the Duvall street rush with a number of levels for sitting and relaxing. The pool is small and a little too warm but when you exit it the ever present breeze gave you a refreshing cool down. My only complaint with the courtyard area is there are no light that would allow you to sit out after dark and read or just relax with friends. Maybe some solar powered (there is surely enough sun during the day) light strings in the umbrellas would be easy to implement. Did not eat in the restaurant as there are just too many other neat places to do that. Had a couple of drinks in the bar and the bartender was attentive and friendly. The pool bar is open until 5pm when everyone starts heading for the The Top to see the sunset. This was really the only disappointing part as it gets crowded fast and there is limited seating so why not just go to Mallory Square. As for parking, being a downtown hotel it is not surprising that you have to pay for parking but as a Platinum level member I was pleased to find that it was free. They are presently working on the 2nd floor of the historic section and if the results on the 4th floor are an example they are making bringing this old lady of a hotel back to her glory years. Thanks to the management for putting that kind of effort in.

Reviews.Title: “good location - just a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: AureliaSC
Reviews.Content: I have been to Key West many times now for business but this was the first time I stayed at this hotel. It was OK, and the location was great. The front staff is too busy and needs more HELP! They do a good job. Parking is pricy - $25 per day when the room is already over $300 per day...but parking is a must in this area. The rooms are a bit tired, but they are doing renovations, just not the rooms with the two double-beds just yet. But the doubles are not on Duval so they are very peaceful. My first room was on the fourth floor, and the AC units outside were sooo loud, but the front desk had no issues moving me someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: shastam
Reviews.Content: This historic hotel is high on character & charm, as well as amenities and location. Situated right on Duval Street in the heart of Key West activity, our charming room was still surprisingly quiet. The common areas are gorgeous and we enjoyed the rooftop pool. The staff was friendly, courteous & helpful. We plan to stay there again next year. Don't let the dubious stucco on the outside scare you off; inside, it's a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Two stays and we will be back next year! :)”
Reviews.Author: leenh_12
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay at La Concha in Key West. We stayed last year and were very pleased with the hotel staff and the accommodations. My husband had some business in Key West, so I jumped at the opportunity to extend his stay and join him for a few days in Key West as it's one of my favorite places to be. We checked in Thursday late afternoon to a gorgeous, newly renovated suite on the 3rd floor (thanks, Josh!!). The room was spectacular with two flat screen TV's and very relaxing color scheme ~ we really loved the accommodations. Our bed was super comfortable. I can't say enough about the staff at the front desk. Josh is the manger and has shown great willingness to make his guests happy and is very nice. We also dealt with Chad who was also very accommodating and friendly. The location for this hotel is superb. You walk right out of the hotel onto Duval Street. All of the shops are right there and many restaurants as well. Starbuck's is located on the Lobby floor, right across from the elevator which was a nice convenience. The hotel is very charming and has a lot of architectural detail ~ it's not a cookie cutter hotel. The top of the hotel has a spectacular rooftop bar and common areas to view the sunset. The pool area is great for getting some sun and cooling off. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to get the real Key West experience and have a very comfortable place to relax when your day is done.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location”
Reviews.Author: wileyc0y0te
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with all the amenities AND the feel that you are definitely in Key West. The location is perfect for experiencing Key West and we couldn't have been happier with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Trigirl92014
Reviews.Content: My friend and I are down in Key West for Presiden't weekend and only booked the hotel last month. We didn't have many choices and prices were expensive. We settled for $350 a night at the Crowne Plaza Hotel in KW and didn't expect much after reading the other reviews. That worked out in my favor, because I can be a bit of a snob when it comes to hotels. I want nice rooms, good amenities and the location - most importantly I want good value. Well, the Crowne Plaza didn't disappoint. Nothing in KW is cheap (except getting a hangover after the 2-1 drink specials at HH) so once you get over the sticker shock of paying for the hotel, it's all good. The hotel is located in the middle of Duval street, so Head South and you hit the Atlantic ocean (which is the "gay" end of the street as we were told last Night) and if you head North you hit the Gulf side which is where the boat doc is and plentiful amount of bars & restaurants to watch the sunset. The hotel is old, but so charming and has plenty of character. The rooms are average size, ours had a king bed and a coach with flat screen TV. The bathroom is a bit small, just a toilet and one sink, but an oversized shower which was nice. I can't complain about anything in the room, bed was super comfortable. Not sure what some other reviewers weren't happy with it. The only exception I would say might be a problem is if you are having a girl's weekend, it might be a bit of a problem getting ready because you really can't have more than one person doing hair and make-up in the bathroom at the same time and there isn't any other mirror. As some other people mentioned, the pool is small, but I thought is was GREAT! The water was very warm and everybody we met at the pool was super nice. The staff was also very friendly, albeit, we didn't have much interaction with them other than valet our car the first day, checking in and asking the concierge for directions - all of which went very smoothly. I am deducting 1 star because of the value factor in the review. I'm not cheap, but I would have been much happier paying $250 a night - $350 is a bit much.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing worked properly”
Reviews.Author: Brian W
Reviews.Content: 1. King bedroom booked, got a queen. Called front desk & was told it was a king. 60 inch wide beds are queen size. It was 60 inches wide. 2. 6th floor rooms so filthy the view was obliterated. 3. WIFI didn't work in our room. 4. We were told 2 days prior that the roof top would be open to us. There was a private function being held there, so it was closed to hotel guests. No sunset view as advertised. 5. Restaurant side dishes all served cold. Returned cold food and got it back again, just as cold as the first time. 6. Lobby doors stuck open all evening on a cold night. Perhaps since the lobby separates the kitchen from the restaurant, that was why the food was cold. Considering the cost of the tiny rooms and cold meals, we rate our stay as poor. On a positive note, the location is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: gspielman
Reviews.Content: Booked this location using Priority Club points. Stayed one night. Great location on Duval Street near almost everything. Parking was discounted to $15 (from $20) as a Priority Club member. We were able to walk to cemetary and little White House. The hotel extended our departure an hour without a hitch. The sunset view from the rooftop balcony was great. You could avoid the crowds near the beach and get the same effect.

Reviews.Title: “right on the main street of Street of Key West”
Reviews.Author: Dianne G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the Duval Street - the heart of Key West stores and actvivites. It is a very good place to really see what Key West if all about.

Reviews.Title: “safe and clean feeling, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: glamontheroad
Reviews.Content: The staff is very professional, and they are trying very hard to make guests feel welcome. The manager personally assists with all issues, which speeds things up. The property is in perfect location. There is simply nothing better in town. The lobby feels rich and colonia plantationl decor perfectly fits the mood of resort. The rooms are small, but they seems to be renovated just recently. Luxurious bathrooms with very expensive marble sets the mood right. No bathtub, though, just shower. The restaurant on premises is so-so, nothing special. The Starbucks downstairs is very strange, at least compare to NY standards, it is simply not the same in terms of items they have, and even coffee. But this is not the hotel's fault. The only issue with hotel - is their dirty windows. Other then that - everything was perfect. The room's decor is very stylish - they keep within plantation theme and the room feels rich. I guess, as soon as they finish renovation, they will double their prices, right now it is relatively inexpensive in comparison. The roof top bar was closed our entire stay. The pool was open, and it looked very clean. The overall rating - very good hotel. The best choice if you want to be in the middle of it all and don't mind simple and efficient rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A rough start that the staff turned around”
Reviews.Author: jrdavis05
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd hotel in 4 days. We went from Orlando, to Miami, to Key West. I am a Gold Member with the Priority Rewards Club. I have stayed at many Crowne Plaza locations before for work and pleasure. Check in is at 4pm, but we arrived a bit early (1:00pm), and it was a Sunday. I did not expect for our rooms to be ready. Parking at this location is valet only ($20/day) and includes unlimited in and out privileges. I did not catch the name of the valet's, but every valet we interacted with were excellent. hat's off to the entire valet staff. They were by far the most competent employees at this property. These gentlemen have a future in Hotel Management if the opportunities ever come up. The valet tagged our bags, and stored them in a locked room so we could walk around Duval Street (This hotel is close to everything!) We went to the front desk, just to check the room status, and were told that the rooms were not ready, but Marta took our cell phone number and said that she would call us when it was ready. We went out, walked around for a few hours, went to several shops, down to the Southernmost Point, and the Southernmost Beach. We got back to the hotel around 3:30pm, and went to the desk again. We were then told that the housekeeping team was about to start cleaning our room. In the mean time, a lot of other people were checking in (lucky them). At about 3:50, our valet noticed that we were still sitting in the lobby, not looking too happy. He then went to the front desk on our behalf, and a room suddenly became available. He helped us with our bags, and we were on our way up to the room. The room is rather small, but that is to be expected in such a historic hotel (Tennessee Williams wrote "A Streetcar Named Desire" in this building). If you want a bigger room, get a suite. There was a couch, a mini fridge (they usually charge you for this, I believe it is $25/night, however we were not charged because we did not request one. The TV was a flat screen, plenty of channels. The bed was very comfortable, as other travelers have stated, it is a standard Crowne Plaza bed. The bathroom was also small, but again, this is to be expected. While my wife and I were in the room, someone tried to access it via a key card. The key card opened the door, however we had the latch across, so they could only open it an inch. At first, we thought it was housekeeping, we were wrong. It was another family on vacation. They were given our room number and key as well. Talk about awkward. We were just thankful that we were there. Who knows what would have happened if an unscrupulous person was given a key when we were not there. I promptly called to the front desk and informed them that someone else just accessed our room with the key card. Marta at the front desk apologized and stated it would not happen again (I sure hope not)! My wife and I went out for the night, Capt. Tony's, Paradise Pizza, and plenty of shops, and Mallory Square. When we came back, we went up to the room, and our key cards did not work. When they deactivated the other family's keys to our room, they deactivated ours as well. So back down to the lobby we went. Chad at the front desk (appeared to be a manager) took care of the situation, and made up for it in the form of breakfast for 2 at their restaurant. From here on out, our stay was excellent. Note: If you have any type of phobia or fear of elevators, do not stay here. The elevators are small due to the buildings age, and they are very shaky. I found them to be fun, but others might panic. **For the ladies, there is no full length mirror in the room at all, in fact, the only mirror is the one over the sink in the bathroom, and no bathtub. It was a stand up shower only.** The breakfast was wonderful. Thank you to Chad and the entire valet staff for making the stay as good as possible. For the location, and the fact that it is a national chain, I would likely stay here again. There are many smaller/neater hotels in the area that I would likely consider.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, poor service”
Reviews.Author: HeileenD
Reviews.Content: I had always wanted to stay at La Concha Hotel in Key West, Florida and I finally had the opportunity to get a reasonable price for a room so I jump at it. The lobby is spectacular, beautiful old pictures of Hemingway all around it. We got there around 2:00 PM and of course we couldn't check in because check in is at 4:00 PM, the girls at the lobby weren't very friendly but they helped us to store our suitcase and promised to call us when the room was ready so we could check in. To my disappointment after 4:45 Pm we never heard from anyone so we just walked back and took a chance it would be ready, which it was. Location is great but as another poster said, the pool is tiny with a very small bar so do not stay here if you like lounging by the pool in a resort atmosphere. I ordered breakfast from room service, which was a terrible mistake. It was extremely pricey $53.00 for me and my husband and the quality was really bad. Pancakes were hard and super small, sausage was old and dried out, juice and eggs were good though. It would have been better if I went to Denny's a few blocks up the street and would have been half the price. The only good thing about the Hotel was the location and the rooms are decent. I will never stay there again as there are better options for same price :(

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, dirty, old rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Mikebrez
Reviews.Content: This was a disaster. I'm a platinum ambassador and never been treated worse at a property. Let me get some of the positives. Location is great to walk down duval st and to walk back in any condition. The beds are comfortable like any crowne has. Thats it. Checking in- rooms were not available at check in time. checked bags and went up to the pool area. It is very small, no music, small bar area, with no bar tender. The hotel itself tries to clean, but fails. It is key west though, a hotel in party alley. The desk clerk seemed inept, turned out to be. When we came back and got our rooms, me and my friend both platinum. He got a jr suite and i got a regular room. okay... not a big deal. It was a tad windy out and the awnings were right outside our window. the noise it created was ridiculous. It took me forever to find out thats what it was. It sounded like someone was pounding on the side of the room, not sleepable. So, i went to the front desk to see about a different room and you would think i asked for her first born. She became extremely defensive, rude, and unaccommodating. After i was pretty much told i was lying about the room, because i just wanted a suite like my friend. That was about all i could take from her, so i asked for the manager. He wasnt on the property so she called him, and started ranting about me!? He tried to do everything he could to compensate for here after it was all said and done. I just had him refund my room and i went to the waldorf where the service would never be like this. there is good reason its at the bottom on trip advisor. ihg group members stay at a different chain in key west.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: OcalaTraveler2011
Reviews.Content: I had a read a few negative reviews of this hotel on Tripadvisor, so it was with a certain trepidation that I booked this hotel. There was mention of remodeling construction noise occurring all day, including weekends. There were also comments about dated rooms. My wife and I checked in on Saturday. The checking process was quick and painless. The lobby area is very nice and tasteful. We got a room on the sixth floor. When i opened the rooms door for the first time, I held my breath. As it turned out, my concerns were unfounded. The room and bath were beautiful, obviously recently remodeled. The room was not large, but it was nicely furnished. The bath was mostly white marble with very modern fixtures. Overall, I was very impressed. The only negative I encountered was that the evening front desk people didn't seem to be aware of a manager's special that was advertised on the hotel website and were unable to apply the discounted rate. Also, it am a Priority Club member but didn't know my member number. The night clerk was unable to look it up in the computer system. It was resolved the next day by the day shift, but it took about 20 minutes. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location on Duval”
Reviews.Author: lululouie
Reviews.Content: Awesome time in an awesome location. Friendly staff. No car needed because you will be in the heart of all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Good but over priced”
Reviews.Author: Yuan G
Reviews.Content: The location is great. Most stores and restaurants are around the hotel. There's a Star Bucks inside the building. The staff are friendly and helpful. However, the room is really small and overall this hotel is over priced.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Sojourner_for_fun
Reviews.Content: We stayed in January 2012 and it was horrible. They were renovating the 4th floor - a fact that they had neglected to tell us when we booked - and we were forced to hear hammering/drilling/sawing from 8am - 6/6:30pm everyday (including Sat. & Sun.) When we first arrived and I questioned the front desk manager concerning the amount of noise and the fact that we were not able to take a nap after 14 hours of travel, she was apathetic and said the situation was completely out of her control. When I point blank stated "so we are paying full price for a room in which we are unable to relax, let alone sleep?" Her only reply was "That is correct." She did not apologize, offer a room change, compensation, or even a set of earplugs. I understand that hotels do need to renovate, but normally they tell the guest in advance and give special discounts during the period of remodeling to allow the person to either choose to stay elsewhere and avoid the noise/inconvenience or deal with the noise at a discount. In addition, our room had black mold growing on the bathroom shower around the ceiling and the ventilation fan did not work. Lastly, a week after we returned home I was further dismayed to find out that they had charged an extra night on my credit card. So if you choose this hotel make sure to bring earplugs, Clorox, and check your credit card statement after you return home.

Reviews.Title: “Less than what we expected”
Reviews.Author: SPfromTampa
Reviews.Content: We were a party of four who visited Key West over Xmas and stayed at the Crowne Plaza 12/23/11, 24 & 25. The positives were the Front Desk staff, the bellhops/valets, the location, & the rooftop view. However, we had issues when we checked-in at 7:00 PM - one room had not been cleaned & the other room key did not work. We trekked back to the lobby & rec'd sincere apologies along with comp breakfast vouchers (more on that later). We settled into the rooms, one of which had a refrigerator which was a huge plus. Some issues with the rooms - cleanliness (the vent in one bathroom was filthy, the vacuuming was haphazard at best as spots were obviously missed) and the a/c vent in the main room was in the ceiling & dripped condensation onto the carpet which, especially in FL, tends to make the carpet mold-friendly. On get-away day - 12/26/11 - we decided to use the breakfast vouchers at the restaurant. Wow, of the four dishes served only one was half-eaten because the eggs were stone cold and the potatoes were rock hard. The upside to this disappointment was the chance to revisit Old Town Bakery on the way out of town. We've stayed at other Crowne Plazas and always felt that we rec'd value equal to what we spent. While this is a pretty decent hotel, it did not rise to the level that we had become accustomed.

Reviews.Title: “Calm in a sea of activity”
Reviews.Author: ROGER08109
Reviews.Content: I was at first apprehensive about staying on Duval Street in Key West, due to the noise, but this hotel is an oasis of serenity. Once you are recharged, just head out back into the party. Perfect location. Parking could be cheaper, but not complaining. Staff friendly and knowledgable about the area.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel looks nice but...”
Reviews.Author: sbaehm
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 3rd floor and as the bellman helped us into the room we could hear loud banging and construction noises about us on the the 4th floor. We were told the construction workers would be stopping at 5pm and then it would be quiet until they returned in the morning. We decided to move. The room that was quiet was rundown and not nearly as spacious or nice as the room we had prior that overlooked the inside courtyard. Also if you plan on carrying your own bags, think again. The concierge practically made that impossible as they quickly ushered us out of our car and to the waiting bellman and luggage cart where we were promptly left with our bags until they could get to us. We were told we could leave our things on the cart and our luggage would be watched. When I was not happy with that (I had jewelry I did not wish to leave on a cart unattended, the concierge got an attitude. The overall customer service and the price for the room was inadequate.

Reviews.Title: “Middle of the action on Duval”
Reviews.Author: goofood
Reviews.Content: Beautiful classic hotel. Rooms are a bit small but they have an old fashioned feel. Nice comfortable beds. The staff was super, from the parking valet (caution as I think it's $20 per day), front desk, to the housekeeping staff. No complaints or issues. We has a balcony suite overlooking Duval which provided additonal entertainment from the rooster crowing in the morning to the late night crowds on the street.

Reviews.Title: “5th Floor away from the street.”
Reviews.Author: ConchyLee
Reviews.Content: Overall, a good experience staying 3 nights. But let's break it down... We had driven down from Miami and because of the Ragnar Relay runners, arrived nearly 2 hours late. Had about 3 hours sleep the night before and was quite tired. So it's with no small irritation that when I arrived at the front desk, there were 3 people working the 2 registration terminals...and slowly. When It was my turn, the guy found my reservation but told me that my room wasn't ready. I asked, what time's checkin? 4, he says. And then I asked what time is it now? 4:05 he says.... And my room isn't ready....why? After some fumbling, one of the other staff guys came over to handle my registration. He apologized and quickly upgraded us to a king room for my inconvenience. Nice touch..good customer service. As you may have read, the rooms generally are smaller in this older hotel, but I wouldn't call it a tiny room...it was certainly large enough. Obviously, the room has been remodeled, and has what seems to be either a 36 or 42 inch flatscreen tv. Bed was ridiculouosly comfortable. Although near the elevator, quiet. Very little "island" noise, but this room didn't face the street. However, the bathrooms have your standard "industrial" toilet with the flush bar on the side, instead of a tank style...and are quite noisy. Quite noisy from the room next door! And the bathroom from the room next door afforded a real opportunity to eavesdrop discussions and other bathroom sounds. That's my ONLY frowny face about the room. We were there over a weekend and one of the 2 elevators was out of service most of that weekend. They didn't seem to be able to get it fixed all weekend, but Monday it was fine. These things happen. I'd recommend LaConcha, and would gladly give the place another stay, if I could get a rate as good as I was able to obtain for this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: klaine17
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel each time I have visited Key West, and love it! We are always able to redeem our hotel points, so the value is great. The location is fantastic, and the rooftop sunset experience a must-see! The staff are very friendly and the key lime jelly belly beans at the front desk are a nice touch (although they were missing our last stay - please bring them back!) The rooms are quaint and comfortable. The pool is nice, although gets a bit crowded at times. Free charger for electric cars a plus! Free scooter and bicycle parking too.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some TLC”
Reviews.Author: DRobbins57
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice at this hotel. While being in the heart of Key West, Duval St. and a great location, this establishment is beginning to need some major repairs. Love the pool and the lobby, the resturant is great, but the rooms are small and need updating. Our first trip had a room with no view except trees right in the window. I requested a street view on the second and we had a balcony that overlooked Duvall. The room was tiny, especially with a King bed in it. My main problem was with the front desk staff at check-in who I found to be quite blunt and rude, condescending. My second problem was the elevator which was a bit scary. Not a smooth ride and someone was constantly working on one or the other. I understand the hotel is one of the first with a rich history, but at the prices they chage for rooms, I believe it warrants a facelift in several areas. I love Key West and this is a great place that just screams for a little TLC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Carrie C
Reviews.Content: I stay at this Hotel every chance I get, the staff is always welcoming and the location is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice remodeled room with great common areas”
Reviews.Author: Oceanfrontproperties
Reviews.Content: Buffalo NY couple. We stayed 43nights and the room was all recently re-done new. Had refrig in room which was nice. Hotel is very well taken care of quiet and walk right out the door to the action of davul street. We never used the care as the hotel is location location location. Great place to stay. Would never know it was a holiday inn property.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: ColCat86
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to La Concha so I knew what to expect. You cannot get a better location than this hotel. Rooms are clean, not fancy. Rooms that face Duval St are small. The ones across the hall are larger. The best reason to stay here is location, you are close to everything; right on Duval street and almost right in the middle between the the Gulf side and Ocean side of Key West. I thought the staff and front desk were very friendly and helpful as well. If you can get a good rate, worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Plaza La Concha Key West”
Reviews.Author: Karen C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and within easy walking distance to all attractions and many bars and restaurants. The hotel itself is old and not fully renovated yet. The plumbing is very old, very slow and very noisy, the walls are thin and the bathrooms small. There is no safe or refrigerator in the room. However, the view from the rooftop is specatcular and the sunset view amazing. The staff could also be a little more friendly. Now that we have been to Key West and seen what is on offer elsewhere would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Tina2899
Reviews.Content: Great location. . . pool was a bit small, but a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the middle of it all”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly B
Reviews.Content: La Concha (Key West Crowne Plaza) is within walking or biking distance to everything in Key West. Be sure to visit the deck on the top floor for a great view. Our family of four stayed in a large room, using our Platinum Rewards. When my son requested a roll-away so he wouldn't need to sleep with his brother, they provided it immediately. The valets were prompt and courteous. We felt well cared for. Our only negative was the dated plumbing. Whenever one of the commercial style toilets was flushed it sounded like a 747 was taking off inside the wall. That was disconcerting in the middle of the night. We did not complain to management, though, because everything else was so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Guest Services”
Reviews.Author: Rene M
Reviews.Content: Excellent customer service and guest service! I highly recommend this hotel in Key West. Beautiful downtown location right on Duval Street. AAAAAA+++++

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised! Renovated Rooms are Fab!”
Reviews.Author: wnbamiamisol
Reviews.Content: After a less-than-spectacular stay here a couple years ago, I was extremely nervous about staying here again. How wrong my apprehensions were! We had a GREAT one night stay, December 28-29, 2011! We arrived 4 hours ahead of the 4pm check-in time and I was prepared to store a bag and head out onto Duval Street. To my surprise, the bubbly and efficient front desk clerk told me I had been upgraded (Platinum Priority Club member) to a suite that had been newly renovated and upon checking with housekeeping, the room was already clean and ready for me. It was an awesome new suite on the 6th floor. It even smelled new! The only draw back, which La Concha can do nothing about, is the noise level arising from Duval Street until well after midnight. Even on the 6th floor, it was still enough to wake me multiple times (until 2am when the bars closed). The 42 inch flat screens in the room are great. The newly remodeled bathroom reminded me of a W-Hotel, with the spacious glass and tile huge walk-in shower. The king bed had a pillow top mattress that would have had me asleep instantly if not for the Duval Street noise. One floor up (7th) is the Top bar. You can sip a cocktail and watch the sunset, but you need to secure your spot at least 45 minutes ahead as the place fills up. As the La Concha is in the center of Duval Street, it is a popular spot to catch the sunset. The hotel has a $20 a day parking fee, but if you are a Priority Club member, it is waived. Wifi is free, BUT, a courtesy of the ground level Starbucks. In a 6th floor room, the wifi is non-existent. Had I been here on business or for more than one night, that would have been a problem. My boyfriend liked that the Starbucks was right by the hotel elevators. It opened at 6am. The only darkside of the Starbucks is that early in the morning, homeless were seated inside. The Starbucks provides a key to the hotel guests-only bathroom, where the homeless go to clean up. At 7am, the tables in the Starbucks were either dirty or occupied by homeless. I am sure this is NOT the image a Crown Plaza wants to have. Check out and retrieving my vehicle from valet parking were swift, pleasant and efficient. This was a great stay in every way! I would definitely recommend this hotel if you want to be in the center of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: sweetnurse34
Reviews.Content: Great location on Duvall street! Room and bathroom were small but ok for two people. Window view from our room was nice, however windows were dirty. The lobby area was probably the nicest area in the hotel. Starbucks is located in the hotel, which was defintely a bonus. I will be staying at a different hotel for our next trip back to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the centre”
Reviews.Author: mika41
Reviews.Content: I like that hotel a lot, it's right on Duval, very luxury inside, it's the highest building in Key West :) They have Starbucks and cool bar/restaurant area downstairs with the best key lime pie I've ever had. Robert was an excellent bartender, we've visited him also at the bar by the pool, that area's pretty! I really like the bar on the roof top, where you can sip your drink and see basically entire island. Pat is entertaining and excellent bartender, we'll see you soon again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Stanburger
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located on Duval. You can walk to all the bars and restaurants. The rooms need a little updating but the lobby and pool area are very nice. We would probably stay again for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond expected services!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mingirl
Reviews.Content: Thanks so much to Crowne Plaza staff from Minnesota!! We had a fantastic stay and would like to thank Zach on the rooftop patio for his superb service above and beyond expectaions for wheelchair needs â™¥â™¥â™¥ And also to his coworker Scott for his support and assistance. Thanks so much guys we had an excellent stay and would recommend to our friends. We are planning a trip and looking forward to another great stay at this hotel and hoping to be in touch with you all soon! Your willingness to assist with the handicapped is truly commendable!!!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_Drift_Woods3
Reviews.Content: The historic La Concha was more than we expected, the large corner room overlooking Duval Street was the perfect place to stay. The amenities were, of course, great, but the feeling of being connected to the past was the best part. We watched the Sunset from the rooftop and it was awesome. No better place to stay when visiting Key West if you want to be right in the middle of everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very quaint!”
Reviews.Author: 007jones
Reviews.Content: Parking expensive, but valet is nice. Room small but quaint and clean. Delivered bar fridge at no cost when we requested at check-in. Would definitely stay again. Rooftop bar is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: yamilisluis
Reviews.Content: Location was great! But the hotel not so much, lobby is probably the nicest part of the hotel. Rooms super small and out dated.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - terrible room”
Reviews.Author: Lrothfl
Reviews.Content: First: one of the best locations to stay at in Key West. Right on Duval Street in the middle of everything. Park the car once and you can get around the entire island via foot, conch train or island trolley. We require a wheelchair accessible room and here was where we encountered most of our hotel problems: the automatic door mechanism did not work because, even though there was the door button in the room, there was no mechanism attached to the door - therefore, you would have to physically open the door to get or out of the room. Since the door opens inward and is heavily spring loaded - getting out on your own is almost impossible. The bathroom had a regular bathtub and not a roll-in shower so - even though they supply a shower stool - forget about taking a shower. Even though Crowne Plaza advertises top of the line bedding our bedding must have been very old and very uncomfortable. Our air conditioning didn't work correctly the two nights we stayed there and learned on our departure day that it was hotel wide and that they were finally working on it. Lastly, their can be nothing worse than a hotel concierge who doesn't know the most basic information about local attractions. We were told that - without question - neither the conch train nor Key West trolley offered "wheelchair accessible" tours. We went down to their staging areas and found out that both offer "wheelchair accessible" tours and equipment as a standard service. We enjoyed a really great conch train tour [which, we highly recommend]. The restaurant attached to the hotel offers good food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: ashbris
Reviews.Content: We rented our room using Priority Club points and received an upgrade to a balcony room. The rooms were on the smaller side however, they were clean and we LOVED the location and the balcony. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but service not up to standard!”
Reviews.Author: XXXXXX2011
Reviews.Content: The room was ok and clean but we had a plumbing problem and showered in ancle high water every day... This hotels real problem, however, is the service level. A few examples: Despite the very late check-in time (4 pm) very few rooms were ready by that time (ours included). We had requested for a crib to be put in the room but it was not. When we pointed it out we got the bed but without linnen. I would not say the staff is rude but they are not very friendly and all seem to be under great stress - twice we heard employees say "Im so tired" when mistakes were pointed out. When we checked out we were handed out the wrong bags and they even tried to charge us the room twice (!) yes, mistakes can be made but still, there was no end to it... Several times when we passed the reception there were customers complaining about different things. Also, if you charge more than 200$ a night for a standard double you would think parking would be included, but no, that is 20$ extra per night. Still the location is great with very nice views over the city from the rooftop bar. One last warning though: dont eat your breakfast at the hotel restaurant (Jacks Seafood Shack) - its both expensive and offers poor quality compared to what you find two blocks north on Duval street.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump”
Reviews.Author: skipcleve
Reviews.Content: We booked a room on points, the front desk MANAGER made us wait to check in on purpose, said our assigned room wasn't ready and we had to wait for that room. WE finally got checked in at 9:30PM and it was a completely different room. This Hotel used to be OK, now it is a dump. Hole in Elevator floor almost broke my wires ankle, carpet in rooms is nothing short of DISGUSTING, and the furniture in the rooms looks like Hemingway himself could have used in back in 1940. If your looking for a good place to get drunk and pass out after crawling back from a bar....Book here. If your looking for a place to relax and feel comfortable sleeping on the mattress....Go anywhere but here

Reviews.Title: “The good and the not so good.”
Reviews.Author: mazel38
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Concha for 5 nights. It's in a great location, walking distance to most tourist sites, including the waterfront. But, it's an old hotel and, like most old homes, things break. We needed to have the air conditioner fixed - it was making a very loud buzzing sound. The toilet didn't flush well, but it was fixed immediately. The back of the TV remote was missing, and the batteries kept falling out. But, it was fixed, as well. Parking was $20/night. Our room was very small, but our friends had a huge room for the same price. Be careful what you ask for. I requested a corner room, and we got it - unfortunately, it was right next to the ice maker machine and faced a wall. But, everyone was very nice and did everyting to try and make our stay comfortable. Note: Shortly before we left, I heard that there is a plan in place to renovate this hotel and that the parking would be by Valet, only.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: dougalfreebee
Reviews.Content: An older building like most in this area but rooms clean and reasonable except the plumbing needs work as the bath/shower drained very slowly. Good location on Duval within walking distance of most things. Only issue we have is charging $20 a day for a car park on their own property!

Reviews.Title: “The "Crowne" Has Lost Some Jewels!”
Reviews.Author: dnjlyke2travel
Reviews.Content: First let me say we have stayed here every year for the last 5 years during our annual trek to Key West and have always truly enjoyed our stay. However this year we were very dissapointed. The reservation was made in early January, and at that time we identified ourselves as having "Platinum" rewards status. Our only request at that time was to have a refrigerator for medicinal purposes. We called one week prior to our arrival to verify that request. Although we arrived on a slow Sunday evening, there was no Bellman to greet us or to assist with the luggage. When checking in were told the refrigerator was not available, as they were on a "first come, first serve basis". When we reminded them we were "Platinum" and made this reservation 9 months earlier, we were told that most guest here were Platinum! As a special treat we ordered room service the first night. The steaks were so rare as to be inedible. We attempted to call room service, but no one answered, we called front desk and they were going to have the kitchen call, but no one ever did. In all fairness the meal was "comped" next morning, and we received coupons for the on premises restaraunt. When going to the resteraunt we found the coupons were for a breakfast buffet, another dissapointment, lackluster variety served by unenthusiastic staff. I think they would be better off putting a McDonalds in the space. The pool which is truly in a beautiful setting has a bar, but is only staffed at their leisure, and can you believe that during Fantasy Fest (as with every other night) closes at 6 in the evening. We went out early one morning to find 2 young ladies sleeping by the pool, although the doors are normally locked at 11pm (paying guest??) After checking everyday at the front , we finally got an old beat up refrigerator the last day of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Room With Deck”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Akron
Reviews.Content: We went to Key West for my birthday. I was upgraded to a room on the second floor with a large deck overlooking Duval Street because I am a Priority Club Platinum member. They also waived the $20 parking fee. There was some street noise but you don't go to Key West to stay in the room. It was quiet after mignight for all of our 3 nights. The rooms are small but met our needs. The elevator was a little scary. This is a historic hotel and was told that they were making upgrades starting early next year. The location is perfect and the staff was super.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jamieathena
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, great service. comfy bed and nice TV! Made my stay in Key West FANTASTIC! one con - scary elevator. should update it and smelled a little like mold! didn't like the parking fee either.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Vincent N
Reviews.Content: The room was dirty ,very noisy, the fixtures were either broken or not working and they had the cheek to charge $299+tax + 20 $ parking per night. I moved to the pier house whack was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice lobby and rooms”
Reviews.Author: mysteryreview
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a large corner room overlooking the pool. The room was a nice place to cool off during the day. The mattress was comfortable. There was some street noise, but overall it was quiet. It was easy to walk to the attractions, restaurants and Mallory square area. Nice rooftop area to see the sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Where you want to stay at Key West ...”
Reviews.Author: Eva Z
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May 2009. The hotel is rather old but I am looking for some historical touch and characters when I'm on vacation anyway. Nice lobby and clean&quiet&comfy room. Parking lot to park my rental car. The stuff are very friendly and helpful. Great location, right in the heart of the actions on Duval Street. Amazing views of the island at the rooftop bar. Will stay here again next time visiting the keys ...

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Michael G
Reviews.Content: Great stay, great location! Isabel at the front desk was awesome with providing assistance and providing solutions!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: badgergirl75
Reviews.Content: Found myself in Key West on business in June 2011 and figured I'd stay at the LaConcha because of its excellent location and well, I wasn't paying the tab. The lobby was impressive and the staff was all very accomodating - although I wish the woman at the front desk would have directed me to the proper set of elevators because I took the one next to the check-in desk and had to work myself through a maze of corridors (including stairs) to get to my room which was coincidently, directly in front of the other set of elevators located behind Starbucks. Oh, well. So be sure to ask which elevators are the most direct route to your room because the place is rather large and broken up. Had a king room and it wasn't huge but it got the job done. Don't think anybody goes to Key West to sit in their room anyway - especially with the spectacles of Duval Street going on right outside your door. Room was clean and quiet even though it was directly in front of the elevator. Sure, it's an older hotel but I happen to love the history of places like La Concha so I didn't mind that my bathroom wasn't state-of-the-art. Parking was $15/day so not horrible and on the day we departed we were informed we could have left our car there while we walked around even though we'd already checked out so I thought that was very nice. You really can't beat the location of this hotel - it's right in the middle of the action on Duval Street. All in all, the hotel is clean and comfortable. I stayed on a Tuesday night in summer so it was very quiet - not sure what it would be like on a weekend. Watched the sunset from the bar on top the hotel and that was a great atmosphere so I recommend you head up there at least once on your visit because it offers spectacular views of the island!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is in the middle of it all!”
Reviews.Author: HeathsgirlJoy
Reviews.Content: We really had an awesome visit. This hotel is within walking distance of everywhere you want to go in Key West! Close to Hard Rock Cafe, Margaritaville, Sloppy Joes, Mel Fisher's museum, Mallory SquareM You will love it here!

Reviews.Title: “Small room, dirty windows with view of duval street”
Reviews.Author: akovalcsik
Reviews.Content: Room 551 overlooks Duval Street but is quite small. There is no mini bar or safe. The windows are quite dirty and the view of Duval street is quite unimpressive. The service and staff at the hotel was exceedingly good. They were always courteous and attentive. The bathroom was very hard to get into and out of as the door swung inward and the space was incredibly cramped. the bed is comfy and the TV was quite large.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to watch a sunset”
Reviews.Author: wrthomas
Reviews.Content: We did not stay at this property; however, we did manage to discover the "Sunset At The Top", . on the 7th floor and is open to the public. The bar opens about 4:00 PM and remains open until just after sunset. To get a good spot, one should arrive by about two hours before sunset. There was live music when we were there. It was a quieter location as opposed to Mallory Square. The bar tender was very nice and gave great service.. An appetizer offering (for pay) would have been a nice addition. It also provided a nice view from what we were told was Key West's tallest building. It is a "must do".

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!! What a location!”
Reviews.Author: michaelmle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of everything! Staff was super friendly and very helpful. We stayed in the Tennessee Williams Suite (663) with the view of Duval Street. The suite small but well decorated with antique furnitures. The bathroom was average size but offered what we needed. Marie offered excellent room services! We didn't try the restaurant attached to the hotel but it was always empty when we stayed. Parking was a hassle: $20 per night. The hotel had limited parking spots so get there early if you are driving. Pros: great locations and in the heart of Key West. Great staff, clean rooms, and wonderful sunset view on the rooftop bar. Cons: small rooms, not modern with the decorations, and parking ($$$).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, historic building, rooms could use updating”
Reviews.Author: hugz415
Reviews.Content: As most of the reviewers have pointed out, the location is perfect. Smack-dab in the middle of Duval makes it very convenient. The building is old and historic which gives it charm. The lobby is done very nicely as well. The pool area is small but while we were there it was basically empty so it didn't matter. The bar at "The Top" is great for viewing the fabulous Key West sunset. I would say the guest rooms are fairly standard. Our room was on the 6th floor at the end of the hall (room 640). The carpets in the halls and rooms are pretty beat up but clean - replacing them would add value. The bathroom was clean and actually thought it was pretty nice. The furniture in the room was my biggest complaint. It's pretty ugly. The chairs at the table were the kind taken from a banquet hall. Getting rid of the table/chairs and putting a nice lounge chair or a small desk would help. Just generally looked like out of date/cheap furniture. The bedding was new and fresh though. Other than that, it was fine and basically what I had anticipated. Just keep in mind that you are paying for location and that it is an old old building.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Excellent location, friendly, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Hollywoodsvine
Reviews.Content: 8 girls packed up for a 4 day, 3 night stay in Key West for a Bachelorette Party. Although at first I thought the rooms were a little pricey, sharing a room brought the cost down and I see that the LaConcha does run specials on the prices, so if you inquire, your rate may be a little better. The LaConcha is central to everything on Duval and within walking distance to several places. The staff was patient and friendly. The beds were sooooo comfortable! On my prior trips to Key West, I am sure I have walked by the LaConcha several times but never noticed it. It is right on Duval, but you can pop right in and be out of the thick of things. Water with lemon and mint and another beverage were always available in the lobby, good for refreshing yourself when coming in from exploring. I would defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Key West La Concha”
Reviews.Author: Warren A
Reviews.Content: Great old hotel with lots of history...but dated. Great location and close to Eaton Street bike rentals.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location: pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: Klewsaat
Reviews.Content: Nice for adults, not so nice for kids which is one reason we liked it. It was clean and the staff was friendly. The AC would not go below 71 F which was a problem that was never corrected even after 2 calls to maintance. The cost is average for Key West-non Resort style. They should have a breakfast bar included in the rates. The Roof Top view is really great and it gave you a perspective of the whole area. Ya don't need a car being everthing is within walking distance There was an annoying drunk group that gathered in the pool at 4 am and woke everyone up, Overall, we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Central Getaway”
Reviews.Author: JaimeCDeBres
Reviews.Content: We go to this hotel every year for our girls getaway weekend. Rooms are clean and spacious. The hotel is older and historic and the pool is just the right size for the adult clientele. I would not recommend this hotel for families with children. This hotel is the center of Duval street and is geared towards adult audiences. It is a little on the pricier side but you dont have to cab back and forth, it is truly central and is within walking distance to everything you would want to see. Restaurants, bars and attractions are so close you really feel like you are living the Key West lifestyle. The hotel is always spotless and the staff and very friendly. The $20 a day parking fee kind of stinks but its well worth the cost to be so centrally located. Overall, a great location for a getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Key West”
Reviews.Author: kmwest086
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was average. Its a historic building right on the main boardwalk. The location is nice and there is a full service starbucks downstairs. The pool is very small (20ppl), but pretty much everything is within walking distance. The concierge is great and will hook you up with much to do in the area. Price wise, it is one of the most reasonable in the area. There are some oceanfront hotels that are much nicer but the price is pretty much double. I would definitely stay here again, the room was small but up to par, and was great if you're just looking for somewhere to sleep at night, and enjoy the town during the day,

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Drlee5
Reviews.Content: This property has gone downhill. Without all the detail, we booked two rooms and called 2 days in advance to ensure they were next to one another (the second room was for our kids). We arrrived to find out that they would not accommodate our request. The kids rooms smelled musty and we complained. We discovered that the AC was leaking and the floor was wet in their room. They eventually sent someone to fix it, but the musty small (and I'm sure the mold) persisted. There were noises in the middle of the night that woke all of us up. It sounded like bowling upstairs. Again we complained, but nothing as done (this copntinued for 2 more nights). This hotel has a great location, but I would look closely at the Hyatt property at teh end of Duval St.

Reviews.Title: “Best location possible to party...”
Reviews.Author: Prosit69
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and it's a beautiful hotel, personal were friendly and although I didn't go in the pool it looked nice and they had a bar by the pool. Both ice machines on my floor was out of order and they didn't seem to care too much, and it wasn't a super huge deal. The hotel is smack dab in the middle of duval street so you can easily walk to sloppy joes or even Mallory square and everything else. Stay away from the restaurant (jacks seafood something or other) it's terrible and way overpriced. Would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in the center of Key West”
Reviews.Author: Gourmand_nl
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in the Southernmost House in Key West but we had no reservation and they had no vacancies. The person at the desk of the Southernmost House recommended La Concha. It is certainly not as beautifull as the Southernmost House but we had a very friendly reception in a beautifull hotel lobby (complimentary fresh ice cold lemonade available throughout the day), the room was nice but not very modern and very quiet although the hotel is located on the very busy Duvalstreet and our stay coincided with spring break. Spring breakers returning late at night made some noise inside the hotel but I think that's al in the game when you go to Key west on spring break. On the rooftop terrace/bar you have a stunning view of the sun set. Al points of interest in Key West are within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything”
Reviews.Author: Ellen B
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during the Poker Run when there were thousands of motorcycles. Our room was on the 5th floor facing Duval St and while we could not hear people, we did hear the motorcycles which was not unexpected. The room was small but beautiful. Bed was comfortable, room was clean, check inn was relatively quick. Parking for our 2 motorcycles did cost us $20/day which I thought was excessive. They also charged my credit card before I even stayed there which surprised me. Then when I went to check out and pay for parking, they almost charged my card again for the 2 night stay. It is within walking distance of most everything. Hotel looks very nice from the outside.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: darlasee
Reviews.Content: What can I say... for my husband and me the LaConcha has it all! With old-world charm, location, location, location and a simply amazing staff there is no other place we would rather be. As frequent travelers, KW is our destination of choice and try to get back whenever we can. The LaConcha is warm and friendly, providing comfortable and clean accommodations right in the heart of old town. Phil always greets us with a fond welcome back. Desiree at the front-desk could not be more helpful. Josh Horton is the go to person for future reservations and Frank Coyle is their fantastic concierge with a personal connection to the pulse of the city. There are so many fabulous excursions, on both water and land, so go see Frank! Cannot wait to be back again at Fantasy Fest. See you then! Darlene & Mike

Reviews.Title: “Great Sunset on rooftop @ bar”
Reviews.Author: Phissie
Reviews.Content: We were in Keys in June and made it to roof bar for Sunset a couple of times. Get there early for outside table! Just enjoy view!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware ! Dishonest! No professionalism!”
Reviews.Author: 1savvygirl
Reviews.Content: Lock up your valuables we had an intrusion in our room without explanation. We filed a police report and never heard from GM only their insurance company stating too bad so sad. Last time staying there!

Reviews.Title: “BEST LOCATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: beachbaby1981
Reviews.Content: Talk about right in the heart of Duval! Love visiting Key West and the closer I am to Duval Street, the better! Room was pricey but luckily the person I was with gets discounts becaue of work travel. Room was nice, didn't spend much time in there, just to sleep but this hotel is all about location, location, location!!!! I also highly recommend Old Town Manor, which is also right off Duval.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: theresagio
Reviews.Content: Staff was okay. not overly friendly. Room was clean. bathroom is very small. Location is great, close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “definitely retro, great location”
Reviews.Author: liarisnot
Reviews.Content: definitely a 'retro" hotel. you can smell it when you get into the room :) Ok it's an old hotel, but it's a historical hotel in key west. I like the retro style decoration, especially in the lobby, one of the more stylish lobby I have seen. Although, personally I prefer a newer hotel. I think because it's a historical building, there are restrictions on what the hotel can do to remodel the building... not 100% sure. But some of the things were definitely the hotel's fault tough. When I get into the room, the first thing I noticed were the glass on the window were crashed in couple of places. One of the cracked glass is in the lower corner and right where my 3-year-old likes to stay and look outside. Now this is pretty bad for a hotel room and dangerous. I was only there for 2 nights so I didn't bother asking for a new room just because of that. Just told my daughter to stay clear of the window and kept the blinds drawn most the time. The toilet flush also finishes with a very loud grinding sound when it tries to stop the water flow, like someone is trying to manually shut a rusty valve. The noise is enought o wake up my dauther in the middle of the night (it requires a loud sound to wake up a sleeping 3-year-old!). Other than the above 2 issues, I don't have too much to complain about the room considering the history of this hotel. Now the good part, the location. It's right in the middle of Duval street where everything happens. All the eatries, bars, etc are within walking distance. It costs money to park everywhere so just leave the car in the hotel and walk around. The hotel does charge $20 a day for parking but you are paying that anyway when you stay there. Also, as a platinum priority club member, I got free parking from the hotel. Being in this location also means it can get noisy during the evening when the party crowds return to their rooms and some of them can be pretty drunk and loud at 1am in the morning. I guess that goes with the location and not everyone minds that kind of thing. For travelers with no child and love to party, this is a great place to stay. Less so for family vacation but it's not too bad. Overall, I think it's a good hotel to stay in when visiting Key West, if the price doesn't get too expensive for your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; Mold in bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Pwmont714
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in great location! Walking distance to shops, restaurants and bars! However, there was an alarming amount of black mold in the bathroom. The mold was growing on the air vents...even better; especially for someone with allergies/asthma. We did mention this to thefeont desk and were told they were sold out and there was nothing they could do. We motioned this again when we checked out and we received, "Oh, sorry about that", as the response. All the rooms may not be like this, but just a warning.

Reviews.Title: “loved it-would go back again-great room-excellant location”
Reviews.Author: larry r
Reviews.Content: The front desk personell,especially Deiree,were fantastic.The bar staff were the BEST.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - will definitely be a repeat guest there”
Reviews.Author: Scooterc1
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! The ambience is fantastic and really speaks of Key West. The pool is quaint and private. The staff is phenominal and the food was very good at all three meals. The bar/restaurant staff at Jack's (Jaime, Sophie, Brittany, etc.) are very friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “5-star location, 2-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: JonathanHamer
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent and the rooftop bar is great for the sunset view. Sadly, those are the only two things I can be complementary about, as it's not value for money, the rooms are disappointing and the pool was a big disappointment after great pools at the three hotels we'd stayed at on our way to Key West. As a Priority Club member I try to choose Holiday Inns and Crowne Plazas where I can, but I do regret choosing this one. Key West is a fabulous place to visit. My advice, find another hotel and enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel ... Only good thing is the location”
Reviews.Author: Hardik V
Reviews.Content: We booked La Concha purely for the location as it is located bang in the middle of Duval street , which is where all the action is. Having Crown Plaza name associated with it , we thought it would have a certain standard but we were disappointed. Its a very old hotel with small rooms , old furniture nd a very small bathroom. Bad light fixtures , smelly carpets do no good to your experience of staying in Key West. Upside - Location - Their rooftop bar is excellent for viewing the sunset Downside - Pretty much everything else is a disappointment

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: tattoolawyer
Reviews.Content: Location, Location Location... Right in the middle of everything!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in the heart of Key West”
Reviews.Author: TooLittleTime65
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd stay at the Crowne Plaza La Concha in Key West. In between these stays I had chosen a resort hotel on the other side of the island and found I needed transportation every time I wanted to hit Duval Street or Mallory Square. At La Concha you just walk out the front door. This trip, even though I am not a smoker, I wanted to stay in one of the balcony rooms that overlook Duval Street. The reception desk explained these are all smoking rooms but that I would not notice a smoke smell and I did not. Not even the slightest indication that a smoker had been in the room. The balcony was wonderful, in the early morning I would start my day off by having coffee and watching Duval come alive. And, in the evening after running around all day it was wonderful to come back to the room and sit on the balcony and watch the activity on the street until the wee hours. Also, once I closed the balcony doors I didn't notice the sounds outside - you could hear the sounds with the doors open but that was the whole reason for having a balcony room. The room itself was spacious and the service excellent. The best part is when you're tired, or want a change of clothes you just zip right back to the hotel. Take a quick shower and you're back out investigating all Key West has to offer. Mallory Square is a short walk down Duval and I found plenty of restaurants close by to my liking. There is also a grocery store about 2 blocks away if you want to pick up some items to snack on in the room. I'm a walker, a lover of old homes and a picture taker and Key West will not disappoint. The view from the light house is fantastic and you can see the island in all directions, also don't miss the Key West cemetery with usual epitaphs on many of the tomb stones.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location!”
Reviews.Author: travisngarrett
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a bit small, but the only time your in your room is to sleep! So, it's not an issue! It's also a great location at a half a block from Margarettaville and a few blocks from the sunset festival!

Reviews.Title: “Hot Hot Hot room.”
Reviews.Author: djeanne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from this hotel. The furniture needs updating, the walls need to be painted, and the curtains replaced or at least CLEANED. But those were the least of the problems with this hotel. Problem #1 is that it the AC doesn't operate properly. Call me crazy, but when I come in from walking around in 90-something degree heat, I want to cool off. I also like to sleep in a nice, cool room. The AC would not go below 73, though it seems hotter than that. I had to take three showers a day. Also, at the restaurant/bar downstairs, it was hot as well. There were several ceiling fans, but none of them were on. At least they may have circulated the air a bit. I asked a bartender if they were broken and he said no, and he would ask them to be turned on. Well, they never were. Finally, he told me that they had "blown a fuse", and that's why they never were turned on. Well, it doesn't take much time or money to change a fuse, so why didn't they do it? Next day, I noticed they still were not on. Guess the fuse still wasn't changed. Or maybe they were just trying to save money - at the expense of their paying guests' comfort. Go figure.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: TomFromATL
Reviews.Content: Hwy 1 ends at the back door for a reason. No need to look farther. This hotel is in the middle of everything! Located in the heart of Duval Street nothing is more than a short walk away. You can imagine times gone by in this comfortably renovated historic building. It also has the best sunset view in the city from the roof top bar. Nice helpful staff as well. You won't be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location... Great Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: vman09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Concha Aug 7th thru the 11th... We loved everything about the hotel. Loaction is perfect on Duval.. It was a short walk to either end of Duval. Starbucks in the lobby, tour desk in the lobby, 10min ride from airport ($8 per person).. The hotel was built in the 20's but has been kept up to date.. Rooms are small but well maintained.. Nice bathroom, comfortable bed, 42 flat screen...we were in room 653 overlooking Duval and had no problems with street noise day or night. Nice outdoor pool on the secdond floor with great pool bar. Hotel also has an observation area on the the rooftop (7th floor) that was great for watching the famous florida sunsets. They also had complimentary tea in the lobby every day.. We will stay here the next time we are in key west.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for nightlife but expensive and not much atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: AndrewDT
Reviews.Content: Great location right next to the nightlife at the north end of Duval Street near all the bars and Sloppy Joes It is one of the biggest hotels in the area but lacks atmosphere- seems to be poular with families and groups of young men and women The roof pool has great views over Key West and it was a good place for getting some sun The rooms were good but quite dark althought we did not spend much time in them and the sleep was good with no noise There was a good large carpark for our hire car The restaurant was average and the service was a bit slow so we did not spend much time there- great location but one of the most expensive hotels in keywest and there are better value places- so you are paying a premium for the location They did have inroom safes which was reassuring

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but the management and staff was absolute crap.”
Reviews.Author: Girlygurl1033
Reviews.Content: Don't stay at the Crowne plaza in key west if you want to sleep at all. They put our room in between two bachelorette parties with atleast 20 girls who kept us up during all hours of the day into the wee hours of the morning. VULGAR LANGUAGE, HALF NAKED PEOPLE KNOCKING ON YOUR DOOR,SLAMMING DOORS,SCREAMING,LOUD MUSIC. the management did nothing to accommodate us in anyway and we found out the last day during check out that the loud parties should have been removed after three complaints. We paid almost a $1,000 to stay there and in return we got ZERO SLEEP AND NO APOLOGY. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!! They only care about the money!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but expensive and terribly noisy”
Reviews.Author: Po216
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LaConcha for a wedding, it being on Duval St. and right in the middle of the action of the area. The location was wonderful, but the price was a bit steep. My room was very small, and there was a bullet-hole in my window. The worst part of the hotel was that it was very noisy. Toliets flushing could be heard a little too clearly during my stay and keeping the bathroom door closed did only a little. I could hear other people's conversations as well. It was bad enough that the hotel offered complimentary earplugs. What it boiled down to was that I slept horribly during the stay. The staff was very helpful with directions, and friendly as well. That nearly made up for the entire experience. The pool was alright, but very small and the bartender left in the middle of the afternoon. The bar at the top was nice, as was the view of the rest of the island, especially the sunset. The wedding reception was also at the top of the hotel, and outside of being skipped for my salad, everything was nice and put together great. I found out afterward that it was on a historical registry, so there will be no improvements done to the building itself. If you don't mind staying up a lot of the night, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Location rules!”
Reviews.Author: jeaniegirl
Reviews.Content: Elevator was broken. Staff was friendly. Pool bar closed ridiculously early and was not open during stated hours.

Reviews.Title: “Total ghost package”
Reviews.Author: Haole999
Reviews.Content: Lets begin by saying, my checkin process from romane the front desk supervisor, he was very professional and pleasent, well mannered and (despite the jerk in the past reviews) treated us like first class citizens. Upon approaching our room(which romane greetfully upgraded us to a balcony room), we stopped and met jeff, the very active and professional and well dressed bartender at the 2nd floor pool. He was by far so great!!!! You got to meet him. Now you may be wandering why we named our review, ''total ghost package". Our room was 251, on aug-2-11. Approx at 9 pm, my gf and I got back from the local duval st dinners and we were just going to rest for 30 minutes and head back for the nightlife. Well my gf at that time decided to take a nap on the far right side of the king side bed, while I was staying up to chat with our balcony neighbors. Before she had slept, she placed her two large locking gold loop earrings with a floss/toothpick thing on this large pillow on the far "left" side of the bed, so she would not knock over anything.(she dont move when she sleeps). Now after 30 minutes of letting my gf nap, while I was just hanging out, I DID notice earrings on the far left of her but not on a pillow but on the bed.
