When I woke her up, she did invorm me or lol yell at me about her missing earring, but we both said that we did not touch the earrings. My gf and I did find one earring on the far left side of the bed on the floor(facing the wall). But the goofy part was the missing 2nd earring...... Now we searched all pillows, blanlets, under the bed, the mattress, the luggage, this missing earring was nowhere to be found!!!! So we went to to frontdesk to ask for a flash light to look under the bed in detail(lol already took the lamp down) . But the flashlight helped nothing. 30 minutes after looking for this 2nd loop earring, my gf steps out to the balcony just to sit down with this surprising yet scared out of her mind look on her face, I proceeded to ask her where she found the loop, but I got no answers except, "i am really freaked out". She had told me that when she got up from checking the under bed once more, she proceeded to twist her upper body to her back, and when she turned her eyes down, she noticed that the big loop gold earring that we were searching for, was un fact locked in and shut on her back shorts belt loop. So while she was sleeping, and while I was outside, this spirit decided to play a joke on us, and hide our jewelery and watch us look for it. So when you goto 251, hide your jewelery, or be ready for a treat

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Zappcat
Reviews.Content: Disappointing for a Crowne Plaza. It's an old, historic building but still expected a higher standard. Slightly shabby. On the plus side, perfect location, in the heart of the action on Duval Street. Highest building on Key West (6 floors) with rooftop restaurant/bar great for sunset viewing. Main gripe was the pool area. Very small, very shallow pool. It was breezy on our visit so no umbrellas put out for shade or anyplace to get out of the sun. Key West is a party town but didn't appreciate the guests who brought their own sound system, placed it at the edge of the pool and blasted their music with no regard for other guests. The bar staff did nothing to stop them. Complained to Front Desk which shouldn't have even had to, and guy was not very receptive and tried to make excuses for them before reluctantly agreeing to handle it. I expected an instant "sorry, it'll be taken care of immediately." The guilty guests left a short time later before any staff took action, if in fact they intended to. Totally unacceptable situation. I think there are other much better places to stay, still close to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: meh130
Reviews.Content: Overall a good experience at a good price. Location is exceptional. Easy walking distance to most activities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location! We LOVED it and cant wait go back!!”
Reviews.Author: pvillar810
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights at La Concha Crowne Plaza and had an amazing time. If you are going to Key West to explore, eat good food and drink then this is the hotel for that. Its walking distance from EVERYTHING! right in the middle of Duval and up the block from Mallory Square we didnt walk farther then 5 minutes. The hotel itself is beautiful and has alot of history. To the people who complain about the rooms, you have no appreciation for buildings with this much history, not to mention it was remodeled so its in really great condition. The rooms are big and spacious and have an antique old Florida decor. The pool was fantastic with the bar next door, we had the Key West Lemonade drink special and it was sooo good! We didnt get a chance to eat at the restaurant but it was always busy and the menu looked yummy. We also rented scooters downstairs for only 60 dollars, what a deal. All the employees were very kind and we cannot wait to come back to La Concha!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: libxnyer
Reviews.Content: Best location on duval in the middle of everything. Beds were amazingly comfortable. Pool area was relaxing (small but there's so much other stuff to do in Key West!). The rooms are alittle old but clean. Will definitely stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: MrPaper
Reviews.Content: The La Concha is a historic hotel located on Duval Street. This is in the heart of the historic 'Old Town' of Key West. We parked our car at the hotel and walked everywhere we went from this central location. The hotel itself has a beautiful lobby which is a great place to just relax and cool off on warm days. Our room was spacious (I think we were upgraded to a larger than normal room) clean, and quiet. If I get a chance to return to Key West, I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “La concussion good location nice piece of history”
Reviews.Author: Judyray
Reviews.Content: My only compliant is that because of their going green initiative they will not drop the room temp below 73. We were pretty uncomfortable the temp made it hard to sleep. We requested a fan but they did not have any.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: dasali
Reviews.Content: I've been there for one night only. Compared to the hotels I've been in Miami Beach, this one wasn't much more expensive but way nicer. Clean, comfortable and on a nice location.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: RonRon0523
Reviews.Content: Location was a major reason for our choice of this hotel as everything is within a short walking distance. The charm of this hotel is its history and age. Our family had adjoining rooms. We had a problem with the airconditioning in one room and the hotel and the day manager were wonderfully accommodating. The concierge was very helpful in planning visits to attractions and restaurants. I would liked to have been able to pre-book the adjoining rooms. My husband and I will definately use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: HornJock
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been in a better location for all the activities on Duval Street. If we wanted to take a quick break from walking around, all we had to do was head up to our beautiful suite and relax. The staff was very friendly and accomodated our needs extremely efficiently (especially since we wound up getting married while on the trip!). One of the concierges, Barbara, was so helpful in finding a wedding service and florist for us on our rather "impromptu" plans. The nightly sunset gathering at The Top Lounge was a great time each night and the view of Key West from there is outstanding. We made new friends and wonderful memories each trip upstairs to the 7th floor party. Hopefully, we'll go back to the Crowne Plaza La Concha every year to celebrate our anniversary and enjoy the hospitality and luxury there. We just got back home and started planning our return trip already!

Reviews.Title: “Not that great for a Crown Plaza.”
Reviews.Author: 2plenty
Reviews.Content: It was clean and centrally located, but disappointing considering its a Crown Plaza. No fridge in room. You need to pay Xtra for that. The other issue was noise, lots of hallway noise. Definitely an older property so bear that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location on Duval St”
Reviews.Author: Carlos1966
Reviews.Content: I recently toured Florida on a Harley and part of the 'must do' was Key West. We wanted a good hotel close to the nightlife and boy did we find it in Key West. The Crowne Plaza is a good sized comfortable hotel smack in the middle of Duval St, yet we suffered from no noise coming off the streets. Reception was quick and welcoming. No fuss and served up a great room on the 5th floor overlooking the small, but reasonably sized pool. There's a Starbucks on the ground floor for all those important coffee moments, an excellent buffet breakfast and everything is a drunken crawl home from the many lively night spots in Key West. Overall I would thoroughly recommend the hotel to anyone who was looking for a central location hotel in Key West where comfort and quality is important to them.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Class Citizen”
Reviews.Author: BobHawk507
Reviews.Content: Requested early check in(45 minutes) was not honored and was given a room next to a very noisy icemaker. Hotel staff was very rude and indifferent to any questions. Advertised hot breakfast was not included. Supposedly this was under another package that we didn't book. I never saw seperate packages when booking online because break fast was important to me. Island wide power outage at 9:30 P.M. (not hotels fault) no phone or television for hours after restoration. The next morning many of the channels were still not operational. Every person that I encountered at the hotel was rude! Hotel never responded back about my situation. Obviously they don't care. In the room the carpet was dirty with a large red stain that looks like it came from sort of fruit punch drink. People were getting ice until 2:00 A.M. and started again at 6:00 A.M. Try and sleep thru that!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding at La Concha...excellent idea!”
Reviews.Author: lesleetarabay
Reviews.Content: We are from Austin, TX but we just had our destination wedding at La Concha on July 9, 2011. We had a fantastic room, a fantastic rate, and fantastic wedding all in this historic hotel. (Even a couple of ghosty things too). Jaime handled the rooms and did a fabulous job with getting us and 70 out of town guests situated. Kerry handled the event planning which was absolutely flawless. He did everything we ask and more. The wedding site and reception room were perfect. The food was excellent. The manager of the hotel even stopped in to say hello and to thank us for having our wedding there. Wow! I was impressed by this. The sunset cooperated and the wedding and reception went off without a hitch. Thank you to La Concha for making our wedding day an experience to remember. We will see you next year for our anniversary. Already making

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: TJO422
Reviews.Content: We got into Key West a day early & decided to stay in town before our weekend at Casa Marina. The rooms at La Concha are very small, and the walls are VERY THIN!! You can hear everytime somebody else runs the water or flushes a toilet. The service in the restaurant downstairs was not very good either. I think I'd try another place before I stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: britgirl26
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short vacation with my young adult daughter. As you enter the lobby of this hotel you get a real sense of old Key West. Palm fronds and leather lounge sofas give it a truly relaxed feel. The building has stood for many years but has tried to adapt to modern times with an air conditioning system which creates a lot of noise in some of the rooms- particularly those overlooking the parking area at the back. The staff were very helpful in finding us a room to move to in a quieter location (along the main side entrance) As the southernmost Starbucks is located just next door, we were content to purchase oatmeal and coffee to start our day from there and then ate it in the hotel foyer. Definately visit Hemingway's house and stroll by the marina, where there are some good restaurants overlooking the water. We would stay at this hotel on a return visit - best location in Key West. Note that the local beaches are rocky -we did find the State Park beach to be the best one.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location!”
Reviews.Author: marianagri
Reviews.Content: The hotel it self was ok, service was good and everything was clean. The only downside was that the hotel is old. Location was great too right in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Key Wesy”
Reviews.Author: Rschrader
Reviews.Content: The La Concha is the the tallest building in key west and offers The Top bar on the roof which is great for sunsets. The hotel its self is extremely old but everything is nicely updated. The rooms are not the biggest but are quite large to key west standards. It nicely located right on Duval St which is the main drag in Key West so its a short walk a all sorts of dining, shopping, attractions and bars. The Restaurant was good and the pool was nice. All and all a great place to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “luxury in key west”
Reviews.Author: tonyXchurch
Reviews.Content: we used priority club points for our stay here and we expected a basic type room as this hotel like many hotels in key west are expensive.we had a very pleasant surprise when joshua on the front desk upgraded us to a suite on the top floor with great views of key west.you can go up to the roof terrace in the evening for a drink and take in the sunsets.the hotels position is ideal for seeing everything key west has to offer on foot.GREAT HOTEL STAY HERE IF YOU CAN ON YOUR VISIT TO KEY WEST

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you ask for what you need”
Reviews.Author: Russ2658
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great location, right in the middle of Duval Street (some noisy late night hall converstaions from returning revelers). The roof top bar has the most fantastic view. That said, the room they gave us at first (requested an King) was small, barely enough room for the bed (and I am not convinced it was king) and right across from the elevator (my frequent guest profile specifically states that I want away from the elevator). After two trips to the front desk to complain, we were moved to a larger room. There did not appear to be much effort to clean the pool area (sloppy guests left beer cans, food waste, and towels laying around). The maids were not to fastidious either. All in all, if we go back to KW, we'll try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: TiffP-ATL
Reviews.Content: Great Location on Duval Street. Staff was able to accomodate us when I booked for the wrong weekend. Rooms were nice, comfortable. Pool had a bar and cafe. Rooftop bar/sunset viewing is best in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for nightlife”
Reviews.Author: stallion114
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for bar and nightlife this is the spot. The hotel is extremely old as is most of key west. The building does show its age in certain aspects the actual building is a historic gem. This was my first trip to key west and I was expecting more beach, but there is only one part of the island that has one which is the opposite side of the island as la concha. If you are looking for a beach to entertain the kids you might want to check out the other side of the island. The beach is still a 15 minute walk from the hotel if you want to check it out anyway. The rooms were extremely spacious and I expected.much smaller. I had an exec king reserved which may of bumped up the size some. Staff was ok but they did nothing to wow me, or even make me take notice of them, but they didn't do anything negative either. If you were flying into Miami and renting a car do yourself a favor and rent 2 one ways. once you are on the island you will not need your car pretty much everything is walkable, and worst case take a cab as they will probably be less than the parking. Also FL is the only state I onow of that does not charge extra for one way rentals if rented and returned in the same state. (other states charge up to 10 times the charge if you return to a different location) If I came back to key west I would definitely consider staying here again, although a waterfront hotel would have been nice for the views. The one major highlight of this hotel is the rooftop bar which has the best views of the famous key west sunsets. I can assure you it will be packed everyday so if you prefer to have a table over sitting get there early.

Reviews.Title: “Should have stayed at the Days Inn!”
Reviews.Author: LiiSAx
Reviews.Content: First let me start off by saying that this is my SECOND time staying at the La Concha & it will also be my LAST. Upon checking in my friends and I were offered an upgraded room (priority reward members). The upgraded room was unavailable so we went to lunch and came back later to check inâ€¦which is no big deal. The second we walked into our room we knew something was not right, first of all it was hotter INSIDE the room than it was OUTSIDE on Duval street. The room also had a light bulb in the bathroom that acted like it was about to explode in your face, a broken toilet seat, that in order to use the facilities you had to just remove the lid and sit it on the ground at your feet, and several cracks/holes in the window. It took us 2 phone calls and about an hour and a half to finally get an engineer to our room to deal with the AC issuesâ€¦the first one was a no show. So the engineer comes, says its a thermostat issue, puts a new thermostat on the wall, and leaves. At this point we just dealt with the heat, got ready, and left the room for the night thinking we would come back to a cool room. NEGATIVE. Upon returning to the room around midnight that night the room was just as hot as it was when we checked in. Management didnâ€™t have much to say about the issue, we were offered a room switch but it already being so late we decided to just wait till morning. After a sleepless, and sweaty night, the next morning we switched rooms. Management was not sympathetic in the least and AGAIN had very little to say. We decided we would just start our vacation over with a clean slate and pretend the night before never happened; we received a standard room with a pool view at the very end of the hall. The air worked just fine in this room however there was a constant noise that sounded like a FREIGHT TRAIN was going to drive straight through our wall. Never figured out what it was, just decided to deal with it for the remaining 3 days of our trip. FUNNY but NOT so funny story, we met a group of gentlemen who were booked DIRECTLY into our first room at the pool pretty much immediately after we vacated the room. Lets just say they were not happy to learn that they had been put in a room having all these issues. They had yet to spend more than a few minutes in the room having dropped their bags off and going straight to the pool, but did say they noticed the holes in the window and the soon to explode light bulb. Another minor but not so minor issue: Trying to get a hold of housekeeping/front desk/ concierge. I recommend not even bothering trying to call any of those locations and just call the â€œmanager on dutyâ€� anytime you may need something. EVERYTIME we would try to call ANYTHING but the â€œmanager on dutyâ€� there would be no answer. The paper-thin walls, and loud noise from Duval Street that everyone else complains about, does not bother me in the least. Having stayed in this hotel before I knew all about that. What bothers me is that we could have saved HUNDREDS of dollars, stayed at the Days Inn, and received the same quality in not only service but also accommodations. Now to end this on the ONLY positive thing there is about this hellhole. The bellman Phil is AMAZING. He was the only employee that showed us any kind of sympathy. One would expect some sort of sympathy/remorse from a manager but no we received ours from the bellman. Not only was he very kind and understanding but he also pointed us in the direction of a few places in Key West that we NEVER would have found on our own. He pretty much SAVED our vacation, so THANKS PHIL!!

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: HappyDays55403
Reviews.Content: From arriving at the hotel to when we "had to leave to catch our flight home" our stay at the Crowne Plaza was top notch -- the staff members were both welcoming and efficient. With so much to see and do in Key West, the suggestions of sightseeing and events to take in are now simply wonderful memories. We enjoyed both relaxing around the pool, room service and a fabulous breakfast buffet. Before leaving for the airport to go back home, we sat in the great lobby area, being so comfortable and impressed with the decor, quality and ultra comfort in the chairs and sofas, spaciousness, etc. that next time around, taking time to read a book or the newspaper will be enjoyed in that great comfortable lobby surroundings. Amazing. Only thing I can think of that I enjoyed but also laughed about to myself was the elevators..... they were historic in a sense and at the same time, I loved riding in them.

Reviews.Title: “All great but the pool.”
Reviews.Author: Cay0Hues0
Reviews.Content: When visiting Key West, we always stay at La Concha. We love everything about the hotel, the staff, cleanliness, service, restaurant, parking, etc. This year though, we experienced a big disappointment. The pool was in need of big service. The water was cloudy and the inside walls had a green substance adhered to them. I do not know if this was mold or mildew, but it was really bad. We reported this on Friday, but when we left on Sunday nothing had been done. I'm sure this pool has not been thoroughly cleaned in a long time. We love your hotel and always recommend it to our friends, so I hope you can do something about this. Thank you, Orquidea Barouh

Reviews.Title: “4:th time at this fantastic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pyramidKungsbacka
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel very good located at Duval street. Very nice rooms and great staff. Will be back again... /Fredrik

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room was barely average”
Reviews.Author: KeriMiller
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location of this hotel was perfect...very close to ALL of the action!! The staff was great, especially Wayne-he gave us a private tour of the bar at the top on our last night because we were unable to get up there during normal business hours!! He went above and beyond the call of duty, and even shared some of the history of the hotel with us, what a great asset for the hotel!! On the other hand, our room was small, and the beds were insanely small--I didn't realize that anyplace still has double beds in their hotel! The walls were pretty thin, but once I fell asleep that didn't bother me at all. I loved the Lavender spray they left to spray the pillows with, and the bedding itself was pretty nice. Next time I won't take the kids so we can have more room to strech out!! Take note...parking is $20 a day!!

Reviews.Title: “Reviews are correct, but some unfair”
Reviews.Author: psopsic
Reviews.Content: You can not beat the location of this hotel! Close to everything you would want to do in Key West, and the staff is very professional. Although the rooms are dated they are clean and comfortable. Pool area is small, but in Key West the last thing I would want to do is spend the day at the hotel pool. Noise is an issue, but remember where you are! Noisy chickens and a party atmosphere are part of what makes this place so charming. I would assume that the plumbing noises could be easily solved in other locations, but this is a 90 year old hotel that happens to be a historical landmark. I have stayed in numerous Crowne Plaza hotels. This will not compete with the amenities of a newer "state of the art" hotel. I would argue that no "state of the art" facility can compete with the charm and history of this hotel. See everything you can while in Key West. Renting bicycles and touring around is a blast. If your an early riser, with a partner who likes to sleep in- I highly recommend a walk to The Cuban Coffee Queen for a breakfast sandwich and the early morning happy hour at Schooner Wharf. Start a little conversation with the locals there and I guarantee you will go home with great stories!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to sat while in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Tropical_Gangster
Reviews.Content: Second year in a row staying at the Crowne Plaza. This is a great hotel. If you want to be right downtown, this is the place. I was concerned that, being right on Duval might be noisey, but not the case. The rooms are very quiet. We had a king room facing the pool. Not huge but big enough. The bathrooms are good size, updated and clean. The hotel staff is very friendly and the pool is a great place to relax (bar service).

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: stairtool1
Reviews.Content: from the minute we checked in, we felt the customer service was truely superior to that of what other reviews said. Pri. club member was given a upgraded room without asking .Even the bellmen were very helpful and infomative. there sugestions were spot on. This Hotel has the perfect location for shops restaurants beach &water excursions. My wife and I can't wait to return to this Slice of Paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: samiam2424
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a must needed 5 day getaway. The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful suggesting things to do around town. The location was EXCELLENT. No need for a car as everything we wanted to see was within a short walk. The Top Bar was a great place to see the amazing sunsets. One complaint was that our room was a bit cramped and the bathroom was tiny. Other than that no complaints. The facilities were clean. Some great things to see: the Barefoot Billy's jet ski tour around the island was a blast. Snorkeling on the coral reefs was pretty amazing as well. Night life suggestions: Hog's Breath Saloon has great raw bar, Lazy Gecko is the Southernmost Red Sox Nation (great for Bostonian's), the Green Parrot is great for live bands and drink deals. Must sees: Sloppy Joe's, Irish Kevin's, Mallory Square Sunset Celebration, Higg's Beach vs. Smather's Beach, Hemingway House, Key West Cemetery, Southernmost Point, Little White House, and of course, all of Duval Street!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: barbarapowers
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in a historic and haunted location with easy access to Duval and other attractions, the Crowne Plaza La Concha is a great location. Room service breakfast (Norweigan Eggs Benedict) was very good. Lobby and pool area were charming. That's IT on the pros for staying at this location. Cons: 1. The rooms are desperately in need of a complete gutting and renovating. My room had a mold issue in the vents and on the bathroom tile which they tried to hide with grout paint. The tub was filled with grit at the bottom and the whole place was in bad need of a good dusting. 2. The beds wobbled and creaked every time you turned over in them. A more secure frame would have helped. 3. Phone did not work for most of the time that I was there and when it did, the extensions did not work. Ended up having to call the operator when I needed something in order to be connected to the appropriate service. 4. Noise issues. If the chugging, musty air conditioner did not keep you up, then the chickens (not the hotel's fault) or the neighbors in the next room did. I knew when my neighbors went to the bathroom and the flushing of toilets would wake the dead. And yes, I did use those little earplugs that the hotel provided when I slept. 5. Some of the staff were very gruff on the phone, but in person they were nice (had problems with my reservation before coming). Sensitivity training might be in order. 6. Bar on top of hotel ran out of ingredients for basic mixed drinks before 7pm. Shame! 7. Elevator to bar on top of hotel broke down with people inside it (thank God I wasn't one of them!) This hotel if given a good renovation could be a first-class location once again. But in my opinion, it was overpriced for what I had to put up with.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for brother's wedding. At check in there was a mix up with the payment of our room. The next day housekeeping never came the whole day even though they were at the next door room when we left for the day. When we came back that evening around 10pm the breakfast tray was still there. I called them to get it and to get clean towels. The next morning the breakfast tray was still in the hallway. Plus - the phone didn't work. Someone would call your room but when you answer there was no one there. AND the air-conditioning leaked from the ceiling. Had to have them come twice to fix it. I will not be coming back! Way to much $$ for what I got in return which wasn't much!

Reviews.Title: “paper thin walls -- you can hear EVERYTHING in the neighboring rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelingcoupleMN
Reviews.Content: overall disappointing experience -- great location and nice lobby, but the rooms are a bit shabby. the consierge was very helpful. the major criticism -- and it's a BIG deal -- is that the rooms have paper thin walls. We could easily hear the TV and phone conversations of our "next door neighbors". My wife was awakened at 1:30am by the sounds of the amorous couple next door. would not stay here again, nor would I recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “The shame if the Crowne plaza brand”
Reviews.Author: Dknighten
Reviews.Content: I stay at Crowne plaza every chance I get. The main reason is the tempurpedic beds. I usually pay around $80 or so. I go to key west regularly & stay at Spanish gardens, a basic hotel at a fair price. This trip I decided to treat myself to a really nice hotel. I paid $300 a night for 4 nights. I've been all over the world & never paid this much so my expectations were very high. I got into key west from a 12 hour drive. My back was very sore & I was licking my chops thinking about good that tempurpedic bed was going to feel. I was so disappointed This is the only Crowne plaza I've seen without them. In fact the bed was an old broken down spring mattress. The room was large but a complete dump. This hotel needed a full gut renovation probably 25 years ago. The carpet was old & torn at the edges The woodwork that should have been stained was painted brown instead hoping you won't notice. The bathroom had a window in the shower I couldn't see out of it because they had an old shower curtain nailed up over it the tile in the bathroom was broken I know it's an old building but the condition was shameful. If I worked for Crowne plaza company I would make it my mission to pull the brand name from this hotel. Oh & the elevator. I am 5 ft 4. I weight 150 lbs. I had to turn sideways to get in the elevator. If I was any bigger I don't think I could have gotten in it at all

Reviews.Title: “HiddenGem”
Reviews.Author: Ker68
Reviews.Content: We have been married in Key West and haved traveled there many times but never knew about this hidden gem. It was wonderful and location was the best. Wish the price had been a tad lower but all in all we found a wonderful hidden property. Loved it

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Benshay
Reviews.Content: Perfect location on duval. We loved everything and definitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “close to Sloppy joes!”
Reviews.Author: Elinasoderberg
Reviews.Content: A very beautiful hotel with a grand lobby with a caribbean touch,a gorgeous rooftop to watch the sunset and a location at the most popular street, duval street.Me and my family enjoyed the visit without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Handicapped not welcome here”
Reviews.Author: gskydiver
Reviews.Content: I am a paralyzed veteran confined to a wheelchair. I specified on my reservation that I needed a "handicapped" room with a handicapped "roll in" shower. After waiting an hour to for my turn at the reservation desk, I was given an "upgraded" room. The room was not wheelchair accessible! I could not get the wheelchair through the bathroom door. I returned to the desk and waited another 45 minutes. The reservation clerk informed me, "We don't pay any attention to requests for wheelchair accessible rooms. People request them just to get the king size bed." I finally received a handicapped room with a bath tub not a roll in shower. Also, I had requested a seperate, but close by, room for my caregiver. She was giving a room on another floor at the other end of the building. The employees need handicapped sensitivity training. They should spend a day in a wheelchair!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaSt_Travellers
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days at La Concha in the old (original) part of the building which overlooks Duval Street. Room was small, with a tiny bathroom and virtually no wardrobe space... very unusual for a US hotel ! The walls were also very thin... you could hear everything going on in the rooms around you. Having said that, the bed and pillows were very comfortable and (thanks to a few boozy Key West nights), we generally slept very well and heard no street noise whatsoever. Carpets and decor were tired looking and the hotel feels like it needs a good refresh... although cleaning staff kept room clean and loads of fresh towels were left every day. The pool area wasn't bad and the top floor bar is the best place to see the legendary Key West sunsets (although this bar seems to be a very under-used asset, with poor furnishing, plastic glasses and relatively short opening times). There is a very small fitness room (a treadmill and cross trainer), but if you are after some exercise I'd recommend heading out of the hotel for an early morning run... the flatness of Key West makes it an excellent running ground ! Hotel has a great central location on Duval Street, with a very handy (but busy) Starbucks on the ground floor. Would I stay here again ? Yes for loacation and top floor bar alone... but there are undoubtedly many other smaller and nicer places around.

Reviews.Title: “KWLC- Great stay, Great location”
Reviews.Author: ddocker
Reviews.Content: Went to KW for the first time with some friends, both of us were using PC points for our stay. No problems getting an upgrade to a balcony room but we both called a head to put a request in. What a great spot on Duval to sit and people watch and catch some rays. We had the two rooms on the Duval/Fleming corner (261,263) so got great sun from 8am to 4pm, just in time to hit happy hour. Property has taken a beating on TA regarding the service level, we did not encounter any issues although we did not use many of the services offered. Front desk was awesome at check in (Desiree) and upon departure. No car/ no worries, this location is awesome and walkable to everything. Closer to the Bight than Southernmost, but we had more fun in the Marina atmosphere anyhow. Beds/ water pressure/ plumbing were all very good during our stay. As stated in another review, small gripe with going to the rooftop for sunset and having the area closed due to a wedding that was attended by 12 people. Really? Went back next day for a very nice sunset, view is very cool. Stay thirsty my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review - Loved the atmosphere but service was mixed”
Reviews.Author: cwberg
Reviews.Content: The Crown Plaza is right in the heart of Key West on Duval so you can walk most places. The rooms are decorated beautifully and very warm, as is the extremely lovely lobby area. We were put on the sixth (top) floor in a room with deteriorating air condition. The first guy who came up said the hotel "was old" so there wasn't much they could do. The next day we were moved by the very accommodating Carmen (believe she was the manager) who was extremely pleasant and helpful. We were excited to go up to the rooftop bar and see the sunset, but upon our arrival we were greeted by a rude bartender who told us there was a wedding going on up there so most of it was off limits. There was still an area to watch the sun set, but after that greeting we left to go down to Mallory Point. The first room we had was right on Duvall, which would have been difficult if we didn't travel with a white noise machine. Still, there was something about this hotel that I would return to....

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't my first trip, won't be my last”
Reviews.Author: Huggy_in_VA
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the La Concha on several trips to Key West. I like the notion of staying at THE classic hotel destination on Duval St. It's neither the cheapest place, nor the fanciest, but I've always enjoyed my stay. I usually visit in the off season during the week, so I don't pay the highest rates. On this trip, I received an unasked for upgrade to a large room on a corner with a balcony overlooking Duval. The room was quite clean with excellent bedding. The furniture, some of which was probably antique, was well maintained but showed some signs of being in a hotel at a vacation destination. The bathroom most clearly reflected the age of this part of the hotel, with a stylish pedestal sink and large tub/shower. More counter space for travel stuff would have been nice. All of the electrical/mechanical aspects of the room -- hot water, a/c, TV, radio -- worked well. The room's numerous windows had great curtains equipped with clips that allowed me to block out virtually all light leakage -- an essential point when sleeping after a late night. I arrived early in the day, well before check-in time. The staff accepted my bags and stored them while I wandered Duval. They called when my room was ready. They were very helpful with taxis, restaurant recommendations, directions, and suggestions for other activities. The sunset view from the roof of the hotel is an essential place to visit when in Key West. Overall, I had a very good experience. Some people are put off by the age of the place (particularly the elevators), but I've always had a clean, quiet room right in the middle of Duval Street, Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mwalls007
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is nice. Service is very slow. On the third evening of our stay, our roof started leaking at 4am in the middle of the bed. I called down to ask for some help, a bucket and to be moved. The front desk gentleman said , "he could do nothing until 8am when the rest of the staff came in". He would however send up the security man with towels and a bucket. Well, We waited an hour using the ice bucket, dumping it every 5 minutes and finally the guys arrives, throws the towels into us, no bucket and hands us a breakfast certificate and walks away. Like I said service is lax. At 8am we go downstairs and ask if they have our new room ready, the girl at the front desk (shannon) had no idea what we were talking about. I was really upset by then and she did get us into another room around noon. I would not recommend this hotel. It is too bad because my experience at Crowne Plazas have been exceptional. Location is basically all you get. It is also very loud and smokey. Even on non-smoking floors. Pool is nice and decks are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: BreakfastkingHull
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for three nights. Great location on Duval Street. Near to the night life, but far enough away so that noise is not an issue Check in was quick and easy. We had a room on the second floor facing onto Duval Street. We experienced no problem with noise from outside during the night. The hotel is one of the oldest in Key West, but thelobby and room decor was in good condition and clean. The bed was nice and comfortable. There is a Starbucks on the ground floor which is open early and closes late. Car park at the hotel is busy, but we quickly found a place when we checked in. There is no need to use a car whilst in Key West as most things are within walking distance from the hotel. The hotel normally makes a daily charge for car parking, but is complimentary for priority club members (not sure if this is for all levels or just Platinum).

Reviews.Title: “Generic room but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Pharmer55
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean but other than that, nothing special. Linens, towels, amenities - nothing stood out. Hotel is older, so bathroom is small and no exhaust fan, so unfogging the mirror after a shower was challenging. For $300.00 a night, expected a lot more but this was really the only hotel I could book for the time and desired Duval St location. The desk clerk didn't even bother to ask how my stay was when I checked out. Very underwhelmed with the hotel, staff and amenities. The central location is the only thing this hotel really has going for it.

Reviews.Title: “No Rest”
Reviews.Author: hdurand802
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very unfriendly, did not give any information at to what comes with each stay. The area was very noisy, the hotel had people running, yelling, drinking, etc until 4am. The elevators were small and very slow. The hotel parking lot was like a can of sardines, You can't get in or out. Even if you reserved a parking spot with your stay. The bell hops were very greedy. We could not use that thing that you put your luggage on unless you hire a bell hop!!! There was nothing that I liked about this hotel. The worst part is that I payed over 250.00 per night. Will never go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on Duval”
Reviews.Author: Carolinascouple
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of nights, on points. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Rooms are average, but clean. We asked for a room on the backside of hotel, away from Duval noise, and were accomodated. Pool area is very nice, as is roof top bar. Enjoyed having a Starbuck's off of the main entrance. Concierge was very helpful with dinner reservations, etc. Lobby is historic and lovely, very welcoming. Can't beat location to all.

Reviews.Title: “way over priced, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: ondaroadalways
Reviews.Content: The only redeeming quality to this hotel is its location. The staff is only concerned about one thing...getting your money! They were rude and did not do one thing to go out of their way to help the guests. When a young couple walked to the front desk looking for a room, they were ignored for quite some time, then, when they realized the room was too expensive, they asked the clerk to recommend a different hotel. The clerk said "sorry, I can't help you" and walked away. I am a Holiday Inn Platinum member and this is the worst H.I. property I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: mybabymama
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend and absolutely loved it. Yes, it was a little pricey, but it was well worth it. Plus, we called around and everyone else downtown wanted even more money. They beat the competition by $70 bucks each night! It is in a great location, everything is within walking distance. Staff was super friendly, the rooms were very clean, and the food was great in their restaurant. If you take into consideration that this is a tourist town, their prices for food and cocktails were the same as anywhere else. We can't wait to go back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Partying in paradise”
Reviews.Author: yohoho888
Reviews.Content: We were in kw for the weekend and stayed at the la concha our room was cozy and had a real kw charm to it their is a parking fee but if u sign up to be a priority club member its discounted. Parking is a premium in kw so 15 bucks for in and out privileges is a good deal the front desk staff was wonderful I was greeted by Desiree at the front desk it was our first time staying here so she explained what the hotel had to offer. Got us a nice upgraded room and we were escorted their by the bellman Phil hands down best staff iv ever worked with. Their were some issues at the check out time with our bill but Nick and Jamie were attentive and took care of every thing write away they made me feel like I was their most important guest I love this hotel. This is the place to be!!

Reviews.Title: “great location, but very pricey.”
Reviews.Author: maolson
Reviews.Content: our room was very small. It was very noisy. You could hear everything going on in the hall and outside. The restaurant was way overpriced. And the cocktails were very spendy. The rooftop was a nice place to watch the sunset. So didn't spend alot of time at the motel. And it was $15.00 a day to park.

Reviews.Title: “What we expected”
Reviews.Author: OHTransplant3
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the La Concha from Dec 5th-8th. Pros: Wasn't crowded. Good Location. Clean. Staff was friendly. Nice pool (didn't get to use it though since we were there on the coldest days of the year). Very comfortable bed. Starbucks was connected to the hotel. Viewing deck. Cons: We feel that it was a little pricey for what you get. The restaurant could be better for the prices but the food wasn't horrible. Key West in general: We had a great time on the sunset cruise offered by Fury. I think it was $40 a person and it was worth every penny. All the champagne, beer, wine and appetizers for no extra cost. The band was really good and tried to get people on the dance deck. The ghost tour connected to the hotel is a waste. We were pretty hyped about it but when we got there, it was actually very silly. I'm into that sort of thing and have been on multiple ghost tours / hunts and this is definitely just a money maker. Which is hard to believe because Key West has such great history. The shipwreck museum was pretty cool. Bigger than it seemed from the outside. The hotel has a scooter rental tent right in the parking lot and the attendant was really informative. I would recommend EVERYONE rents a scooter for at least one day. It's a great way to get around and is actually quite fun. I wouldn't ride one around town at home but when in Rome... We went to a few restaurants and bars but you should definitely stop in at Bahama Bob's. It's small and not overly crowded but serve great drinks and the bartender was really nice and helpful. It was nice to experience Key West but It's a huge tourist trap. I imagine at one point it wasn't so commercial. Then again, we stayed near Duvall St.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: 1travelgirl
Reviews.Content: I had Priority Club points for a couple free nights so that is the reason we chose this hotel. The hotel is a great location, just remember it's not waterfront but then again, not many are. It is only a couple blocks from the beautiful Key West waters. We had an average two bed room that faced the back of the hotel and we had a wonderful view of the cruise ships in port. The pool was not heated and a little cool. In January, the pool didn't have sun all day as it was shaded by the hotel. The pool wasn't crowded so it was easy to find a chair in the sun. There is a bar at the pool with $6 drinks that beats the $10 drinks on the rooftop sunset bar. Of course, this is average for Key West and the drinks were great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Unethical Starbucks”
Reviews.Author: lorrexr8
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in a great location, however the attached Starbucks Cafe does not do it justice by charging the Tourists (who are their main income) well over the top prices while charging the Locals half price for the same service and product. Shame on you Starbucks for this way of RIPPING OFF your main income. I would advise all people staying at Crowne Plaza to avoid the STARBUCKS at all costs. Rollo

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe hotel should be better”
Reviews.Author: ehmarcus
Reviews.Content: Some annoyances: Limited TV channels and NO CNN. Channel numbers don't match guide in room.. TV channels not shown on screen. Non-flushing toilet was promptly repaired. Faucet handles are so close to a wide mirror frame that one can't hold them from the top. Fitness room is minimal. Pipe in ceiling leaked flooded room and required a bucket under the leak. Location is excellent. Staff is helpful, Decor is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great view- Good location”
Reviews.Author: lab12345
Reviews.Content: Not "resort luxurious" but certainly very clean and really great location. Good place to watch the sunset from the top. Our stay was quiet and there is a great little pool inside the hotel complex that is private and a good place to relax. There is a Starbucks downstairs in the lobby and a decent restaurant that has a breakfast buffett ($18)

Reviews.Title: “BETTER NOW than ever”
Reviews.Author: twogo20
Reviews.Content: I understand there was a management change not too long ago. It shows! Especially in the restaurant...what terrific menu and executed beautifully. Who would have thought "hogfish" is worth a rave? Freshest seafood ever and service professional yet friendly. Rooms are lovely,bathrooms small but done nicely. Modern touches with a vintage flavor. LOVE it. OUTSTANDING staff.

Reviews.Title: “Jack's restaurant a good choice!!”
Reviews.Author: barbarakays
Reviews.Content: We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant each of our three mornings. The buffet items were delicious. Hot items were hot and tasty. The fresh squeezed orange juice was a treat. We enjoyed the smoked salmon and so many condiments. Our servers were pleasant, friendly and attentive. It was a pleasure to eat in your restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Billsmith1234
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were fortunate enough to stay at the la concha for eight days and our stay was incredible. The entire staff went out if their way to make us feel like family. The hotel bar and rsstaurant is a must stop place if you are in key west. The bartender Scott made our dinners there quite the experience, every bar should be fortunate enough to have this caliber of personal service. the food was superb and the service and entertainment even better. If you are in key west stop in and see Scott and the rest of the superb staff Our room was what every hotel should strive for from the smallest detail up we were so well taken care of with every request handled immediately. Our stay ended as it began with a warm smile from Shannon at the front desk and we left hoping to return quickly. Thank you la concha you are the best.

Reviews.Title: “wow what a great time/great service”
Reviews.Author: macdad14
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed 4 nites at the Crowne Plaza LaConcha for the New Year and it couldn't have spent at better hotel .Service,service and more service from Phil(bellman) greeting you with his smile and remembering your name,the lady at the reception desk who upgraded our room (platinum club) to the best bartender on Duval street Fred.The entire staff couldn't have worked any harder to make this one of our most enjoyable stay . What a location right on Duval street where it all happens,dining,nightlife and shopping all within walking distance.It can get a little noisy but who comes to Key West for quiet. We recommend to everyone to try sunset here,what a view. We will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Grand old lady in a beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: MsLaurie
Reviews.Content: I like older hotels because they have character. And this one is loaded with it -- courtesy of Ernest Hemingway and Tennessee Williams! Yes, the rooms are small, but that's not unusual for an establishment of this vintage. The view from The Top -- the rooftop bar -- is exquisite. You can see the entire island from up there, sunsets included. Yes, the windows were dirty, so I couldn't commemorate the fabulous view I had from the sixth floor, Duval side. But hell, I did get to enjoy the view! The fitness center isn't great and they don't have a business center (free wi-fi instead), but how important is that when you travel to Key West? I loved being in a historic hotel in the center of Duval.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, overpriced and not customer focussed”
Reviews.Author: shenleey1
Reviews.Content: stayed in la concha for christmas and new year and checked out this morning, rooms dated, windows do not open and were very dirty. Had breakfast in restaurant this morning at 830am when it opened but food was not hot and staff very disorganised, had to change cutlery as it was not cleen also glass i lifted from buffet for my cranberry juice was dirty and had not been washed from previous day I stay in crowne plazahotels three days every week with my work and i rate this hotel as the worst i have stayed at

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: briankemmerer
Reviews.Content: August of 2010 I booked a room in Key West with Priority Club points at the Holiday Inn. At the end of October and a few days before my departure while booking rooms online for business trips I noticed that my reservation in Key West was gone. I contacted the Platinum Club service desk and they informed me that the hotel was no longer a member of the IC chain. â€œWHAT!!! When was I going to be notified? When I arrived and had no place to sleep?â€� I could not believe that Intercontinental would treat such a loyal customer like this and not honor the reservation. After many minutes and conversations with his manager the very helpful gentleman at the call center desk was able to obtain a room for me at the Crowne Plaza but not for the entire week because the hotel was booked solid the last three days of our trip. He also informed me that this was now the only hotel on the island that belonged to the group. I was incredibly angry that this could happen. The vacation that my wife and I had planned was being ruined. I would appreciate an explanation as to how this happened and why I was not notified. When we arrived at the Crowne Plaza in Key West the entire staff could not have been more pleasant and hospitable to my wife and me. On the day of check out my wife and I were going to have to impose and spend our last two nights (three days) in a friends room at a bed and breakfast at the other end of Duval Street. It was very inconvenient for our friends but they were willing to accommodate us for the two nights. What a horrendous way to spend a romantic weekend in Key West with two â€œHoliday Innâ€� homeless people sleeping on your couch at Papas Hideaway. On checkout day (Friday the 5th of November) I was greeted by Jamie Thigpen at the front desk and I explained my situation and asked if she had any cancellations. She had a cancellation and immediately reserved it for me. Unfortunately it was not a pointâ€™s room that was available. But Jamie spoke to her manager and arranged for me to use points for the room if I could get the points released. I phoned the Platinum Priority Club at the number printed on the back of my card and ask for points to be used for this room. I was not getting anywhere and it did not seem possible to have points pay for a room in this manner and so quickly. I was at a loss and Jamie witnessed my deteriorating attempt to make this work. Jamie then put out her hand and I gave her my cell phone. Jamie spoke to the person at the club line and talked to her manager and was handling the situation better than my attorney could have done it. After a few minutes she returned my cellular phone and informed me that everything is complete and the points were transferred. Our vacation was saved and it turned out to be a lot of fun thanks to the Crowne Plaza in Key West and their outstanding management and team members. The Crowne Plaza also upgraded our room and I truly felt like a Platinum Member. My wife and I personally thank the entire staff and management at the Crowne Plaza Key West-La Concha and special thanks goes out to Jamie Thigpen who went above and beyond and was truly concerned and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: afd116
Reviews.Content: Sitting in our hotel room, room 441, just getting ready to leave to go back home to the snow and cold (not ready, at all). We have had the most wonderful stay here at La Concha!!! We were given a room upgrade and couldn't have been more pleased!!!! Our room is a corner suite overlooking Duvall Street. The room is nicely appointed and it is very clean. We have enjoyed the refrigerator and views!!! The sunset from the roof has been wonderful. If I had to pick one thing I have enjoyed the most, it would be the staff. Courteous, kind, and they went out of their way to always great us as we came back from our day. The pool area is a nice little hide-a-way and a true hidden gem. We have decided we don't need to look anywhere else to stay when we're down here. Great room, great value and location, location, location!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous time at the La Concha!”
Reviews.Author: colleenchampine
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent Key West visitor and will only stay at the Crowne Plaza La Concha. Whether traveling solo or with others the La Concha is friendly, comfortable, fun and located on Duval street. From the Andy, who oversees Jack's Seafood in the lobby to the top of the LaConcha bar with Zak and Pat, all the waitstaff and bartenders are friendly and inviting. The moment you register you feel like family, not a guest. I highly recommend this hotel and the amazing staff that comes with it!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location!”
Reviews.Author: JPYNaples
Reviews.Content: Stay was super. Made special concierge requests for a special arrival and all was simply great. Thanks Barbara! Great history here. Excellent location on Duval St. Roof views breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “Use the safes located behind reception”
Reviews.Author: PaulaRogers69
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for part of our honeymoon, we checked in, left all of our belongings in our room for a couple of hours & the head of housekeeping entered our room and relieved us of $900 in cash that was in a bag (were not told of the availability of the safes in reception), the reception staff were not that interested in our complaint, they did check the entry lock to see who had entered & called the police for us but that was as far as it went. If you do stay here make sure you use the safe !

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: pearson30
Reviews.Content: La Concha is located right on Duvall Street within walking distance to restaurants, bars and attractions. We did experience a problem with our room on the first night when we were awakened about 5AM due to mechanical noises which we later found out were "chillers". The front desk staff was very responsive and moved us to a suite the next day. The suite was large, comfortable and had great views of Duval Street. The rooftop bar is a great area to watch the sunset and enjoy views of Key West and the water. We booked the "bed and breakfast" rate and the buffet was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for such an older place”
Reviews.Author: BeanerRI
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in tip top shape. Especially after a week of Fantasy Fest. The staff worked very hard at keeping us happy and content. We just enjoy coming here after Fantasy Fest each year.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Johnellec
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Concha Oct. 19-22. we had a wonderful time. The hotel is beautiful and the location is perfect, we were able to walk everywhere. The staff was great, very efficient . We were upgraded to the Tennessee Williams suite which was fabulous, that never happens to us! The suite itself was amazing, you could see forever. It's an old hotel and they kept the ambiance while upgrading the comfort. The downside to an old building is the outlets are in inconvenient places and the elevator is small and slow. Of course it's the only one in Key West so that also makes it the best. The rooftop bar at sunset was really fun. We would love to stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Big expectations, but ...”
Reviews.Author: Kerstin-01
Reviews.Content: Good location, exellent staff and service, but expensiv. 20$+tax a day to park and if you wanted a refrigerator 45$+tax a day. And a warm bottle of water that stood in the room when we arrived 5$+tax. And no internet acess, recommended an internetcafe arround the corner. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MR4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights whilst on holiday in Miami - my only wish is that we had been here for longer! We loved the hotel, the staff were very helpful, our room was huge. Our arrival we found our air conditioning was broken & the hotel was fully booked so we couldnt be moved to another room, so we were brought fans to our rom & given a complimentary breakfast, this was perfectly adequate & didnt affect our stay. The hotel is very central so you are right in the heart of all the action in Key West but with good double glazing you dont hear any street noise. The hotel lobby is amazing & we took many pictures of the whole area. Key West was great, a place for everyone to enjoy themselves whether you are 18 or 80 everyone can have fun. With only being here a short time we only did 1 trip, the sunset cruise which in my opinion is not be missed. Its all just so pretty & perfect it brought tears to my eyes. Bar wise there are just too many to choose from but we especially enjoyed Sloppy Joes. Have fun everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “love this place”
Reviews.Author: yogimckee
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here every time we go to to key west. Every one is so nice and helpful. I love the view at sunset on the roof top. The location is Great walking distrance to everything. What more can you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “located in the heart of Key West”
Reviews.Author: Major_Delays
Reviews.Content: Easy to find on Duval Street, right at the heart of the action. The hotel has character and the staff are happy to help with any requirements. Really good views from the roof top of the whole of key West. Park your car in the car park and forget it for the remainder of your time in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cookingfoolrbc
Reviews.Content: Balcony rooms are great, overlook duvall, walkable to everywhere you want to go. When wehad to stay due to possible tropical depression and had to switch rooms one of last 3 nights, they worked with us on price. Great to help you schedule outings etc.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel right in the heart of the town.”
Reviews.Author: DazzaFergie
Reviews.Content: We travelled here for 2 nights and were not disappointed. Right in the middle of Duval Street within walking distance of all amenities. When returning to Key West will be my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: waclzs
Reviews.Content: Myself, my husband and 10 month old daughter, stayed in the hotel for 2 nights. We really enjoyed our stay. The location is fantastic and the public areas very nice. Unfortunately we were given a very small room, which was made even smaller as we had to have a cot for my daughter. The cot itself looks like it was something out of an institution, perhaps something that could be looked at? The sound proofing is also fairly bad, I was woken up by snoring in the next room. Service on check out was not great, we weren't even asked if we enjoyed our stay (standard practice surely?). I read another recent review stating that Priority Club Card holders get free parking, I certainly didn't, there needs to be consistency with this. I would recommend staying at the hotel but I guess the rooms are hit and miss, and I would definitely take some ear plugs and a travel cot next time!

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: traveller191267
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure to be greeted by such friendly reception staff. We were not aware that parking was to be charged,but accepted that it was for the best. The staff were very helpful and courteous, the rooms exceeded expectation and were very comfortable. Overall, a pleasure to have visited and would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Old Key West at its best!”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanDivers_2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the "busy" end of Duval St. Though others have complained about noise, it was not an issue. Our room was HUGE, so much when staff learned what room we were in their comment was, "You have a very nice room." Beds were comfy and all staff extremely helpful. Can't say enough about our great experience! This is the only place to stay when in Key West! We are Priority Club members - I guess that pays because in addition to the large room, we also received complimentary parking.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: ferny25
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect, I didnt have to worry about catching a cab or a shutter back to my room.the lobby was nice and the view from the terrace was picture perfect.my only complaint was that the pipes for the bathroom was very loud,but thats to be expected with an older hotel.the rooms were very clean and staff members were very friendly. Even thou my stay was for one day i would recommend crown plaza to friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good!”
Reviews.Author: timbolester
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location of this hotel is perfect. It is right on Duval St. in the heart of everything and is only about 4 blocks from Mallory Square. We got there at 11 AM and thought it wouldn't hurt to ask if they had a room ready for us -- and they did! No problem. The hotel and the room obviously have a lot of guests coming and going, so there are some wear & tear issues. The hallway on the third floor had a TERRIBLE odor (plumbing/sewage?) as we got off the elevator but it was gone by the time we arrived at our room (313). At first glance, everything looked really nice. But upon closer inspection we noticed that the carpet was really old and worn. Flushing the toilet was quite a workout. We had to move the nozzle back & forth, up and down until it would finally decide to flush. The walls were thin (I could hear people "doing their business" in the bathroom next door). But these issues were minor considering how convenient the hotel was. There is a Starbucks downstairs right outside the hotel. The pool, while shallow (only a depth of 3 1/2 ft.) was nice and pleasant with a tiki bar. There were, thankfully, very few children, so the noise level was low. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant. The prices were about on par with other, nicer restaurants in the area, so we decided not to have "hotel food" for dinner. Also, our room faced the back, overlooking the parking lot, so we did not have to worry about the late-night noise from Duval Street. We slept very soundly because the beds were very comfortable. It was VERY hot outside (typical July in Key West) but the AC worked fine. Some people on this site comlain about the $20 per night parking fee but I didn't mind. On-street parking is extremely difficult to find in Key West. Once you park at the hotel, you have the peace of mind of knowing the car is close by and relatively safe (actually we could see it from our room window). Once you arrive, you won't need to drive anyway, and it's much more convenient than booking a room at one of the El-Cheapo hotels near the beginning of the island. At those "family hotels" you are more than 5 miles away and either have to wait for an inconsistent shuttle, or drive. Believe me, once there, you won't want to drive. Traffic is awful. The only problem I experienced was upon checkout. The front desk mistakenly over charged me for the parking. We were only there for one night and they charged us for two. They quickly rectified the situation but I do recommend that upon leaving you physically check out, rather than just leaving, assuming they will just charge your card. If I hadn't caught that mistake, it would have been very difficult to get my $20 (plus tax!) back. Overall, I liked this hotel and would return again if the opportunity presented itself.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location and Value for being in the middle of all the action in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbell_traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean,was a great location, too. It has a roof top bar where you can go to see the amazing Key West Sunsets. Close to all the action, you can walk out the front door and be in the midst of the action.No car needed, the trolley of "train" can take you around town if you don't want to walk.The room was much bigger than I expected with a large bathroom and comfy beds.. A Starbucks is located right off the hotel lobby.Restaurant on site as well as other ones within walking distance. Nice pool and sun tanning deck.

Reviews.Title: “Unique rooms with great service.”
Reviews.Author: tds79
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel had a lot of charm. It was old mixed with new and the staff was amazing. We asked for a crib for our infant and they brought it up to the room immediately and there was a baby travel kit with it that included baby shampoo, lotion, etc. What a nice touch that was. The pool area was very nice and had a lot of sitting area around it. You couldn't beat the location as it was right in the heart of everything. I'd definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: Keysey22
Reviews.Content: True- the hotel isn't worth what you pay. In Key West, I think that is true for any of the hotels. For a decent rate (Key West standards), you do get to stay in a prime location within an easy walk to everything. If you want to be close to the action without a long hike home or paying for a cab- this is the place. If you're looking for peace and quiet- you're better off not staying on Duval. The hotel is old and kind of dark. The rooms are small, but have always been clean. The beds are comfy and I've never had a bad nights sleep in the hotel. I also enjoy having my morning coffee on the rooftop deck at the pool. Yes, the hotel is noisy. You will hear everything in the rooms next to you. You will hear toilets flushing throughout the night and t.v.'s playing next door. I've stayed here four consecutive years, and have heard construction going on in the morning each time. The noises have never disrupted my sleep though. Another huge con is the 20 bucks per day they charge you for parking. It's practically robbery. I've never had a bad time in this hotel. I spend alot of time in Key West, and usually choose this hotel because of the perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “It depends on what you like...”
Reviews.Author: jeanniepep
Reviews.Content: We visited in June 2010 and used our Priority Club points for most of the nights; which, to be honest, was the only reason we chose the La Concha. Any night you can spend in Key West is a good one, and a free night is even better! At check-in, the clerk graciously offered to let us move into a small room that was already available (we showed up several hours before official check-in time) or let us wait for a larger room. We opted for the smaller, more immediately available room, and it was indeed small. The room itself was not a big problem but the bathroom was tiny, even for us, and we're used to sharing a small bathroom with one sink at home. People who are used to double sinks and a little elbow room should keep this in mind. The room was clean, although the a/c vents in both the bathroom and the bedroom had a slight bit of dripping water and accumulated mildew. It's an old, large hotel in a very hot, humid town, so we decided to cut them some slack on this point. Because it is an older hotel that has been taken over by Crowne Plaza, it has some charm and character along with modern conveniences like a big-screen TV and wifi. Somehow it still skews more toward being a corporate hotel than a piece of old Key West, though. Also, the walls are PAPER THIN so be aware that you'll hear your neighbors chatting, fighting, watching television, flushing the toilet, having sex, etc. - and they will hear you. I guess it says good things about either Key West or the hotel itself that we heard a lot more sex than fighting...a lot more. The rest of the hotel is nice, but just not special. The lobby is lovely, the pool is pretty but VERY small considering the number of guests the hotel can accommodate, and the bar at The Top really lacks character and fun (but does have the best views in town). When we visited, we were told the special was Key West Lemonade, which is....? What? Minute Maid on ice? Nobody ever clarified so we had a beer and moved on. It is located right in the middle of all the bars on Duval St, which is good if you like the Duval Crawl but it can get wearisome to fight through the hucksters and gawkers when you just want to get back to your room at 2am. Duval is also insanely crowded when a cruise ship is docked. If you like the Duval bars and shops this might be a plus; we definitely partied on Duval but I kinda wished we were just a block or two away from all the action so it wouldn't be such a battle to get to and from everyplace. I spent the whole trip trying to figure out why I didn't like the La Concha very much. The staff was helpful and gracious, it was clean and relatively comfortable, the location was convenient....it was just so impersonal. There are so many guesthouses on the island that have such unique personalities, it seems a shame to spend any time in what amounts to a Holiday Inn when there are more interesting options everywhere you look.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully managed hotel with clean, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: GD2004
Reviews.Content: Great location. Friendly, helpful staff. Clean, well appointed rooms. A feeling of elegance. Reasonable price for Key West. Quiet despite the proximity to Duval street.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel..close to all bars!!”
Reviews.Author: amyj984
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in hotels in Key West before, but this was by far the BEST!! It was in a great location on Duval St., less than a block from Margaritaville, and only about 1/2 a mile to Mallory Sq. Not sure about the noise, we had a room facing the entrance area, so it was not loud at all. It might have been loud if your room faced the street. They do provide ear plugs and a sleep mask. The bar on The Top was awesome! Best view of Key West I have ever seen. The hotel rooms did have signs of wear, but it was only beacuse of the age of the building. It was still very nicely decorated, with a large television and a very comfortable bed. The pool and pool bar were really nice, with a great view of the street. We got there early, but were given a key card so we could park our car right away. I think it was the off season, beacuse our room was less than $200 with taxes, and was well worth the money. We did not want to leave the next morning, and hope to return soon. The staff was very friendly, and the lobby area was nice, with leather oversized couches, and tables. On our next KW trip, we hope to stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of Everything”
Reviews.Author: SFLMomBocaRaton_FL
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The bellhop took TONS of baggage from our car (4 girls on a weekend getaway) without flinching and helped us get settled. The concierge - Frank - recommended everything from breakfast to dinner to snorkeling adventures - and all were first rate! We stayed in a junior suite, which was comfortable, and had a great view of Duvall Street as well as the ocean and Mallory Square. Even the restaurant downstairs, Jack's, was incredible! The location is amazing - right in the midst of everything on Duvall Street. This stay could NOT have been better - an amazing hotel! I'll definitely book here the next time I'm in town!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough big hotel in the centre of town”
Reviews.Author: Arden1000
Reviews.Content: I arrived without a reservationin key West, so was pleased when this hotel took me in and provided parking, which is an issue in key West. Room was clean and tidy with massive TV, no view to speak of but bed was confy for sleeping. Roof top bar easily the best place to vies Key West and the Sunset! Hotel located right in the heart of Duval Street whihc is the centre of atention at night, although i heard no noise from the street. Swimming Pool was broken during my stay but they provided shuttle bus to sister hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: lilo05
Reviews.Content: We loved the location even though Duval Street below was a bit loud till 3am. Great room at a great price. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: rednorma
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here for the 3rd time, and really love it. The location is great, roof top great, service great. What else does one need. We will be back in August 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Jerseyshore09
Reviews.Content: My husband and I both travel extensively for our jobs. When we need to get away, we often search the world over for trips. But when we need a home away from home. We go to the La Concha. Yes we are both priority club members.. But ever time I have been at the La Concha it has been the most wonderful experience. The Front desk service is exceptional every time. We have had many different room types every time, but always the housekeeping staff has been wonderful. It is a wonderful historic hotel, and every room has its own charm. I am still waiting to meet some of the ghost. As a travel channel buff, please go on the ghost tour, its a ball. The whole town is a meca of wonderful experiences. This is a place to relax and chill. See ya all again in 2 days and counting. Barbara will be upset if you don't book the Dry Tortugues trip in advance though. You have to experience this hotel once in your life, I promise you'll return for the locations and most importantly the service you'll receive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for key west”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireRedSox
Reviews.Content: We had a really good stay at this hotel. The staff were very helpful, the room was really nice, the lobby is as good as i have ever seen, and the location is perfect. Duval street is very lively, lots of drunk middle aged americans, so i was expecting quite a noisy stay but i was pleasently suprised. Key West is a must visit and therefore La Concha I would think is as good as any hotel to stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Best location if you're "Doing Duval"!”
Reviews.Author: DKWEST
Reviews.Content: We love The La Concha! Location - Location - Location! It's a bit pricey but well worth it if you want to park your vehicle and do the Duval Crawl, there's not a better location on Duval Street. It a very beautiful Hotel, but it was originally built in 1926, so expect some of the minor inconveiniences of a renovated historic building. I've read on here people complaining about "slow elevators",.. Well I say slow down and enjoy the ride,.. Take that time to give your Wife, Husband, boyfriend, or girlfriend a kiss and rekindle the flames! If you're in Key West you're not supposed to be in a hurry anyway, so don't let a slow elevator bring you down!!! I'll take a slow elevator that drops me off on Duval Street than a fast elevator elsewhere, where you have to get in the car, ride down to Duval, find a place to park, then drive back after a night of drinking. Slow Down,.. Enjoy Stated elegance of a Historic era,.. Party like like your in the Keys and Don't have care in the world,.. Then retreat to a small room where you have to be closer to the one you love!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great ambiance and perfect location on Duval”
Reviews.Author: Smcquilkin70
Reviews.Content: Wonderful old hotel built in 1926. Small swimming pool, but large relaxing area around it. Tallest building in Key West and the top is open for the public. Great place to see sunsets and there's a bar up there too. Frank, the concierge can hook you up with anything you want to do.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: oudda63
Reviews.Content: We have visited Key West quite a few times in the last ten years, but this was our first time staying at this hotel. From the time we checked in the staff was exceptional.
