We were upgraded to a balcony room. The room was clean and well furnished. Went to Jacks for dinner and the food was excellent. I really enjoyed the rooftop bar. It is close to everything from, shopping, eating and the waterfront. You can take the ghost tour from the lobby or catch a trolley right out front.

Reviews.Title: “Past the Glory Days...”
Reviews.Author: MsBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza "La Concha" hotel in downtown Key West disappointed me. The check-in clerk was courteous but not very helpful when I asked for an upgrade (I'm a Platinum Priority Club member). The only perk offered was free parking, but I had no vehicle. My room was large and clean; however, the bathroom door mirror had broken off and there were ugly glue marks on it. My room was pleasant, overlooking the pool & garden. What bothered me most was that the lovely big windows were painted shut, so I could not enjoy any fresh air. The HVAC system sounded haunted, like someone was clicking through a deck of cards--weird! The location is very convenient for restaurants and the docks for sailing, cruises, etc. If the windows had opened I would have been much happier. I did not eat in the restaurant, but it was always busy. Starbuck's is located on the ground floor, and is also very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: rojeti
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location - steps away from Margaritaville and a couple of blocks from Mallory Square. The accomodations were wonderful and the staff went above and beyond to ensure our stay was memorable. The rooftop lounge was the best view of the town and the sunsets.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bob G
Reviews.Content: Stay 5 nights. Staff was excellent. Front desk, concierge, our housekeeper. Yes, the pool is rather small, but it had to be wedged in between the two buildings. It is an old hotel--great for a nostalgia nut like me--but kept up to date. No complaints from this guy.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a wonderful place to stay even though a little expensive.”
Reviews.Author: holyhijinks
Reviews.Content: Location: You canâ€™t beat it! Itâ€™s why you stay here. It is perfectly located near all the hustle-n-bustle on Duval St. Check-in: It was fast and efficient, if a bit unfriendly. Room: We were on the second floor, facing the parking lot. The room was a smoking room, although we are all non-smokers. But the room didnâ€™t smell smoky. It was a little small, but not at all claustrophobic. It was plenty of room for three adults. The bathroom was a nice size, and everything was clean. Two small things: 1) sometimes you had to pump the toilet handle a couple of times before it would flush (although once it flushed it was a powerful flush!); and 2) we couldnâ€™t really control the A/C thermostat. Sometimes we wished it wouldâ€™ve been a few degrees cooler in the room, but it wouldnâ€™t go down. Iâ€™m glad the weather was nice and cool during our stay, or it may have been a bit unbearable. Facilities: The pool was nice. The view from the roof is spectacular! The lobby is beautiful. Staff: The men at the check-in desk werenâ€™t the most friendly of folks-- they weren't rude, just cold and aloof; but the bell-hop, housekeeping and concierge were all very warm and hospitable. And housekeeping always did a fabulous job! Overall: We would recommend this place for first-time visitors to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tnieb55
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel with the best view of the Sunset from the roof. Great rooms. Central to everyplace in Key West. Located on Duval Street, close enough to walk from the Southern Most to Schooners Warf.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DunedinDale
Reviews.Content: What a great location to be near everything in Old Town. The view from the top floor is awesome. Service from the front desk was fast and efficient, but housekeeping was disappointing... I would expect coffee would be replenished daily without having to ask for it. The room was small (which we'd expect in an older hotel), but the balcony overlooking Duval St. was roomy and gave a great perch for people watching. It was unusually cool there, and we were surprised to find the hotel did not have heat! The cool wind blowing through the cracks between the French doors to the balcony made it hard to keep warm in the room at night, but the front desk was quick to provide an extra blanket. The room was well-appointed with a large 42" flat panel TV, but a nightstand with a drawer would have been preferred to the end table provided by the bed. The WiFi didn't work well at all in the room. It was a bit disappointing for a Crowne Plaza property, especially at a Crowne Plaza price. If you want to be centrally located in Old Town within walking distance of everything, and don't mind the price, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: touristwoman
Reviews.Content: This is the largest hotel in the old part of Key West and an historical one too. It is attractive in the lobby and pool, but the rooms were tired with a saggy bed. Nothing special in anyway. Sunset viewed from the roof top lounge is probably the best thing about the hotel, unless being located in the thick of the bar scene is nice for you.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: GL_trip
Reviews.Content: We just spent a night at Key West on Christmas Eve, so we want to stay near to the happening place which is Duval Street. You will not go wrong by staying here, which is most popular and famous street at Key West. The hotel is located at the center of Duval Street, we came here by a rental car and we parked the car at the hotel carpark, at USD20 per day. The car park is reserved for hotel guest only, it is not easy to find a public car park at Duval Street. Once we have parked our car, we just walk out to the surrounding for the rest of the time until we check out. It is so convenient that you don't need a car when you stay here. Don't miss to visit roof top of the hotel for beautiful sunset view, it is stunning and unforgettable!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but would stay elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: Southernfield
Reviews.Content: I chose this place due to location and I must admit it was ideal for just that...LOCATION!!! Being on Duval St. was really convenientl, however there are tons of lovely Guest Houses that I would consider for my next trip to Key West. Hotel was quite busy, so I was told and only would upgrade me if I paid for it. (I am presently a Priority Card Platinum member.) We were only offered free parking, so I later went back to speak to the hotel manager and asked for free breakfast...surprisingly, I did get that for my family. The hotel itself is fine, but old...meaning rooms are very small, limited outlets (good luck in finding one and if it works is another story), the hallways also have that dark carpet and dark painted door that just make the whole place seem so gloomy and dingy. We requested a fridge for our room and one was brought quickly however it looked like it was at least 20+ years old. We finally did get to enjoy the rooftop bar one evening and watched the sunset. What a great crowd that shows up for this nightly event...the sun setting in Key West. Anyhow, drinks were great as well as the music!! The pool here was shallow, and dirty, and looked like it hasn't been properly maintained...disappointing. This overall area where the pool is on the roof, is actually okay to hang out at, plus the bar nearby is a bonus. Internet service was off more that it was on...completely unreliable. The breakfast down in the restaurant was actually very good, and we enjoyed it each morning. Besides good food, we did have very good service. Besides the restaurant on the street, there are a couple of fun shops which are part of this building as well. The woman concierge was quite helpful and was able to book our water activities and answer all our questions. I know this place has a great history attached to it, I just didn't feel moved by any of it and will choose somewhere else the next time we are in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Key West- What a Dump”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter35USA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. They were charging over $300 a night. Key West is one big con. This place is full of grungy people, hobos begging and drinking in the street and rough rowdy families . This is not a very classy resort. When you go to book a hotel rooms on most website, you are informed that they are full or that they are over $400 a night. When you arrive in Key West, every hotel, guest house resort has vacancy signs. Key West is tired and run down. Shops are boarded up or vacant displaying for rent signs. This hotel was dated and nothing special. I doubt if it has 3 stars. There was no shampoo in the bathroom- just soap. The pool was not heated and the fitness centre was one room with a few machines. Very poor and certainly not value for money. I would never visit Key West again.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, centrally located, extremely convenient”
Reviews.Author: doclauderdale
Reviews.Content: Of the hotels in Key West, I found the La Concha (Crowne Plaza) to be one of the best. Its location cannot be beaten as it is on Duval Street where all of the activity on the island is located. No need for a taxi, scooter, or car...just walk out the door! The amenities were excellent...... Room service, flat screen TV, nice pool. The on site restaurant was first rate. The staff is extremely helpful. Yes, the hotel is old, built in the 1920's, but that only adds to the charm. The room was certainly adequate in size. One of the tallest structures on the island, there is a lounge on the roof where you can celebrate the sunset, and see a panorama of the entire island. I highly recommend La Concha. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, excellent staff and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelman1979_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Year's and had a balcony room which was nice. After reading other reviews, I'm glad I had the balcony room. The rooms are very small like reviewers said, but the hotel is VERY OLD. It was built in the early 1900's. So what do people expect from an old Hotel? Of course the rooms are going to be small and the elevators are going to be slow. The staff was frienly and accomodating. The hotel is very clean as well. The location is right in the middle of everything, so a short walk to anything on Duval St, from Mallory Square to the Southermost Point. You are right in the middle of all of the action. Overall, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location -- does it outweigh value?”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne_FLJill
Reviews.Content: If you are a Duval crawler, you'll love the location. It'll take forever to drive down Duval to the La Concha, and it's very easy to miss the entrance on the left that takes you into the hotel registration/parking. I'm a Priority Club Platinum, so although we did not get an upgrade due to the holiday, we did get free parking and a room on the 6th floor. The room was tight, so tight that we stored our cooler in the bathroom under the sink, and the windows didn't open and were filthy, so it was hard to see any of the sights, despite facing Duval Street. What we did get was the noise. Motorcycles, motorcycles, and more motorcycles. The location was not worth the room rates (I had three free nights, so there was no charge, otherwise I'd not be there...$350 per night? Forget it.) as the rooms are tight, the bathrooms have no fans, and the elevators are painfully slow. I stayed at the Merlin Guesthouses on Simonton last time, which was a few more minutes' walk to Mallory Square (once to the square is more than enough), and it is a nice break to be off the chaos of Duval. We ended up eating at restaurants off Duval and found much better value off Duval for everything from coffee to fine dining. If you are going to drink the night away and crawl home, stay on Duval. Otherwise, find a better value by looking to the smaller venues and the guesthouses. The lobby is very large and has comfortable seating areas and complimentary wifi. I spent an afternoon lounging in a very tropical settee with a good book.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for Duval St.”
Reviews.Author: bairdwc
Reviews.Content: We stayed two days and found it met all our needs. Originally, we booked a resort but once we mapped it, we made a decision to stay at the Conch. The hotel is well maintained and the pool is a plus. We had a room with a balcony where you could watch the people walk by. Jimmy Buffet's was close by so a good margarita was a block away. Overall, a nice hotel but a little pricey.

Reviews.Title: “would recommend for first time visitors/ great location”
Reviews.Author: mimi_linna
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas Eve and Christmas night here. room 647. overlooking Duval St. Friendly staff. clean room. Went up one floor to the terrace and watched the sun set. The trolley stop was right out the front door. Could not ask for a better location. Down side was if you are a light sleeper and go to bed early, you can hear traffic and people talking on the street. The hotel provided me with ear plugs upon request. If you were to get a room facing the rear parking lot, you might not have this problem. I would recommend this hotel for those visiting Key West for the first time. When we return, we will most likely stay somewhere other than Duval street since we are not shoppers or stay up late partying but I am glad we stayed there for our firist visit.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: robhiam
Reviews.Content: Excellent stop over situated on Duval St, was in easy walking district of many bars restuarants and other sights. the hotel is the tallest building in Key West and has a great panoramic view of the city and is a great place to watch the sun go down. The room we were given was very large with a big flat screen tv, we did not eat at the hotel as the choise of eating in Key West is incredable, We were also given complimentary parking.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay anywhere else but here.”
Reviews.Author: Lolaloo22
Reviews.Content: I will never stay anywhere else in Key West again! This was the best hotel ever. It is in the heart of the island, right in the middle of Duval. You park your car and donâ€™t have to drive again til you leave the Keys. The staff was wonderful, helpful and always courteous. The hotel itself is beautiful â€“ I believe it is a historical landmark. Of course, because of its age, there are some issues that canâ€™t be helped â€“ i.e. thin walls, outdated elevators. We didnâ€™t use the pool but it was a very nice pool area with a balcony that overlooks the city. Also, there is a rooftop bar where you can have drinks and watch the famous Key West sunset. It was just so convenient to walk out the door and be in the middle of everything â€“ it is walking distance to all the bars, restaurants and shops. I will definitely stay here again. Some tips for Key West â€“ the trolley tour is a great way to see the island on your own schedule. You can just hop on and off whenever you want. It is a little pricey ( I think itâ€™s $30/pp) but you can get coupons for discounts. Also, there is a company called Southernmost Scavenger Hunts that runs scavenger hunt challenges in the Duval area. It is only $20/pp and it was the most fun weâ€™ve had in a long time! We did the â€œadultâ€� one, which was essentially a bar crawl â€“ it took us to pretty much every noteworthy bar in Key West, with coupons for 2 for 1 drinks at each one. We met so many people and had the best time! Also, you can win prizes for gift certificates to use at restaurants in the area. I highly recommend it. They also have a family-oriented hunt that they run during the day. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service and less than stellar rooms.”
Reviews.Author: lovetoeatinkeywest
Reviews.Content: Staff was very unhelpdul for even the most minor of requests. Parking was horrible at $15 a night and the lot was always full even though we paid. 2 eggs and bacon breakfasts were $63. It was a Dennys meal on better plates...yuk. We stay I'm Key West often and this will be the last at LaConcha.

Reviews.Title: “In The Heart of The Key West Fun!”
Reviews.Author: bssskins
Reviews.Content: What a location! We were there for 2 days and never moved our car until we left. One night we hit the bars to the south of the hotel and the next night to the north. Everything is convenient. The rooms were nice, you don't really spend much time there anyway. For those who are staying two night, I recommend one sunset at the top of the La Concha and one at Mallory Square. Not a beach location, so if you have kids or want that type of place, head to the south end of KW. If you want to be right in the middle of all the action, the La Concha is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dawn112Ohio
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The rooms are alitle small but nicely decorated. We did have a room with a balcony overlooking Duval Street. Wonderful location, walking distance to everything. No need for scooters or taxi's. Found out after our stay that the hotel is haunted but we did not have any problems with ghosts. We would definitaly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wear your raincoat and boots--inside.”
Reviews.Author: BILLKILL
Reviews.Content: Great location but little else. The entire hotel needs renovation starting with a new roof and plumbing. It rained our second night there and we woke up with the roof leaking on our bed. We switched to another room and the toilet leaked after every flush and flooded the bathroom. They tried to fix it but failed so we spent the night throwing towels on the floor after every flush. The next morning we switched rooms again. No fridge, no microwave. Needless to say, we will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: gandalfNY
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at the La Concha and it was a very pleasant experience. The room was very comfortable, with an excellent location on Duval St. We never drove the car while we were there, everything was within a comfortable walk. The hotel bar on the roof offered a great view of Key West and the hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha in the heart of Duval St.”
Reviews.Author: ILMomandDad
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Key West. I wanted to stay in La Concha this time due to it's location right on Duval St. in the heart of the historic district. The lobby is beautiful and comfortable. Some of the leather sofa's have that well worn look, but I found it to be part of the charm. I noticed that people felt comfortable enough to read a book there. The rooms are somewhat small and contain original moldings and baseboards. We were given a handicapped room, which we did not need but enjoyed, due to a larger bathroom than most rooms. The bed was comfy and there was a large screen TV in the room. We stayed for free due to husband's "points" and were not charged for parking or internet. My husband and I were very satisfied. I would definitely stay there again. There is too much to do and see in Key West. You only sleep in the room. There is a wonderful view of the sunset from the top of the building. The pool clean. I thought it had a southern old world charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: mfisherday
Reviews.Content: The beds and the rest room were very comfortable and clean. The room is small and our view not the best, but a great tv and great resting place.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but very unremarkable otherwise”
Reviews.Author: chrisnoc
Reviews.Content: Spent a night at the La Concha with a friend who had booked it to be close-in to the center of Key West. The hotel is right on Duval Street so it is convenient but I must admit I expected a much more high-end experience from a Crowne Plaza branded hotel that charges $159 for a standard room with no view on a weeknight in the off season. This is a historic hotel and it has charming areas but others are just average. The rooms are nice but the beds and bedding was not as nice as I have at home and the side chairs looked like they came from a catering hall. The pool area seems nice and large but the upper floor deck is a waste of space. We didn't get up to the top floor bar and deck. Sadly we did attempt to eat at the downstairs hotel off the lobby. The service was great but the food was inedible. I ordered a simple cuban sandwich and my friend ordered a simple chicken sandwich. I took a few chewy and tasteless bites from the sandwich before I encountered a slab of rancid pork that almost caused me to lose it. The waiter immediately came over and offerred to replace it but my appetite was completely gone at that point. They removed the item from our bill but should have comp'd the whole thing. The restaurant was empty during the peak of lunch hour so we should have sensed it was not great. There are too many other choices for food in Key West so unless they turn this around steer very clear. Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect”
Reviews.Author: Trimada
Reviews.Content: I had heard different things about this hotel, â€œold, small roomsâ€� etc. but thanks to a very nice person on the forum board (you know who you are) and my diamond membership with Priority club, I was upgraded to a suite. Was this the best hotel in Key West? No probably not, I am certain that the Westin and Waldorf resorts along with a whole bunch of others MAY have nicer rooms BUT for me this was the perfect location. You are right in the middle of Duval Street and a very easy walk to just about everything. I didnâ€™t find it too loud at all but I did have the 5th floor. Maybe if you are on the second floor you may be able to hear more, not sure? I heard rumors that the rooms were small and again I was upgraded so I wonâ€™t speak for all rooms but we had no problem. Positives Location- without a doubt the best Great sunsets from the roof top If you like the â€œold styleâ€� rooms â€“ but this can easily be a negative if you donâ€™tâ€¦ Negatives Okay the air-conditioning could have worked better but it wasnâ€™t awful. Slow small elevators, but again what do you expect from an old hotel. Personally, I travel enough with several different chains; I have Diamond/Platinum memberships which allow me to choose which hotel to stay at. I was considering one of the Waldorf hotels but after visiting that area I am SOOoo happy I didnâ€™t stay thereâ€¦ Again I am sure their rooms are nice but for me they are too far to walk and donâ€™t want to spend all that extra money on cabs etc. If I come back to Key West I will without a doubt be using this hotel againâ€¦ Oh and not supporting this brand of hotel, just read my review on the Intercontinental stay (same chain) that I had right after thisâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rippedofff1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on Duval, Can't beat the location.Rooms are very clean, staff was helpful and friendly. That's the good. The bad is as follows. Fitness center was a joke. One treadmill, one bike, one elyptical. One small set on bumbells up to 25 lbs. Someone reviewed this as a good fitness center, I'd hate to see they're gym. The pool is very small, no big deal but they allow smoking and you can't get away from it, it can be annoying. If you hate inhaling second hand smoke then find another hotel. Also the pool is only 3 feet deep. again if you like to swim try another holel. All in al the place was nice, older but it seemed like it was well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Average Rooms Adequate Staff”
Reviews.Author: CASAlexandria_VA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the La Concha for 7 nights. If you are looking for location, the hotel is perfectly located almost in the center of Duval St. The lobby is nice and clean, but the rooms are in need of repair and upgrade. I was put in a handicapped room because I was on the government rate (I guess they save the nice rooms for full-paying customers) and was disappointed with the condition of the room. The maintenance promptly fixed the problems and moved me to another room when they couldn't fix the air conditioner. Overall, the price you pay is for location and not for the condition of the rooms. You also have to pay $20 a day to park there. Finally, the staff was not very professional. For it's location, history, and price, you would expect more attentive service from the staff. Also, I had a do not disturb sign on my door and the maid knocked on it anyway! So, if you are looking for no frills with a good location and if the price is right for you, stay at La Concha. However, if I were to do it again, I would stay on the north end of Duval Street near Mallory Square.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but staff not great!”
Reviews.Author: jo1006
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located at the busy end of fantastic Duval Street, and the rooms are clean and servicable. We had a two night stay in ~September, and enjoyed every single moment of Key West, however the hotel staff are not too fantastic. We were charged an extortionate amount on our credit card (only found out when we checked the balance over the phone!) even though we had said we would be paying cash. When we queried this with reception staff, we received only shrugged shoulders and totally unhelpful comments. We were charged $129.00 plus tax AND and extra $35.00 per room for 'extra's' which we were assured would be returned to our credit card within two days (needless to say, we still wait for this) We were charged $20 per night for parking (also ridiculous) Wanting to spend a couple of lazy hours in the hotel pool, we found it to be scummy with the filters not working and a layer of dirt floating on the top of the water. The pool was also very warm, which is not welcome when the temperatures are over 100 in the shade. It was like bathing in skin soup, so we chose to have a cool shower in our room instead. Although the rooms were clean, the coffee supplied was disgusting and the bottled water would cost us $5 if we were to use it. This review appears as if we are quibbling about the money, but to be honest, a Crown Plaza hotel should be better than this. Luckily, the poor hotel experience did not spoil our fantastic stay in Key West, and we will visit again in the future. Needless to say, we will NOT be staying in the Crown Plaza, La Concha hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to hang our hat for a 40th bday celebration”
Reviews.Author: treeallmon
Reviews.Content: Planning my 40th birthday celebration with 25 of my friends in Key West called for the best location in which we did not have to drive anywhere. La Concha was it! Reasonably priced and located right in the heart of Duvall....centrally located in my opinion from things down toward Front Street to events at the Southernmost Part of the key. We were able to walk everywhere. The 2nd floor is the only floor with outdoor balcony's and these look right over Duvall. The end room, 241 is a junior suite with a Huge balcony and a sitting area. This was where our large party congregated prior to leaving for dinner, etc. With a large refrigerator, we were able to keep all beer, wine and alcohol here for everyone to come and get a drink for the walk out OR just to hang out. The other rooms were small but clean with large TV's but small bathrooms. The hotel is over 100 years old so there are not numerous electrical outlets that we are used to at home....to plug in cell phones, flat irons, laptops. etc. But it was doable. The pool was great. Not incredibly huge but perfect to me. A bar during the day where you can order drinks and food. The downstairs resturant of the hotel was good food as well. We had the breakfast buffet our last day there and it was great! $15 per person. Not your typical buffett.....it was really good! Great time...would stay there again! Clean, reasonably priced and situated perfectly for party central!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location! Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Corina82
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect located in the cityheart of Key West. Although you're in the middle of nightlife, the hotel is quiet. The room was comfortable and clean. At the roof you can enjoy the sight over Key West. Parking is not cheap, 20 dollars a day. In the hall Ã½ou can find a concierge where you can book trips around key west, very handy! Key West is a real funplace, perfect for a happy holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Great location / rooms”
Reviews.Author: Neilbond007
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights last week. Upon checking in was informed I was upgraded to a junior suite (gold member / paid with points). Got to the corner room on the 4th floor. Was pretty large! It was only 1 room but had a King size bed and large couch. Also had a pretty large LCD TV. Room was spotless. Furniture looked pretty updated. The only issue was the extremely loud ice machine outside the room! Luckily the bed was round the corner so could hardly hear at night. The hotel is in the center of everything. Easy walking distance to everything you want to see. Would definitely use this hotel again when in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “great location but its haunted”
Reviews.Author: loribabes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on duval street where all the action is. The lobby is gorgeous. The room are on the small side and has the old hotel room ambiance. The hallways though is a little narrow and spooky looking. I think this hotel is haunted. When we arrived, I told my husband that this hotel must be haunted and he said "ghost ghost if you are here please knock" all off the sudden the blinds started rattling, when i turn around it stop. We just started laughing, thinking it must be a funny ghost. There must be a reason why the haunted walk starts from the lobby. Anyhow, while on our stay the cd player played twice on its own. Overall, we had a very nice stay. I would stay here again. The ghost does not bother me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and overall satisfied with our stay”
Reviews.Author: KeyWest4fun
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to just about everything. Room was clean and comfortable. Received great, friendly service from all staff encountered such as front desk, concierge, restaurant servers and bartenders and even the housekeepers. Some advice, don't book a room facing Duval St. because you'll hear all the street commotion well into the wee morning hours. For less outside noise, book rooms more in the interior of the hotel or the sides and back. That said, we were in an interior room, but heard all the racket from rowdy guests in other rooms and had to call hotel security to ask them to quiet down. That's my only gripe about the place....the possibility of having a room next to rowdies who'll keep you awake.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: TexasPOTUS
Reviews.Content: You've got to stay at this hotel. When you make reservations, tell them you want to stay on the second floor facing Duval Stree. They are the only rooms with balconies and great views of the day and night life on the streets. Just driving by you would not be able to tell this gem of a hotel is hidden among the crowds and little shops and restaurants lining Duval St. The price you pay is well worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Good and The Bad”
Reviews.Author: krippelz3
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Crowne Plaza Key West for a few years, and have always loved it. With my last trip, however, something has changed. Let me start with the good because this is a good hotel. GOOD--- Location. The hotel is right in the middle of all the action. You dont need a rental car or scooter. You can walk to all the bars / restaurants, Hemminways, Mel Fishers, ect. That is a major plus. Lobby is beautiful and for me it sums up what key west is. Pool USED to be quite nice, but maintenance has slipped. Rooms are nice, not huge but if you upgrade 1 level they are quite spacious and nice. BAD--- It appears that this hotel is showing signs of its age. It was built in 1928, and unfortunately it is starting to look it. The lobby is beautiful, but the pool had several cracked / chipped tiles. The rooms were not the cleanest i have seen. Service--- The worst i have had at this hotel so far. One day i left my room at 7:30am and returned at 6pm to find my room was not cleaned. I called and the front desk said it would be cleaned that evening (it wasnt). The next day as well my room was not cleaned. I was leaving that morning, so I didnt press the issue. Guests--- During my visit there was a large group of douchebag frat boys that were loud, rude, and annoying. They had empty beer cans floating in the pool, and were playing beer pong on an inflatable thing that took up half the pool. There were families with kids and i felt bad because these guys were cussing like sailors and being outright rude to all other guests. There needs to be more control over things like that. It appears this hotel is becoming the "college weekend out" hotel. So families are being nudged away. By overall recommendation is NOT to stay here, and I wish i could say the opposite because i have had some great stays in the past. I would say go down to the north end of Duval and stay on Ocean Key, very family friendly and peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location. Great place to stay. Right in the center of everything.”
Reviews.Author: kwbeth
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at LaConcha several times now and would not stay anywhere else. Price is reasonable considering location. Sunset from the roof is beautiful as well as the view of the town. Rooms are very nice and roomy. Wireless internet works great. The staff is extremely accomodating and attentive. The seafood restaurant downstairs is pretty good too.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy experience / Ghost visit”
Reviews.Author: DallasScary
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not what we expected. The carpet was old fashion, the beds were old and the room just looked creepy. When you enter the room you just get the chills. We stayed 3 nights in room 311 and the first night all you could hear was talking all night long. The walls are so thin that you could hear the people in the other rooms. The hallways are long and creepy and lonely, almost as if you are in a black and white scary movie. On our second night there while we were asleep my husbad dropped his pillow in the middle of the night as he turned around to pick it up he saw two feet as if someone was sitting in the chair watching us while we were asleep. Throughout the night you feel that someone is walking in your room. Never again will we stay at this hotel. Not worth the scare nor the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Room for the Price”
Reviews.Author: twinzmomie
Reviews.Content: Went to Key West for a few days of R&R with no children. The hotel was very nice, the staff was also very nice and accomodating. The concierge could have been a bit more helpful, but other than that, very nice. Our room had a balcony overlooking Duval, which explains why there were earplugs in the goody back we received upon checking in! The hotel was in an excellent location, no need for the car. I have to agree with other comments made re: the small pool; but if you arent there for lounging by the pool it is great. The bartender Zak @ the rooftop was a treat and even though there was no sunset to view that night, a fun time was had by all!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great for the kids...”
Reviews.Author: NorCal9
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here in early July. The location was perfect, right on Duval within walking distance of all of the best spots, whatever your tastes. The rooms were only OK, a bit small with a window that didn't open. We thought things were pretty quiet, and didn't wake up to any noise from inside or out. The pool is TINY and only 3 feet deep. It is essentially only a spot to cool down with a drink. For the kids, that was a drag, as the two times we tried to go to the pool with them, it was filled to capacity with a younger crowd, drinking pretty heavily and using words that would require some explanations to the kids. If you are young and without kids, this place would be great. For us trying to entertain the kids, it would have been nice to have a bigger pool that wasn't filled with 15 people with drinks in their hands. Not an unruly crowd--just people having a good time in the Keys. The roof top sunset view was pretty cool. The sunset didn't really cooperate while we were there, but it was a nice place to have a drink and meet some people. Parking was the other drag. $20/day for parking. Just add $20 to the room rate and call parking "FREE."--I just can't help feeling that parking fees are nickel and diming you. If you can get there without a car, do it, as parking in Key West downtown is hard to come by and expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: flgram
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a little mini-vaca to Key West and got a great rate at the Crowne Plaza on Duval Street, staying Wed and Thurs nights. It is located towards the end of Duval, closer to Mallory Square, a perfect location to walk the length of Duval and the surrounding areas. The hotel reminded us of a European hotel and being the oldest hotel in the area, has a charm of its own. The bed was comfortable, the room was large enough, and although the bathroom was small, it was immaculately clean. We had a quick breakfast in the restaurant in the hotel, Jack's, and there is a Starbucks in the hotel as well, but we enjoyed the local fare at the bars and restaurants on the water. This hotel also has parking available, if you drive down; it costs $20 per night, but worth the security and place to park!! The Trolley is a good way to see the island and learn a little of the history and it is a "jump off, jump on" tour, so one can see whatever they choose in a particular area and then reboard another trolley later that day. Don't miss walking around the older section to see the houses and architcture...most interesting. The drive from Ft. Myers, where we live, took a little more than 5 hours. It was interesting driving at "sea level", but next time we will try the Key West Express and leave the car at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ColleenAngeli
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in June 2009 for Fathers Day and his 60th birthday. Room was great, didn't have a street view, but no noise helped with sleeping. Room was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Right on Duval , very handy but very quiet inside”
Reviews.Author: Bobbio
Reviews.Content: The Crowne Plaza is in an old well preserved building right on Duval, the main street in Key West. You are right at the heart of things yet as a result of excellent double glazing and air conditioning the rooms are very quite. Our bedroom was large and comfortable with ample storage space and a view over Duval. The main restaurants were good but we were a bit diaappointed with the rooftop terrace from where sunset could be seen. it got very crowded and noisy. There was a large car park, guarded by a flock of cockerels, expensive at $20 a day - plus the inevitable US habit of adding tax afterwards - which confuses foreigners - but very handy in view of Key West's limited parking availability. There was no interet available in the lobby, which I found very surprising. The only way to get internet was to bring your own PC and use it in the room or go to a nearby internet cafe

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Key West. Best location on Duval St.”
Reviews.Author: FloridaNuts
Reviews.Content: We received an internet special rate for $129/nt. THE MINUTE I STEPPED INTO THE ROOM, I IMMEDIATELY CALLED THE FRONT DESK AND REQUESTED ANOTHER NIGHT. Our plan was to stay only one night originally. My wife and I have visited Key West before. This Hotel is 5 Star. It is in the HEART of Duval St. Our view was that of Duval St.We had a non-smoking king room. It was beautiful. We watched a sunset on Mallory Square one night then went to the ROOFTOP Bar (the highest viewpoint in Key West) the second night. We had drinks at the RoofTop Bar and walked around to enjoy the 360 degree view of Key West. Great spot to take pics! The Hotel was very clean and had the best location and extremely safe and quiet (despite all the action on Duval St.). You needed a room key to get to the RoofTop Bar. There was also security at night to enter the Hotel. I stress this as very important because there are all kinds of people on Duval St. All the $ we spent there was well worth it. From the room, to dining, to shopping. We are a young couple with no kids and had an absolute BLAST in Key West. We will return there soon and I will only stay there!! You can hang out til 4am partying and then return to a CLEAN, QUIET, SAFE Hotel room. The staff was very friendly and classy. There is sooo much to do in Key West. I parked the car in their gated lot and didn't get back in it til we had to leave. We walked everywhere! This hotel is in the PERFECT location. I can't stress that enough! This is where you want to be. You definitely get what you pay for here. We had a 42" (Plasma or LCD) Tv in our room. The room service was excellent. We couldn't find anything to complain about even if we wanted to. The restaurant was excellent to. I would like to get the same deal next time. But even if I didn't, I would stay there anyway. It was worth it to us. It is not that often that you would be willing to pay more. We HIGHLY recommend this beautiful Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about, Great, great, great !! Best overall place to be”
Reviews.Author: notravelguy
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Wed. 6/10 and our room was neat and clean. 2 double beds, as requested, plenty of room. nice updates, large flatscreen tv., (only watched about an hour in 4 days). Had trouble with a lamp, went to front desk, was fixed right away! The Pool was great for lounging around, not any kids, and the food from the bar looked good, we didn't eat there as there were so many places to go. Of course the best view in town was right over our head on the roof top. Great bartender, Pete, awesome sunset, and simply a great look at the town in general.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but could be better”
Reviews.Author: Armandina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 nights as first timers to Key West and the USA. The central location is excellent, plenty of shops, restaurants and attractions within a short walk. The room was large, but we were diappointed that there were no balconies to rooms (only suites) and the windows didn't open. The pool area was VERY small and at weekends became VERY overcrowded with large groups of noisy, rowdy teenagers/college students who started drinking round the pool at mid-day and continued till 4am in the morning, on one occasion waking us up. There are very few sunloungers around the pool, so if you don't get one early in the morning, forget it! Breakfast was available in Jack's Seafood Shack (in the lobby). We had breakfast there once and found the service to be very poor. It took half an hour to be served toast and a bagel (there were only 3 other couples in) and we had to ask the waiter twice to bring us milk for our tea, which we waited 20 mins for. It's not surprising that this place is deserted compared to all other eateries. Barbara the Concierge was helpful, but was very pushy about trying to sign us up for dives with Captain's Corner (we'd read some bad reviews about this dive centre), perhaps she was on commission? She suddenly became very 'off' with us when we said we'd like to check out a few dive places ourselves and she made it obvious that our conversation was over... We enjoyed our stay, but if we ever went back to Key West we would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: sox33
Reviews.Content: I went down to Key West with my 3 girlfriends (all in our mid-twenties) for a long weekend getaway. La Concha was perfect for us because of it's location. It's right on Duval Street in the middle of all the shops, restaurants, bars and nightlife. Our room was in the back and overlooked the parking lot so it didn't get too noisey. The room was standard, we didn't spend a lot of time there so room size wasn't an issue. The concierge was excellent. She helped us with everything from finding a great dinner spot to renting bicycles. The service is also good. One night we blew the power out in our room, called down to the front desk and it was fixed in about 5 minutes. The one negative I can think of is the Elevator. There is one elevator for each side of the hotel and they are tiny. While we were there, there was a continuous high pitched beep on the elevator. The pool area left much to be desired. The actual pool is very small, only 3 feet. The pool area is also small and doesn't get much sun until after noon. It also gets very slippery so be careful! The pool gets very crowded in the afternoon so get there early! The roof deck bar and patio are great to watch the sunset. That also gets very very crowded so I'd say get there 30-45 minutes before sunset to get a good spot. There is a hut to rent bicycles and scooters out back of the hotel. Bikes are the way to go to see Key West! It was pretty cheap and much better than walking. Some places not to miss: Pepe's for breakfast, Mangoe's for dinner, there's a really good ice cream place across the street from the hotel (forgot the name!). Irish Kevins for drinks, all the bars on duval street!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, no issues for me”
Reviews.Author: ImATravelinFool
Reviews.Content: I arrived unannounced without any reservation. After trying two other hotels with no success, I found luck at this one. The walk-in rate was on-par with what I had previously seen on the internet and was much less than the offered walk-in rate at another nearby hotel. Since I was touring on a motorcycle, I never made any committed reservations to any hotel and this one wasn't on my list. I happened upon it while driving down Duval Street in search of a hotel after two strikeouts. This place was great for me because it was in walking distance to anything/everything I needed (food/sights/things to do & see). The hotel is old and parts of it are dated, however, my room was clean with newer furnishings. I was on the backside facing the parking lot per my request so I could see my bike and hear the alarm. Noise was not an issue for me as previous posters noted. however, I was so tired from riding, I could have slept standing against a wall in the lobby. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Key West always the best”
Reviews.Author: KWloverIowa
Reviews.Content: We were married in Key West and came back for our second aniversary at the beginning of April. We go to Key West about twice a year and have stayed at B&Bs, VRBO rentals and at the Crown Plaza, any and all of these places are great. We stayed at the Crown Plaza on this trip. I had read previous reviews about the Plaza not being clean and bad service. I'm here to tell you we had great customer service and our room was clean when we got there and was cleaned every day--of course it always helps if you tip for good service. Our favorite places for libations are the Schooner Wharf for entertainment and La Te Da for margarittas. We always meet great people---a special thanks to Paul at 101 Burbon for the aniversary drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Hotel A Little Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lightmyfire
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights in April and, as many have said, the location of the hotel is great if you want to be in the centre of the action, which suited us. It didn't excel in any other respects, the room was ok, if a bit small and tired and the bathroom was tiny. The buffet breakfast in Jacks just about scrapes a mediocre rating, it was never piping hot and the selection was the same every day. We would have gone elsewhere if it hadn't been prepaid. The staff were all courteous and helpful, but we couldn't help but notice that a majority of them were Eastern European. Nothing at all wrong with that, but we rather felt that the Hemingway and Truman connections to the hotel were somewhat sidelined as a result. The lobby area is lovely, but the space is largely wasted when a decent bar would be a major asset. Strange for a largish hotel that the existing bars were on the roof, by the pool and in the restaurant, which seems to operate separately from the hotel. All in all then, it wasn't a bad experience, but it wasn't a great one. Would I recommend anyone to stay there - no, but then again I wouldn't recommend them not to. On the plus side, nothing could take away the joy of Key West, to say that we loved it doesn't do it justice. We'll be back next year, but not to La Concha.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - But would not stay again !”
Reviews.Author: Smithford
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for three nights at the end of March, as part of multi centre holiday we had booked through a uk tour operator. Upon checking in we were not asked if we had a smoking preferance and were given a room on the second floor that was a smoking room overlooking the pool area. Upon complaint to reception we were moved to a fourth floor room overlooking the car park. Thought the rooms were dark and a little tired - even though this section was built in the late 80's- Crowne Plaza by name but certainly not in comfort. Air Con was very noisy in the room. Tried a quick Breakfast at Jacks one morning - waited an age for our food (Tea & Toast) , other people had got up and walked out, then another age for the bill. Parking was good and location excellant, Pool area was busy all of the times we went to lay out. Wifi was good and massive Flat Screen TV with good choice of channels. Upon checking out told there was no bill to settle as we had expected (Everything having been pre paid) but upon checking my credit card on line a few days later back in Orlando found I had been billed for the complete stay. I ccontacted the hotel to be told there was nothing they could do until the Monday morning after 10am! After being put on hold twice someone did finally deal with the problem and refunded my card, needless to say with the excchange rate differance I lost out almost Â£10.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Hikerman2007
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights the last week of March. Location is convenient , though the price of a room is on the high side. Our first night we stayed on the third floor facing Duval Street. My wife could not sleep because of the street noise, so the second night they gave us a fourth floor corner room on the back side of the hotel, which was not only quiet, but bigger. Other than that, we had no other complaints with the place. Parking is $20 a night plus taxes, $15 dollars a night if you are a Priority Club member. Our only suggestion, do not reserve a room on the Duval Street side of the building. The balcony you get with it is not worth the noise you have to put up with all night, especially the motorcycles.

Reviews.Title: “One Half of the hotel is a noisy disaster and should be removed from ICH reservation system”
Reviews.Author: matgas2005
Reviews.Content: Pricey Junior suits are all overlooking the Duval street (e.g. Harley strip). Which in principle means that your windows are still shaking at 4am? Lovely !!! That's why you get ear plugs together with CD (how to fall in sleep) on your bed when you arrive. Nick at the reception desk tried to persuade me that you receive ear plugs in all Crown Plazas ( ha, ha) Since I have Platinum Priority Club status and I have stayed at Plazas and Intercontinental hotels around the world I took this statement as an offence. I checked the windows and realised that management tried to fix the noise problem (probably in late 70's) with additional single glassing window frame nailed on the original historic windows. Disastrous combination since one more layer of glassing (no silicon between glassing and frame) is vibrating all night long. Itâ€™s funny that USA conquered the moon in 1969 but in 2009 a double or triple glassing that completely eliminates the outside noise is still a science fiction. I have to admit that at 4am we started to smile since the situation was so terrible. Next morning I went to the reception and negotiations on discounts for "no sleep" night + additional free breakfasts for our entire stay started and then we were finally moved to the room on the 6th floor overlooking the pool. That side of the hotel is much closer to the Crown Plaza standard, however that room has some issues as well. Pharaon Ants. So we were moved again. This time to the 4th floor overlooking the pool. So at last everything was OK. Final conclusion: No sleep for +300US$ room. No thanks. Rooms overlooking the Duval Street should be removed from ICHotels reservation system since hotel management failed to protect ICH guest from the outside noise, knowing that Duval street is a chalenging environment for hotels like Crowne Platza should be. This is not accaptable. I would wish that CEO of Key West Floridas Hotels llc operating this Crown Platza would sleep in those noisy rooms for at least a week and pay 300+ USD/ night in order to understand the agony its customers. But I have to say that helpfull staff should not be blaimed. At the end hotel showed significant flexibility on rates due to noise problem, but to be honest I didn't come to the Key west to further improve my negotiation skills.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: CCCharland
Reviews.Content: We couldnt have been happier at the location of this hotel - right in the middle of Duvall St. Didnt have to walk far for ANYTHING! Renting scooters was right at the back of the parking lot - dont talk the front desk about this thought cause they tell you they willsave you $5.00 but if you just go talk to the guy he gives you a bigger discount. Room was pretty clean and beds were comfortable,but they put us in a handicap room so there was no tub - I asked twice to have our room moved but was told there was nothing available. Since we were on the 2nd floor right by the elevators we heard alot of foot traffic but it wasnt anything we couldnt deal with. The bathroom - the shower kept overflowing - there wasnt a step or block to keep the water in the shower area so it kept flooding the bathroom floor. The tiles were alittle groady - i think they needed a good scrubing with a brush. The pool area was ok - kinda small, but clean. Didnt see anyone smoking in the pool or anything like the other reviewer stated. The bartender was excellent. Saw him out several times and he always came up and asked how we were doing and if we were enjoying our stay (didnt hurt that he was a little cutie :-) ). Oh - there is no hot tub - which would have been nice because my feet were killing me from walking all over Key West and since our room didnt have a tub I didnt have anywhere to soak them. It was in the middle of spring break but we didnt see too many Spring Breakers at all. The only loud part was the Haunted Tour that starts inthe lobby at 7 and 9 i think. The guy that did that tour was really obnoxious and LOUD! He got everyone yelling INSIDE the hotel - I felt that was wrong. There is another tour that isnt so obnoxious and really gets into the history of Key West - take that one instead. Parking was $20 a day - i think that was crazy - especially since other resorts on the island dont charge anything to park. If we go back the onlyreason we would stay there is because of the location. I have stayed 5 other places in Key West and this was the most convienant, but not the nicest.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience at La Concha”
Reviews.Author: foxgh
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in Key West and I was in town for a golf and fishing long weekend with old friends. Our group was aware that we were making this trip in the middle of College Spring Break and we were prepared for some of the general madness that comes with College Spring Break. We understood that staying in a hotel would be a lot louder than renting out our own house or group of villas, however, we were not prepared as to how bad it would be at La Concha. Friday night was horrible. The walls are very thin and you could hear Spring Breakers jumping on beds and playing loud music and yelling until 5 in the morning. We called security on numerous occassions and asked for their help but they were generally rude and apathetic to our issues. In fact, security came to our room once and woke us up because they said they had received complaints from another room about our room. Unfortunately for "Shayne" (not his real name), head of security, he had the wrong room number as we had been asleep for hours. Shayne did not apologize for the mixup. The pool scene during the day was entertaining... if you like men wearing American Flag Speedos and smoking cigarettes in the pool. When we asked head of hotel security if he could stop them from putting their cigarettes out in the pool, he said that he couldnt do anything unless he saw them do it. I have stayed at a lot of hotels but i have never seen a more apathetic and unfriendly security staff in my life. Besides, these issues, the hotel location was great and the bartender at the pool as well as the cleaning crew could not have been friendlier. As much as i hate to write negative reviews (this is my first), La Concha was a horrible experience and much of it was due to the hotel security, specifically Shayne.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-great rooms !!”
Reviews.Author: swiftyl
Reviews.Content: Perfect--you want to be on duvall street-very clean, good service. Close to everything--you park your car and walk to everything your entire stay ! Good pool and great lobby area for relaxing-starbucks on site !! Tip--out of front of hotel take a right on duvall and very close you will see a very small restuarant--serves crepes--fabulous !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Times”
Reviews.Author: libby123
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at La Concha and I must say it was fabulous. We were three girls and were allocated a nice room with 2 large very comfortable beds. The room didn't have a balcony but we were just by the roof terrace by the pool so every morning we grabbed coffee from Starbucks in the lobby, the papers and sat and enjoyed the morning sun. As it was just after Christmas, each morning we were treated to bell ringing from the nearby church and it was great. The room was a little dated but it was in keeping with the hotel and it was very clean and the bathroom was also good, spotless, lots of towels, good shower pressure! The pool was adequate, had a good supply of towels and a nice bar, but we used to go to Dante's on Caroline Street which is a bar with a large pool, lots of shade, and so long as you ordered lunch/drinks you could stay there all day. The lobby area was very colonial and cosy. We had drinks and the Sunday buffet in Captain Jacks Seafood Place, also in the hotel and this was also good. The barman was great and deserves a mention. Great seafood and icy cold beer. The View was a good place to see the sunset but did get a little crowded so after a few days we decamped to the Sunset Pier and enjoyed the sunset from there. All in this hotel cannot be beaten location wise. I would definitely stay here again. In fact I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: FLReviewer
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here. The location was perfect. We had a balcony room, but the room was very small. It would only hold a queen bed. You can hear everything in the other rooms and the partying on Duval Street. I guess that is why they give you a CD of sleep sounds. Should have been our first hint. They did try charging me a lot more than what I booked online so I recommend printing your confirmation information. They did end up giving me my room for the online price, but only after I had to go to the car and get my laptop and go to my room and get my laptop out, figure out their wi-fi, etc. They were unable to do it from their computer although all I did was go to their website and click on reservations and there it was. We only ate breakfasts at the hotel, but they have a restaurant and Starbucks in the hotel. They have an all you can eat buffet with drinks for $16 or you can order off the menu. My husband didn't care for the buffet. Said things were cold. I thought the food off the menu was good and I always love Starbucks. We had the usual housekeeping problems, such as no coffee left one day and no soap the next, but it was clean and the flat screen tv was almost as wide as the bed. I felt the hotel was a bit pricey for what they offer but the location was great. Oh, they do charge $20 a night to park.

Reviews.Title: “great service from an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: BristolKen
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the La Concha for one night during a tour of Florida. Cannot fault the hotel or service in any way. Our room was very clean and spacious with good views.

Reviews.Title: “Great Duval Street location! Excellent pool area for relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: Travel2Explore
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Concha for a girls' get-away trip in February 2009. The location of the hotel was perfect - walking distance to Mallory Square in one direction and to the Southern Most Point in the other. The room was nice and the beds were very comfortable. Our room was right outside the entrance to the pool area. The pool deck was extremely quiet , the lounge chairs were comfortable and the pool-side bar was nice. Perfect place to get some sun between 10 AM & 4 PM. The service was fairly good - the hotel staff provided extra towels & amenities as requested every day. The only complaint is that the walls were pretty thin - we could definitely hear everything happening in the hall or in the rooms next door. We didn't eat at the restaurant at the hotel but we did hit the Starbucks every morning. We had a drink at the Roof Top Bar - it had a nice view, but the outside lounge was not very impressive. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha”
Reviews.Author: LollyMoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days Dec 30 - Jan 3). As others have said, GREAT location. The hotel itself has a little glitch or two, but nothing so terrible that I wouldn't stay there again. We are priority club members and used points, and the hotel did give us a better room than we originally had booked (higher floor, non-smoking room, but two double beds instead of a king). Front desk staff was very helpful and accommodating. I.e., the grab rail in our tub broke off the wall and we reported it to the front desk, and they sent somone up immediately. Also, I told the young man at the front desk that the ladies room in the lobby was in disgraceful shape and needed attention desperately and again, they sent someone in immediately. Still shouldn't have let it get that bad to begin with, but I digress. Things to note: rooms are smallish, but adequate. Very few electrical outlets. Bring a power strip for cell phone chargers, camera chargers, etc. Beds are comfy and have plenty of pillows. Full size iron and ironing board. Plenty of drawer space. No mini bar or fridge (at least in our room). Towels are fine, but the housekeeping staff took the bathmat the first morning and never replaced it; they also forgot to replace face cloths and didn't restock toiletries or replace the coffee cup that was missing our entire stay. Pool area is small and fills up quickly and early. Hotel restaurant (Jack's) is a place to pass on - overpriced and only average food. Too many other great spots to eat within steps of the hotel. Sunset at the Top (rooftop bar) is not to be missed. We also brought our coffee/breakfast up there in the morning (brought, not bought, as there is no restaurant up there) and enjoyed a view of the entire island. During your stay in Key West, a "must do" is having a meal at Latitudes on Sunset key. You have to have reservations and take the ferry over. Food and atmosphere are wonderful! Also, check out Catamaran Echo for a sunset champagne cruise. Small and personalized and not jam packed like the other, bigger companies. Blue Heaven for breakfast is a good bet, but be prepared to wait. If you are thinking of next New Year's Eve, Key West is a blast, but be aware that NYE is the busiest day of the entire year on Key West. Crowds are huge, but fun. Have fun and enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “NYE 2008 in unhelpful hotel”
Reviews.Author: StAugustinePainter
Reviews.Content: We came to key west to see the best of florida. This hotel has a great location, but the staff are very unhelpful. Our Room was not clean until 4pm NYE, not helpful. I would avoid this place I am Priority Club PLATINUM member...but still no service was provided. Very hard to have a good holiday in a room which is not clean for 75% of the day!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Old hotel”
Reviews.Author: meg1621
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said, the location of this hotel is second to none. It's right in the middle of the main street (Duval) where restaurants and bars are all over the place. The rooms were extremely old and because of that, they looked dingy and almost dirty. Staff was helpful. Pool and pool bar were great!

Reviews.Title: “Who cares? Not the staff!!”
Reviews.Author: justmeNorfolk
Reviews.Content: This hotel can skate by because of its location right on Duval Street. However, you have to ask to have your room cleaned and stand watch over the housekeeper in order to have the job done properly. (Our housekeeper spoke an unidentified eastern European language so we had to use hand signals to tell her we wanted our glasses cleaned, the bathroom floor mopped, fresh linens, etc.) Otherwise, they will do as little as possible and leave if they even show up. I was truly disgusted by the condition of the room but the staff would not move us and I had unfortunately prepaid through an internet booking service. The walls had substances dripped down them, there were brown spots on the walls of the bathroom, hairs in the tub and unknown sticky substances on the carpet. It was difficult to get anyone to clean and a string of excuses were given. I would never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,old Key West charm!”
Reviews.Author: dnjlyke2travel
Reviews.Content: When planning our recent vacation to Key West, we wanted someplace close to the action, and we didn't really want the hassle of renting a car. The La Concha fit our needs perfectly. The central location on Duvall is just a few blocks from Mallory Square, and just about everything else in town. We found the hotel staff very friendly, courteous and atttentive to any of our needs. The concierge staff (Barbara & Frank) were most helpful in assiting us with our planned adventures. Our balcony offered a fantastic view of Duvall Street and the ever changing parade of tourist and locals. We found the hotel property to be clean and very well maintained. The pool is small, and 3ft deep, but with the ocean on one side and the Gulf on the other, who has time to swim in a pool in KW? The view of Key Wests' legendary sunsets are awesome from the rooftop!

Reviews.Title: “a really nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: boyandgirl
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nights at end of sept, its in a fab location right on duval street, so really close to the action the rooms nice and clean, pool area small but nice. think key west is a great place and will definately go back one day and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “One for the older generation”
Reviews.Author: Brigham
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights 23-26 September with family and had a really nice relaxed time. As a Platinum member I got an upgrade to a corner suite over Duval, nice to have some priveleges from working/travelling the year! If you arrive during a downpour and park your car in the hotel car park, be prepared to negotiate several inches of water to reception! Room was good and spacious, however, the air con had to fight to keep the temps down to 70 but that isn't a biggie. Bar was good but a bit pricey and nighttime service was good. Breakfast was not so good and service on two different days was not really to Crowne Paza standards. One day the breakfast came out unchecked and not cooked as we ordered, next day it was soooooo slow but the girl serving was trying her hardest. To me, it was the supervision and service in the kitchens at fault. Pool was small and really shallow (3ft all round) so a bit of a let down, the pool bar was closed (out of season?). The view from the roof bar was great and sunset drinks are a must. The hotel is set in the best possible location for nightlife in Key West and is only a short/medium walk to all of the attractions. One of the reception staff (lovely girl) has a Scots father but sadly she supports Celtic! Tried changing her mind but to no avail, she will in time... In all, apart from the rather disapointing pool, the CP in Key West is a lovely place to stay and well within the beliefs and standards of Crowne Plaza Many thanks Rangers for the treble!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jazzed
Reviews.Content: Came for a bachelor party. Great location on Duvall, in the middle of the nightlife and close to the docks. Concierge is knowledgeable and helpful. They put out a yummy citrus drink like lemonade every day. Beds are comfy! Comfortable quiet room. Rooftop bar is cool at sunset. Great staff. Pool is a little dead, but you should be out and about anyway. Would definitely stay here again. Have traveled the world and this hotel does it right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Old School Resort”
Reviews.Author: Baxheadcase
Reviews.Content: This property was my first stay in Key West and I loved it. The staff was great and I showed up early, was upgraded because of using points, and had a great room. The property is located right in the middle of Duval street and you can just park your car and walk to anywhere. The room I had was a corner suite with a balcony and it was great. The property is old, but the rooms were very clean and decorated nicely. The pool area is a great place to chill out at during the day and is very refreshing. At the Top was great as you could see 360 degrees around the island as this property is the highest in Key West. I would go back and stay at this hotel again and refer anyone who wants to have a great hotel in the middle of Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place near Duval St.”
Reviews.Author: winthropdsb
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed at La Concha on Sept. 3rd -5th. The concierge was very nice and helpful. The rooms were clean and neat. They give you a sound CD to help you sleep. The beds were comfortable. There is a Starbucks downstairs along with another restaurant/bar. As in other reviews, the only thing I would change is to make the pool area larger and to remodel the bar on the roof. You can not beat this location on Duval Street. We did not have to get in our car once. We walked everywhere. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: jlong003
Reviews.Content: Our Trip was August 10-14. The hotel was very nice, marble floors, beautiful. Our room was average size but very clean. The pool was small and often got to crowded, it was on 3 ft, the entire pool. The veiw from the top is very beautiful. The bar at the top is a major rip off ( my husband paid $8.00 for a Corona...ouch!). The hotel is in the heart of Duval and walking distance to most things. However, if I return I would get a hotel closer to the beach, it's a bit of a walk. On our last day the hotel kept our bags while we were in town till our flight left, that was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: Welshwiz3
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location - restaurants on doorstep, easy walk to Mallory Square and major entertainment. Hotel was clean and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accommodation”
Reviews.Author: belf0101
Reviews.Content: I dont have anything bad to say about this hotel, the location is great everything at your door step which is rare, rooms are large and quiet, very pretty inside the reception. The Pool size is all you need, sunbathing space too. and you can hear everthing from the street whilst lazying. Definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: pmatts19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at LaConcha during our second trip to Key West and loved it. The location was great, the beds were comfortable. We didn't have a balcony room for the first two nights but had one the last two nights. Hotel staff moved our luggage for us while we were out exploring. We didn't have any problem sleeping, we just clipped the curtains closed and slept like babies. My only complaint is how small the rooms are - not much room to move. In our first room, our windows were very dirty. The balcony room was fun, we love to people watch and what a great place to do it from. We rented scooters from the outfit in the parking lot. We had a riot. It's a great way to get around the island if you want to see more. It was very easy to find parking for the scooters also. I would recommend renting them. We ate breakfast at Blue Heaven one morning, the food was great as was the atmosphere. Even though the upstairs bar was only open for a few hours, the rooftop itself was open so you could still go up there and enjoy the view. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: livinitupPalmBeach
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend with four other couples. What a great hotel! It's located close to all the "action". I had read reviews that the rooms were small- but ours as fine. MOdern and clean and much nicer than we expected. The staff was very polite and friendly. The lobby was beautiful and relaxing. We all met there each evening before dinner to share what we did all day. It has a nice pool area and outside tables on most floors to sit and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: TakesPix
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a last minute trip to Key West, and the La Concha had been suggested as a good place to stay by a friend. We typically prefer resort type establishments when visiting a location such as Key West, but for the two nights we were going to be there, the price was right and they had a king non-smoking room available, so we booked it. (Hint: even if the web site shows they are sold out, call direct to book because they often have rooms available still) Our Priority Club membership gave us 25% off the normal $20 per night parking rate. Although the hotel was sold out, we were still able to get a spot in their lot. Once we parked we never moved the car until we left Key West. Check-in was pleasant and efficient, and we got what we had reserved. On taking the elevator to the third floor we were a little dismayed to find our room literally in front of the elevator. We were concerned about noise, although in the long run we were never bothered by it. The room overlooked Duval Street, and one of the few negatives was that not only did the windows not open, but they were so dirty that we could barely see what was going on outside. Although there was a street festival going on, we were never bothered by noise from the outside either. The room was very clean except for the windows as previously mentioned. It was also one of the smallest hotel rooms I've ever stayed in. The entire room including the bathroom was under 175 square feet--think the size of a smaller cabin on a cruise ship. It contained a king bed, two small nightstands, a chair, a drop leaf table--there was no room to open the leafs--an armoire with a TV (not flat screen if you are one of those who this type of thing is important to), and another small table with enough room for a coffee maker and highly overpriced bottle of Evian if you were interested in such. The very small closet contained an iron and board as well as a luggage rack, which could only be opened outside the closet due to size constraints. There is no safe in the room for your valuables. Contrary to the Crowne Plaza web site, the rooms do not contain a mini-fridge, and if you order one to be delivered you will be charged $25 per night. We just brought up the small cooler we had in the car and filled it with ice instead--I'm not sure where they would have possibly fit a minifridge in that room anyhow! The bathroom was stocked with four sets of average hotel towels and decent quality toiletries. The lemon scented soap was a nice touch and seemed to fit the style of the hotel. Be warned, the king size bed only has four full sized pillows of average quality. The blanket was a summer weight style and was triple sheeted. The hotel had a great rooftop bar with the "Larry and Dora" duo providing entertainment as we all watched the sun set from a great vantage point. We ate at Jack's Seafood Shack off the lobby our first night, the food was so-so, service was about the same. The best part about this hotel is its convenient location. We easily walked to both ends of Duval Street during our short stay. We found several liquor stores, a small grocery store, a pharmacy, and several different banks with ATM's all within a few blocks. It is no more than five blocks from most of the Key West major points of interest, including the Hemingway House, Sloppy Joe's, Hog's Breath, The Little White House, Mallory Square, etc. If you are inclined, the trolley stops within a block of the hotel, although we found it very convenient to just walk everywhere. We would definitely choose the La Concha again for a short trip, although if we were planning on a stay of more than a couple of nights we would probably opt for one of the local resorts (Pier House, Sunset Key, etc.) for a higher level of amenities and a more spacious guest room. I know some people have complained about street noise in previous reviews, we weren't bothered by it at all--although I can see how some very light sleepers would be. The hotel does provide ear plugs, a sleep mask, a sleep CD, and drap clips to keep the room really dark. The rooms has individually controlled central air--no noisy window A/C units. There is a pool, although we never made it there for a swim. For the price in Key West, it was a good value. Other than the location it was actually pretty basic, and as I mentioned earlier, it was by far one of the smallest rooms I've ever had at a hotel. As long as you don't mind the small room you'll probably find the La Concha to your liking. If you are only looking for a clean room to sleep and shower in, the La Concha will be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: simpsonvillegirl
Reviews.Content: We were first-time Key West travelers and knew nothing about the island. This hotel is in the heart of the action so everything we wanted to do was just a stroll away. However, no matter how crazy Duval Street was, inside the hotel was calm and peaceful. Our room was cool and comfortable and we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A minute”
Reviews.Author: doogan22
Reviews.Content: away from all the main attractions the gorgeous island has to offer.
