We fell out of bed each day and strolled on Duval Street to to make our way to our favorite breakfast spot (Blue Heaven). In the evening we enjoyed a few sunsets at the rooftop bar. There was a band that played along in the back ground which was really cool and relaxing. We preferred to dine at other Key West local places, yet tried Jack's downstairs one night. The food was good though. We decided on having a balcony which was great if you like to smoke and people watch. It cost a bit more, but hey your on vacation. Overall, we loved this hotel and plan on returning. The only thing that you have to remember is that roosters start sounding off at 4am! Make sure to use the earplugs the hotel gives you, we didn't realize they were there until our last day!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Penelope1975
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Key West. My husband was here during his "college days." I had researched right here on TripAdvisor the different hotels in Key West. After reading the reviews, we decided that this hotel was the ideal choice for us. I booked online through the Holiday Inn website. I had wanted a king N/S but none were available at that time. We booked a queen N/S. Imagine my surprise when we checked in that we had been upgraded to a 2-room king N/S suite...the Tennessee Williams suite...and just because were are Priority Club members! (we had just joined within the last several months) The location of the hotel is what sold us. It is within walking distance of most of the popular attractions, bars, restaurants, etc. We purchased the Key West Passport online before leaving Illinois. It included entrance fees to several tourist attractions, and all day off/on rides on the Trolley. One of the 12 Trolley stops is right at the La Concha. Ours was only a three day/two night visit. We thoroughly enjoyed Key West and the La Concha. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, great location”
Reviews.Author: Gitouttaheah
Reviews.Content: Four days at La Concha, all wonderful. Can't beat the location. Our room was a bit small, but well appointed and very comfortable. Pool was SO nice for cooling off during the hot afternoon. This is a historic hotel. The only quibble I have is that the sign doesn't say "Crowne Plaza," it says "La Concha," which made it just a bit hard to find at first. We'd love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Crackin Concha”
Reviews.Author: LittleRich
Reviews.Content: Great location within Key West, smack on Duval street which is where all the good stuff is!! Good sized rooms, especially if you can do a little deal with front desk and manage an upgrade (much easier if not visiting in US peak season). If you have 2 nights in Key West, definitely worth watching one of the sunsets from the roof top bar - complete with live music, who managed to time the ending of the song perfectly with the setting of the sun.......goose bump moment, was great. Nice pool, not huge, but serves it's purpose. Well equipped gym, with CV equipment and free weights. Really enjoyed the stay, would go back there in a heart beat!!

Reviews.Title: “Love La Concha! Best place to stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: dianew1
Reviews.Content: I am sad writing this because I am no longer in Key West! We visit KW every year and have stayed at a few other properties but this is home in Key West now. The people at this hotel are fantastic - from bell hop Phil to Nick at the pool bar - they are very welcoming and fun. We stayed 3 nights and always go left out of the hotel on Duval for a fun time! This is a lovely hotel in the very best location on Key West - what more could a traveler ask for? Can't wait to go back and will definitely stay here again - only 355 days to go!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: dotravel
Reviews.Content: We (2 couples) traveled on a road trip from PA to Key West and stayed one night at this hotel.We LOVED it and wished we would have stayed longer to enjoy the whole atmosphere of Key West a little longer.There is so much to do! Great shopping,food and bars! The Hotel was top notch in atmosphere,cleanliness,and staff VERY accomodating.You step out the front door right onto Duval street and all the action.Beds were VERY comfortable!! Would go back in a minute!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: wirerepair
Reviews.Content: excellent location, right on Duval St, within walking distance to everything Upgraded us to a bedroom suite which was huge. Would definitely stay there again due to location, location, location

Reviews.Title: “Great little getaway - consistent service each year!”
Reviews.Author: KAllan07
Reviews.Content: My husband is a Priority Club member so we use his points to visit Key West each year. This was our fourth visit to Key West and our third stay at the La Concha and it was the best stay yet! We were upgraded because of his Priority Club status to a room on the second floor with a balcony that overlooked Duval Street. This was the best room we've had and we'll be requesting it on our future visits! Each morning we sat outside and enjoyed the rising sun and people watching and each night we enjoyed coming home from a long day/night of eating, drinking, shopping, and sight-seeing and doing the same on the balcony. The only negative about this room was that the french doors weren't very sound proof and it was bike week so was extremely loud at all hours with the bikes reving their motors and drunk college kids on spring break. We just made sure we had enough to drink ourselves to fall asleep through the noise! The pool was nice - it's small but is very clean and has comfortable chairs to lie in and a nice pool bar with music. The water was cool and refreshing, which was nice since the weather was warm and a bit sticky. We flew into Ft. Lauderdale and drove the gorgeous drive down Rt. 1 so it's good for others to know that the La Concha has parking for its guests at $19.00/day (or $14.50/day if you're a PC member). We did have a few days when we took the car out where there were no more spaces, much because of motorcycles taking up a spot a piece, but a few minutes would go by and a space would open up. We didn't eat at the new Jack's restaurant but we did stop in for a drink before retreating to our room and the bartender was lacking personality to say the least. The drink menu was quite limited - we were looking for a nice nightcap martini or drink and resorted to glasses of Brut. Having a Starbucks right in the hotel is an added bonus as well for a good cup of java in the morning! We truly enjoyed our stay and ate at some fantastic restaurants, drank at some great bars, and visited some wonderful local shops and spent a whole bunch of money! The La Concha has been consistent in our 3 stays with the cleanliness of the rooms, the courtesy of the staff, and the fantastic location of the hotel. Although I'd like to try a small B&B during one of our future stays, La Concha will always be our hotel of choice each year in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “best in key west”
Reviews.Author: dmorsillo
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights and had not 1 single complaint from my picky wife. stumbling distance to the best clubs on the island too, which is worth a few exrta bucks in my book. Dan & lori from western pa........RIP MYRON

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Near Everything & Great Rooftop Bar”
Reviews.Author: wutsnext
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Crowne Plaza La Concha and overall it it a great hotel. There are a few minor problems which I always seem to encounter but not major. The hotel is right on Duvual Street and everything is within a few blocks to walk to. The front desk staff is hit or miss. Being a Priority Club Member I have always had an upgrade. I knew the hotel was sold out but I didn't expect to have the room next to the ice machine. It was noisy so I did request a different room which was much nicer from a different staff member and was quickly accomodated. The rooms are clean, quality linens and very comfortable bed. The lighting is strange as there were lamps with no outlets to plug them in? I also feel that if the hotel gave coupons (which they use to) for discounts on their restaurant meals and drinks at the rooftop bar I would have tried Captn Jacks or the breakfast buffet. The rooftop bar is great for the sunset and is crowded but offers a nice view of the cruise ships also. I also take advantage of the smoking rooms which are almost nonexistent in Key West. I use my AAA for a discount but would never pay over $300 for a room even in high season. If you want a 3+ star hotel that is clean, safe and in the best location to see and do everything then this is it. I most likely will return and probably stay at the La Concha.

Reviews.Title: “Good, although I have had nicer rooms on prior stays”
Reviews.Author: Buffett79
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a number of times in the past and will be returning in early March. However, on my last stay (Feb 8-11) our room was much smaller than rooms I've had in the past. Also, the vanity/sink was in poor repair as the water faucet handles could actually be lifted off of their base. The linens seemed a bit more worn/tired vs. past stays as well. The location is great, and the pool is very nice however for $300 per night the room should be in a little better repair.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bodari
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our vacation to Key West and my husband and I stayed at the Crown Plaza and loved this hotel. We used our priority club points and were upgraded to the Hemmingway Suite which was sooo pretty. The hotel is in a great location if you plan on bar hopping and eating a lot, as we did! We had a wonderful time and would definately book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accomodations”
Reviews.Author: cupcakeRN
Reviews.Content: A long weekend in Key west....we were so impressed with this hotel...great location,room...very clean...would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Key West First Timer!”
Reviews.Author: Coastalpines
Reviews.Content: We stayed at LaConcha in mid-November with a small group of friends for a birthday/getaway long weekend. Upon arrival we were pleasantly surprised at the the beauty and location of this hotel. Our rooms were not ready as we arrived early, but who cares, you are in Key West! The lobby is beautiful, as is the landscaping in the courtyard/pool area. There was a wedding in the hotel and that looked beautiful as well. The rooms are clean, the baths large and the CD player/radio is a bonus when you want to avoid television on vacation. Our only issue was the rooms weren't cleaned early enough, but after the 1st day, we planned our afternoons around it. The sunset view from the "Top" was spectacular, but get there early if you want a seat and a front row view. This was my first trip to Key West, all of my companions had been before. I cannot WAIT to go back. Wonderful food, drink and sights to see. My top recommendations The Butterfly Sanctuary was the BEST Breakfast at Two Friends Lunch at My Blue Heaven Lunch at Carolines Dinner at Seven Fish Anytime at Schooner Wharf Sebago Sunset Cruise The Caberet was interesting, and of course Mallory Square at Sunset while drinking a stronnng cuban coffee to refresh us for the evening to come! Avoid the restaurant in the hotel, it's overpriced for what you get and there are too many other options! If you are looking for an affordable, close to everything, place to sleep and shower, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the La Concha”
Reviews.Author: Cajindy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a excellent location. It is a short walk to Mallory Square or the beaches. Being on Duval it has great advantages to all the action. We had a room on the back and it was extremely quiet. We originally were placed in a balcony room over looking Duval St. Unfortunately the rooms were smoking and I am a non smoker so we changed immediately. I would like to have a balcony room. Very Nice. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The view from the top is worth the trip. We are already planning a longer trip next year. I am very picky on hotels and would rate this very high on service, location and overall appearance. Jacks the hotel restaurant was good on service and quality.

Reviews.Title: “La Concha-smart”
Reviews.Author: KANEY1979
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay a La Concha. Thought the hotel was smart with helpful and friendly staff, the hotel lobby was very attractive. The hotel boasts a rich history, such as Hemmingway writing novels there and even Al Capone stayed there apparently. The hotel is apparently haunted by a waiter that fell down an elavator shaft in the early 1980's in a freak accident, if you feel a tap on your shoulder and no one is there or if you see someone standing over you whilst in bed, like a friend of mine in another room believes he did, it might just be him. This hotel is very convieniently located and the view from The Top at sunset is amazing. The barman at The Top, Zak, was cool. Jack's seafood Shack was nice for breakfast however I recommend the Bistro next to Mallory square. Key West overall was great, lots of booze and sunshine. However avoid at all costs the jet skiing at 0 Duval Street, 'Old Town Tours', they will rip you off, claiming you have had an collision when you quite clearly hadn't.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ftpjtm
Reviews.Content: We had another great stay at this beautiful hotel. I don't understand those who give this hotel negative reviews. I am pretty picky, but I once again (we also stayed here about 2 years ago) loved this hotel. It is an older hotel, but it is in beautiful condition. The room was classy, clean, and luxurious. The only negative I can offer is that there was no refridgerator or mini-bar. You can rent a refridgerator. We booked a package which included breakfast, and the breakfast was a very nice hot buffet. The staff was attenative and helpful. The lobby was immaculately clean with classy decor. The parking was adequate - we were there during a VERY busy time and it was a relief to have easy acces to parking in this part of town (there is a charge for parking). The pool is nice, as is the roof top bar. The hotel is located amongst the bars and nightlife of Key West. If you want peace and quiet, look elsewhere! This part of town is not for you - so don't stay here. But if you are here for the night-life, this is the place to be. Walk out the door, and you have arrived at the center of activity. The front of the hotel can be noisy when Key West is crazy with activity. If you want to avoid noise, ask for a room in the back of the hotel. This hotel is not the best bargain in town - it is much cheaper to stay a few miles away from down town. But is you want to stay in the center of Key West's activity, stay here and HAVE FUN!!

Reviews.Title: “Great all round hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: panda22
Reviews.Content: Location very good - very central in Duval Street. Good clean modern hotel - lovely pool. Would recommend. If driving - difficult to spot as signage is very poor - remember the building number.

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was lovely”
Reviews.Author: panyan1960
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night in this hotel in 2003. Our main base was up near tampa and we took a few days touring the Keys and staying in hotels en route. We booked the stay (2 rooms for 5of us) using Priority points. Both rooms were lovely and the old fashioned decor suited the hotel, giving it the feel of an old English country hotel. The hotel staff were very friendly and we felt out of place turning up in our casual clothes (after a day on the beach) and with our plastic carrier bags! Didn't eat in the hotel as there is so much choice in Key West. Wish we had booked an extra night as we loved the place! If we get to Key West again will definately stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not what i was expecting for the money”
Reviews.Author: bdcow
Reviews.Content: the room was not much bigger than a large walk in closet. the pictures on their web site are very decieving, or i just stayed in the smallest room they have. everything is loud. there is no soundproofing in this hotel at all!!!! when a room above or next to you on either side flushes the toilet, you hear the liquid run down the pipes. somewhat nausating to be honest. you hear the flush of every toilet within a hundred yards. if someone turns on a faucet you hear it. i wont even begin to explain the showers. the room is dusty, especially in the air conditioning vents. the hotel claims to have renovated in 2006, but i think they skiped my room. i would also say the pool is nothing like the pics, you could not possibly swim in it. its more like a large hot tub overall i am very very disapointed with this stay. on a positive note it couldnt be more conviently located.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: babair
Reviews.Content: Key West is fun, fun, fun. Staying at La Concha means that you are always just a short stumble to the next great bar or attraction. We enjoyed the pool and bar, and the view from The Top during sunset. On the down side, the room was pretty small -- like European Small. And for some reason we did not get a visit from housekeeping. The windows were pretty dirty and didn't open either, so it was hard to judge the weather. Parking was $19/day.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL IN EVERYWAY”
Reviews.Author: TravelTheWorldVIP
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel.Myself as well as 3 friends booked this hotel for 1 night on a friday. We are all 23 yrs of age and all came to Key West to party. The hotel is great just for that i mean you are located on Duval st basically in front of every good bar and restaurant. The parking was a little steep at 19.00 a night but it was right in back of the hotel. We left our car there the whole time we stayed and just walked to everything. The pool is extra small but we didnt come to the keys to be in a pool. The sun deck by the pool is great a large area.Great nightlife in Key West couldnt beet the drink prices our restaurant prices we paid about 25.00 a pearson to eat at an all you can eat crab and shrimp buffet great food.In all i will be back to key west and will be staying in the crowne plaza again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MarkKv
Reviews.Content: Apparently, when you book though Orbitz or Expedia, this hotel and probably many others do not guarantee whether or not you room is going to be smoking or not. That's what happened with us at Crown Plaza Hotel in Key West. I booked thought Orbitz and then called them to confirm, at which point I specifically said that I need a non-smoking room. The answer I got from the reservation desk was: "Yes, sure!" However, when I arrived, I learned that they do not have what I needed but they were able to quickly find a substitution - a luxury room on the top floor, which was a great deal. The area is great - central in all ways you go. The staff was very helpful and knowledgeable so we truly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “The La Concha is a perfect hotel for anyone's stay in Key West.”
Reviews.Author: Akrongal
Reviews.Content: I don't understand how anyone could give a bad review of this hotel. I had the pleasure of staying at La Concha for the week prior to the New Years festivities, as well as the week after. It is the perfect hotel for anyone who wishes to kick back, relax and have a few drinks. I spent every afternoon laying out by the pool, or enjoying the company of the bartender, Nic at the pool bar. He was extremely entertaining and a great person to talk to at the hotel. The concierge was also extremely helpful in helping us book our snorkeling trip and our trip to the dry tortugas. As far as the rooms and the remainder of the atmosphere of the hotel... it was great. You can't expect to stay in a historic hotel and have it furnished in modern decor. That would destroy the hotel's ethnicity. As for me, I plan to revisit Key West next year, and I will be staying at the La Concha.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old Key West”
Reviews.Author: Jerrwin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old Key West charm, with a modern touch. Its been very well restored. The room were updated nicely, but a bit small. The pool is small, more like a large whirlpool, but has a nice pool bar close. Parking was tricky, because construction was going on in the alley you use to get to the front entrance and we drove right pass it the first time. The top floor is a great place to view the sunset and has a nice bar that only open during the sunset watching time. I would recommend this hotel without any hesitation, but the service in the restaraunt was terrible and the food so,so. Duvall St is right out front and everything is in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for stumbling to and from duval street”
Reviews.Author: SHFT54
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel in Key West. It's right on Duval street, which is where just about everything is. The rooms are a little old, but they're comfortable, and clean. The lobby is nice and features a cafe. Location is what really makes this hotel. It's close to Mallory square where a large crowd gathers everyday for the sunset, as well as all the bars and nightlife that make Key West famous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the middle of old Key West”
Reviews.Author: merlinslap
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this excellent hotel and were completely satisfied with the location, the service, our room, and the entire facility. It has been refurbished to its original 1920's decor. A fun place to stay in Key West, and watching the sunset from the roof is the best view in town.

Reviews.Title: “memorable wedding”
Reviews.Author: canton88
Reviews.Content: Our son got married in Key West and we chose the Crowne Plaza for the location. What a wonderful experience. Our room was spotless, very quite and comfortable. The entire staff made our stay a pleasure. The pool was beautiful and the food at Jacks was great. The Crowne Plaza made our entire family's stay a pleasure. Thanks It was great.

Reviews.Title: “smack dab in the middle of Duval Street”
Reviews.Author: 1234casey
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for younger crowd. First time to key west with my husband (were both mid 20's). We booked this hotel for first 3 nights and then The Inn for the 2nd two. This one puts you exactly in the middle of duval. It's about a mile to one side (Beach) and 3/4 a mile to the other (Mallory Square). We walked both ways on separate days; there are tons of shops and places to eat or drink. If you want to stay right near the water, this place is not for you. It's pool should not even be called a pool. It is on the 4th floor and is very very small. Although there is an outdoor bar and a medium area for laying out and tanning. I think the pool is the biggest drawback. Downstairs is a very nice, yet somewhat casual restaurant, and the lobby is very immaculate/grand. Staff was above average and we were even allowed to check in at 1, when normal check in time is 4. The rooms were very clean, and cleaned daily. You can hear vaccums and tv's if loud between rooms, and room size is smaller (as is the first hotel in the area). However, nice beds with sleep cd's provided. We were on the side facing duval and could clearly hear motorcycles, but not people/music. However, if traveling during a peak time, would imagine unless you're a stay up late person, you would not enjoy facing Duval Street. We ordered room service one time, and were pleasantly suprside by very quick service and great quality foods. I even asked for a sandwich not offered and was provided it without question. Bathrooms again small, but nice quality and clean. Paper delivered daily and top quality coffee stocked. There is a starbucks downstairs and parking is, as quoted, 19 dollars a day. Worst part was the 20 dollars extra (on top of parking) for daily service. Our three night stay was quite expensive and is the only downside of this hotel. There was construction during our stay, but we did not see or hear any of it, as some others have reported. Overall: We would definitely stay again. Pros: GREAT location, above average hotel, nice staff Cons: unknown fee added, with that and parking one night puts you about 250.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: golfgod76
Reviews.Content: Love it, came for a nice vacation and felt at home. Jacks seafood shack is Great, the barstaff was so friendly and made our trip fantastic!!!! very helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Key West Treasure”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixTravelgal
Reviews.Content: Room 554 was really nice King room with a great view of the pool. The room seemed very new and updated. Very clean with lots of amenites. Lots of counter space in the bathroom. Very quiet. The hotel rooftop is fun at sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: OceanLove3
Reviews.Content: We got this room on Priceline for $200. The hotel is right on Duval, so the location couldn't be better. The pool area is horrible. The pool looks like a splash pool and is only 3 ft deep. It's also very tiny. Disappointing for a hotel of this size. The fitness center looks like a closet with a treadmill, bike and elliptical machine. The walls are paper thin. You can hear your neighbors, and ours happen to be incontinent, flushing the toilet every 20 minutes or so. Our room faced Duval and the noise didn't bother us at all. We live in a city and are used to noise, but I guess if you're from the middle of nowhere, it can be bothersome. Overall, stay here for the location but not for a great pool scene.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Cricketer11
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 3 nights at this Hotel and all I can say is it is all about the location location. It is very centrally located at within easy reach of everything.The rooms are very small and leaves no room for anything else. TV not very good and staff could not care less about anything you have to say. Food is just average and service so so. It is not worth the money paid, but it is a good location. WOuld not return to this Hotel again. Not good valure for money

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great experience”
Reviews.Author: leelee5876
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here in mid February of this year. We did not have a car, and found the hotel to be excellent for location. It is near to everything we wanted to do. We were upgraded to one of the larger rooms overlooking the pool. W e started each day with Starbucks, spent every afternoon at the pool, although it was small, and we really enjoyed the drinks! And walked to every bar we wanted to visit, and stumbled home from most. We had a great experience at La Concha.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: JoeyG
Reviews.Content: Nice. Yes, it's a bit noisy but you are in the heart of Duval St. We went during spring break so our college age daughter could go with us, one last trip with Mom and Dad? Yes, they do provide ear plugs and it's not a bad idea to use them, even though we were overlooking the pool, not the street. Go for a room on that side by the way, quieter. It's what you expect of a Crowne Plaza, clean, nice bathroom products, everyhting works. Pool was a little crowded, spring break, and not the greatest sun angles. Skip the Ghost tour that leaves from the lobby, it's bad. I've done vampire and cemetery tours in New Orleans that were sooo much better. Try the crepe place just north of the hotel, same side of the street. Made fresh to order with the grill facing the street, great product.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED La Concha!”
Reviews.Author: jerzgirl62
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Crowne Plaza La Concha. My husband almost cancelled our reservations after reading some of the bad reviews and are SO glad we didn't! Our room on the 4th floor overlooking the pool was HUGE! We could have fit my car in the room along with the 2 double beds. The lobby was beautiful, and the staff was great. The pool area, although small was really nice. Our kids had fun splashing in the pool as my husband and i sipped a cocktail at the bar. We can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than We Expected”
Reviews.Author: BigBird27
Reviews.Content: I was really quite nervous staying here after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor but it just goes to show you really have to take it all with a pinch of salt. We stayed for 3 nights at the end of March / beginning of April and having been there now cant see how these reviews reflect the real hotel- I was amazed, the overall atmosphere is very upmarket- grand lobby, lovely outside areas (pool bigger than the hotel we stayed in in Miami- cold but big enough!) and although our room was a little dark the furnishings were brand new- the staff were really helpful and the location perfect. I've stayed in many Crowne Plazas and this was one of the better ones- I noticed whilst we were there that they were advertising building works at the property but I didnt see this or hear this really at all- I noticed them painting the outside and obviously they are sprucing things up- I guess some rooms are still the old style but ours was definitely one of the newer ones and it was huge, and it was a standard room. My only real bugbear was that they didnt know we got parking for free with our booking and the water in the room tasted very odd, but I put this down to plumbing. Overall I had a brilliant time and would have no problem recommending the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: ABF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here March 9-12 during the height of Spring Break. Our room was very clean and although somewhat small, there was plenty of room for the two of us and our luggage. Considering our room faced Duval Street, the noise was not too bad at night. The only problem was when a Harley would drive by. The hotel also provided an eye mask and ear plugs on the bed along with linen spray and a sleep CD. My husband did not even use his ear plugs. We had lunch and drinks at the pool bar which was nice and you could pick up the free wireless internet there. We also watched the sunset one evening from the rooftop and there was a guy playing guitar and a bar with inside and outside service. I recommend coming to the rooftop when cruise ships are in town since the view of the sunset at Mallory Square is blocked when ships are in port. Overall we had a great experience. The lobby area is nice and spacious, again with wireless access, although no computer. I used rewards points to stay here. Regular room rates for our stay were $348.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: H20diver
Reviews.Content: Reading some of the reviews I had to laugh. Our room was so small with two double beds and an armoire that we couldn't have a suitcase at the end of the bed. The bathroom was even smaller - I could wash my hands while sitting on the toilet and turn the water on in the tub at the same time. We had to pratically beg for towels and after staying 4 days the maid service hadn't even left another shampoo - we had to ask for another one to shower on the last day. We had scuba gear with us and there was no place to put it because the room and bathroom were so small. I've paid less at a Ritz than this hotel! The parking fee is a major rip off because you might, or might no find a space. There were also roosters and chickens roaming the parking lot. The rooftop at suset does have a fabulous view and the key lime cookies offered by the desk one afternoon were fabulous. There basically is no pool it too was so small.

Reviews.Title: “Staying here as we speak...”
Reviews.Author: sassycat
Reviews.Content: *This hotel is in a GREAT location *Staff friendly and helpful *Not noisy at all *Rooms kept cool, and the maid service is excellant *Big bathroom Short stumble home from the nightlife Would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - even thru the construction”
Reviews.Author: noapologies
Reviews.Content: The hotel went our of their way to make us happy. It was very busy - and under construction - but honestly - even that - was minimal... and Kenny Chesney was there at the same time - and we did not get any less attention than he did! Great location, upper deck for sunset was lovely - good casual restaurant - rooms clean and big enough - we had a king room - really a good stay -

Reviews.Title: “Ants everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: carlareno
Reviews.Content: Ants and more ants! Our room was full of them. I think it had to do with the poorly sealed doors/windows and the live plants in the room (which was a lovely touch except that the ants figured the plants were party central). Location is not great for KW - the "beach" across the street is nasty (smelly seaweed) and it's a bit of a walk from the action on Duval.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ve3039
Reviews.Content: Ignore all the bad reviews!!! This is a great hotel with a super location. We nearly cancelled our stay due to the bad reviews. Upon arriving we were pleasantly surprised. We were upgraded to a king room...quiet floor..the only little complaint we would have is that the elevators are old & slow. Everything else was just wonderful. We would stay here again without hesitation!!! D & V Eastman

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: HuskerTourist
Reviews.Content: This was not our first trip to Key West, but it was our first stay at La Concha. For starters, the so-called 24 hours fitness center was closed during our entire stay. We were offered a temporary membership at an off premises fitness center but that place had gone out of business. We were awakened three successive mornings by either carpet installers who were playing a very loud boombox right outside our door or by other workers using drills and sanders somewhere on a floor above us. We stayed at LaConcha for the first week of the new year and it was truly terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Szyque
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the North end of hotel facing Duval Street. When we checked-in one of two elevators were out of order. When we returned from dinner both elevators were out of order. We were told we could take the stairs to the 3rd floor or take the elevator in the South end of the hotel to the 2nd floor, then walk up one flight of stairs. When asked how long the elevators would be out of order. No one could estimate or inform how long the repairs could take. However, it was mentioned that this is an ongoing problem. Another issue during our stay; the toilet in our room wouldn't flush. The maintenance staff had to come to our room twice to repair. Not what I expected for a 3 night stay at a Crowne Plaza. Hotel is one of the oldest hotels in Key West. Rooms are quite small. We travel frequently and this experience will keep us from staying here again. Quite disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Management”
Reviews.Author: kwgirl
Reviews.Content: I recently made a non-cancellable, non-refundable reservation at LaConcha as a "preferred club" member, and was assured by the reservationist of a 7:00 a.m. check-in (as I was driving all night to attend a KW wedding). Later that day, I received an e-mail confirmation with a 4:00 p.m. check-in. I called about the discrepancy, and was told 4 times that the manager would call me to discuss the situation. The manager NEVER had the courtesy to call me back and the problem did not get resolved until I contacted the Corporate Office of Crowne Plaza Hotels. The resolution was the cancellation of my reservation, rather than to accommodate the early check-in time that was promised to me by the reservationist and was noted by her on my reservation on the computer. This, of course, caused me much time and money as I had to completely re-vamp my travel plans. How many of us have had to make special concessions for a misinformed employee that said or did the wrong thing?????? Obviously this manager doesn't care about pleasing the customer. BOTTOM LINE - If this is the caliber of the management team, I can only guess what the caliber of the hotel and staff is as well. My family and I travel to Key West at least 4 times a year, and we will share with everyone we meet that the La Concha is NOT the place to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: debbie40
Reviews.Content: We were a bit nervous about staying here due to some of the reviews. However its location was just right for us so we thought we would risk it. We were well prepared with our ear plugs as many of the reviews talk about the paper thin walls. It is true that they are not the best but if every guest respected this then it would not be a porblem. Unfortunately in any hotel there are a lot of inconsiderate people who talk at high volumes in corridors etc. However aside from this we were pleasantly surprised by the hotel. The reception area is wonderful and the bar/restaurant was nice with reasonably priced, very good food and friendly staff. The rooms were not particularly big but were well furnished and very clean. We had a room on the 5th floor over looking Duval street but got very little noise from the road despite staying over new year. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Really convenient and nice”
Reviews.Author: SCCoastin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 1/5 -1/9/07 and enjoyed its great location and (mostly) friendly staff. There was one man on the front desk who was quite haughty and a bit condescending. Even he couldn't diminish our enjoyment of Key West, however. Unlike another reviewer, we too stayed on the 6th floor but in a nice, large room overlooking the pool. We heard from other guests that their rooms were small. Ours was quite spacious and the beds really comfortable. You truly can walk just about everywhere from here and it's a good choice for a centrally located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with La Concha”
Reviews.Author: IlliniFan95
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Concha on 1/3-1/5 and were very happy with the hotel, the service and of course the great location. The only thing I would warn you about is the size of the room, our room was a King on the 6th floor overlooking Duval Street. It was small, but very nice. It had all the character you would expect from a historic hotel and all the modern features of a Crown Plaza. I would and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: jolary03
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed here from 12/8-12/11 and found the hotel to be in the best location with clean rooms and helpful staff. We had a balcony room and even though it was slightly obstructed because the building is being painted, we were told as soon as we checked in and were still able to get use of it. I would absolutely stay here again when we return to the Keys.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than terrible !!!”
Reviews.Author: wnbamiamisol
Reviews.Content: While this hotel has a great location on Duval Street, it is truely the ONLY thing it has going for it. I get to Key West fairly frequently and stay at a variety of hotels and B&B's. Two weeks ago Tuesday was my first LaConcha experience. I arrived about an hour before official check in time (4pm) and though I hold Priority Club's highest frequent guest status, I was told my room was not ready and was asked to return in an hour. That was fine with us, so my boyfriend and I grabbed a late afternoon snack and returned about 4:30pm. I again waited in the line at the front desk and watched as the woman in front of me was told her room wasn't ready, so she was upgraded to a suite. When it was my turn, I was told my room was not ready and asked to return in another hour or hour and a half! I said this would not be possible as my boyfriend and I had restaurant reservations for 6pm and needed to get ready. I was grudgingly given a room literally the size of a closet!!! There was no desk or work space. The tv was in a cabinet in the corner of the room and from the bed, only the person closest could view it. The tv remote didn't work. We attempted to get ready for our dinner. The power was off. I called the front desk and was told it would be on shortly. No apology offered. About 15 minutes later, the power came on. Then, there was NO water!!! Again, a call to the front desk and no apology offered. I was told the water was back on but "it will take a while to reach the 5th floor." We never got to shower before our dinner reservation. We returned to the hotel 9:30pm, with the wish to finally take a shower. ICE COLD water. Again, a call to the front desk, who explained because the power and water had been off, it would take a while for the water to heat. No apology. We ended up sleeping, never having had a shower. Each time the a/c cycled it woke us up. It sounded like a 747 coming in for a landing. In the morning, I looked for my newspaper that is always included for frequent guest members. Nothing. We check out with an unpleasant front desk clerk at 8:30am. I asked about the newspaper and was told they "had just arrived." He never offered to get me one. All this cost me $169 for a mid-week one night stay. I will NEVER return to this unpleasant hotel. As an aside, I filled out the Priority Club survey sent to me via email and received a reply that the hotel would be contacting me. Nothing.

Reviews.Title: “great location, service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: abbyliz
Reviews.Content: When I read the reviews I was a little worried â€” but then realized that many of the people who left them probably have a lot to complain about. If you're going for a quiet Key West vacation, don't stay here, in the heart of perhaps the three busiest blocks on Duval Street. (That said, we had no problems with the sound, but didn't expect total quiet). For that matter, don't stay anywhere near Duval â€” we've been in B & Bs nearby and the morning streetsweeper is a nightmare. For me, I like a clean, comfortable room; friendly, efficient staff and a location that doesn't involve a $20 cab ride each way to get to the Duvall bars. From here you can walk to pretty much anywhere in Old Town you desire. From your door, you can easily get to some of the best restaurants and bars in key west â€” and enjoy the convenience of returning to a comfortable room whenever you want. The housekeeping staff was phenominal, turndown service was great, front desk was friendly and helpful. I think some people may book this Crowne Plaza and expect full luxury of many of the chain's hotels. Fact of the matter is, you rarely will find that in this portion of key west â€” the buildings (and thus rooms) are older (and thus smaller) the sound proofing isn't as great and you do trade off some luxuries to be found on the other side of the island in the newer resorts and condos. I do wish you could use the wireless in your room (as opposed to the lobby) as it's a convenience I've come to expect most places we go. I have to imagine they'll make the appropriate adjustments, however. But it's convenient, clean, comfortable and decorated very nicely. Now that we've stayed there, I'll do it every time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rubby211
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location was the best! Four blocks from Mallory Square and a ton of restaurants and well known bars(Hard Rock, Sloppy's Joes, Fogarty's) just a couple of blocks away. There's a Starbuck's in the hotel, for those who enjoy a strong cup of coffee. Plenty of shops and stores to go spend the afternoon browsing. The rooms were clean, and comfortable. The maid service was in and out, very quickly. No complaints. The only thing is the rooms were small. Not alot of extra space. But if you go to Key West, you don't spend a lot of time in the room. The beds were to die for. A nice view from the 7th floor, and a decent pool to hang out when things are mellow....Already planning for a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: pnkbunnygirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of Duval street and is perfect for the people who have no desire to rent a car. I had most of my wedding guests stayed here and I visited the hotel myself and they loved it! The hotel is clean and very nice and the staff is very friendly. On the roof of the hotel is a resturant and a pool. If you are going to Key West and planning to party or just to hang out this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on Duval Street”
Reviews.Author: Gumbo425
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the La Concha in Key West in August. The location is very convenient to everything Duval Street has to offer. It's just a 3 - 4 block walk to the Gulf and the beautiful Key West sunsets. The front staff was very pleasant, helpful and accommodating. The hotel itself has seen better days, but apparently is going through some renovations. Our room was very small as was the bathroom; however the bed was very comfortable. Rooms facing Duval Street will be very noisy at night with the "boombox" vehicles and Harleys crusing the street. The hotel is apparently aware of this as complimentary ear plugs are provided in your room. Room lighting is a little substandard. There is no internet service in the rooms or lobby. You have to walk to a cybercafe around the corner if you want to check your e-mail or surf the web. As most hotels, the TV reception/color was terrible. There is a nice restaurant in the lobby and bicycles/scooters are available in the lot behind the hotel. The pool is rather on the small side, but there is a poolside bar. The rooftop balcony affords a pretty good view of sunsets and the rest of KW. The bar up there closes rather early, but I guest it's hard to compete with all the other establishment on Duval Street. If you're looking for luxury and lots of amenities, this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/great location”
Reviews.Author: Herk_Driver
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight Aug 28th. Great hotel and even better location. Don't beleive the negatives on some reviews, while it is not ultra modern, the location more than makes up for it. I thought the rooms were nice, a tad small, but definitely worth the price and location. Staying here, you will not need a car, you are stumbling distance to all the bars and activity on Duval Street. They have a great breakfast buffet as well. Starbucks cafe next to lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SparkyG
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April 23rd and 24th. We were upgraded to a junior suite, we are platinum members, and luckily we were offered the upgrade for free. The room was fantastic, a large comfortable bed, complete with sleep pack, lavender water, eye mask, calming cd. Large ornate beautiful bathroom, with lovely toiletries We were thrilled when we realized that the balcony not only looked onto duval street but wrapped around the side of the hotel overlooking another street, it was huge! Proved a great place to people watch He staff were VERY helpful and when we checked in there were fresh baked cookies on reception, I love little touches like that! The pool was brilliant, and summed Key West up, nobody swam, instead all sat around the edges of the pool sipping cocktails, reading books or chatting. I loved it! Very grown up! We had breakfast at the hotel and found it to be very good. The location could not be better, and the concierge was FANTASTIC, booking us a dolphin and snorkeling afternoon that was wonderful. I will go back to Key West, and I canâ€™t imagine that I would stay anywhere else other than La Concha! I love the old 30â€™s / 40â€™s style vibe of the old Key West that lives on here

Reviews.Title: “Get the balcony”
Reviews.Author: scholet
Reviews.Content: Everybody had me scared that I was going to walk into this blackhole. What a shock!!! This was a phenominal experience. I would have to say that those that complained about the hotel are people who cannot be satisfied. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room is not huge, but is not that small. We had a pack and play for the baby at the end of the bed, all of her toys etc. The balcony made the experience the best. Looking out over Duval Street was awesome. Don't hesitate if they are available.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the Heart of KeyWest”
Reviews.Author: Madjock
Reviews.Content: Situated right in the heart of Key West (Duval Street), you won't be stuck getting home after a night out. The hotel was rather nice, car parking around the back (at cost), with a small but suitable pool on the roof (may as well head to the beach). No problems with our stay, would recommend it for anyone who wants to be in the main part of Key West and prefers to walk around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place for a First Visit”
Reviews.Author: mamiesgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Concha from 6/25-29 and found it to be a good hotel at a reasonable cost for our short stay in Key West. As it was our first visit, we found the location to be ideal for walking around and seeing the sites of Duval Street. We vacationed with another couple and had adjoining rooms on the top floor. Since we are Priority Club members we were upgraded to king rooms. The hotel rooms were small but clean and had all the amenities. We did not hear noise from our neighbors but sometimes could hear loud cars or motorcycles outside. We found the service to be friendly and helpful. One major complaint is the lack of an in-room safe. I had to keep my jewelry in the hotel safe and this necessitated stopping at the front desk at least once daily to change jewelry. However, they were always quick to help. The pool area is very small and was crowded one day. Other days we had no trouble finding lounge chairs. The service at the pool and rooftop bars was good and the bartenders fun. Overall, if this is your first visit to Key West, the La Concha is a good, central locale for your trip. We did explore some of the B &Bs and would probably try one of those for another trip.

Reviews.Title: “what a dump!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: How gross this hotel is is unbelieveable! Here are a few of the low lights during my stay 1-wrong room assigned & room keys never worked 2-used condoms & KY jelly in dresser drawers 3-trash and clothing in drawers & underbed 4-pool is a mere 3 feet deep & your bath tub is probley bigger. My suggestion, stay @ one of the bed & breakfast's. It is a much better value & cleaner!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: albinfla
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 2 nights in June2006. The location is great for party goers but that is about it. Bugs in room, No ac in halls and elevators. Pool is terrible with many rowdies. I would dare swim in it while it was packed with drunks. $19 a day to park there is a bit too much. I wanted a cup of coffee at 3am and was told I had to wait till 6:30 am when the retaurants open. For the $ you can find a better place

Reviews.Title: “A Solid 3 Stars”
Reviews.Author: e_gorey
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews here ahead of time and was pleasantly surprised. If you're looking for a 4-star luxury resort, this is not the place. In that respect, it doesn't live up to the quality of many other Crowne Plazas; the pool is small and crowded and the hotel seemed to be frequented by conferences of seniors. But if you're looking for a comfortable place to stay in a great location, this is it. We paid $135 for the night and thought it was very reasonable. Our room with two doubles was not a bad size at all...average I thought for a hotel room. Maybe we were on the quiet side, but I did not hear a thing in the middle of the night, though my friend, a light sleeper, said that she heard some rooster crows. Yes, it's in the touristy area of shops and restaurants, but if you don't want touristy, why would you stay near Duval Street at all, or for that matter, on this side of the Key? I thought that being centrally located to everything, including Mallory Square, was a major plus. I walked about 1 mi. in the opposite direction to where many of the B&B inns were. Rather than being jealous that I didn't stay on the "quiet" end of Duval street, I was glad that I didn't have to walk really far in hot weather to all of the attractions. Yes, an inn may give you more of a local flavor, but I think you get that just from visiting the area. We had wireless in our room and sufficient work space. The bed was comfortable and the room service (breakfast) was good. The rooftop offered great views of the city. This hotel is rated 3 stars and 3 stars is what you get.

Reviews.Title: “great location , good old hotel”
Reviews.Author: trevor-wa
Reviews.Content: my parents stayed at the la concha ( crown plaza ) while we stayed 13 blocks down the street at the best western haibiscas- they loved the location and the hotel with the exeption they found the room a bit small and the inside courtyard ajoining their room noisy until late on sat nite with people partying. best thing for us is the bar/deck at the top of the hotel to have a drink and watch the sunset with 20-30 locals each nite

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend the La Concha”
Reviews.Author: fredisenb
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the la Concha Hotel in Key West and had to write to express my views. Even though the reviews on this property were hit or miss I decided to go using my Priority Points. Upon calling the hotel I was greeted in a friendly and professional manner and I made the reservation without any problems. Upon arriving at the facility I was once again warmly greeted by the luggage attendant and the front desk clerk. "Mary" was very nice and upgraded us to a Junior Suite. She mentioned the room was not ready (9:00 a.m.) and she would call us immediately upon having a room ready. I gave her my cell phone and left. After lunch, approx. 1:30 p.m. "Mary" called to say the room was ready. We came back to the hotel and were once again warmly greeted by the entire staff. Our room was indeed upgraded to a Junior Suite which had a king size and a pull-out Queen. This was more than adedquate. The bathroom, room, beds etc. looked like they had been recently remodeled. The bathroom was also in near-perfect condition. The Lobby and all public areas were excellent as the location (right on Duval). The restauarnt was NOT good. Go some place else to eat and stay here. The lobby and pool etc. were also clean and in great condition, I would return to this hotel and recommend it to anyone. You cannot beat the location right in the heart of things and within easy access to all the things you want to do while in Key West. The only draw back is that there is no beach and you will hear some noise at night from the clubs, crowds on Duval. Not enough to keep you up but might be a problem for light sleepers. Otherwise, you will be pleasantly surprised to find that this hotel, though, older has been fully remodeled and is in great shape. On a side note, we dropped by the Casa Marina Rsort which we had been to about 15 years ago and wondered what was going on. The main dinning room which used to be stately and beautiful is now closed ( only food served Alfresco) and the property looked a bit drab. In comparison I think the La Concha was in much better shape. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Loud, Unfriendly and Overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been to Key West many times, and this is by far the worst hotel I stayed at. We arrived around 2:30 to find out that our room was not ready. Not too shocking, except for the way the information was delivered. The staff was was short and non-welcoming, telling us that our room would not be available until their "guaranteed check-in time" of 4pm and then disappearing before we could ask any questions. While at first the location of the hotel seemed ideal, located right on Duval Street, it was anything but. I love Duval Street, but the noise of the crowds and the motorcycles going until 2-3am is a bit much. The hotel even provides ear-plugs if that's any sign of how loud it is overnight. Apparently, the non-smoking room we reserved turned out to be on the second floor directly across from the elevators, facing Duval, and was definitely a smoking room with ashtrays throughout. The Sleep Advantage bed is the only complement I can give. We paid extra money to stay here thinking that it would be a better experience. Now I'm glad it was only one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great again”
Reviews.Author: drl80
Reviews.Content: Second year running staying here for a week in December (2004 and 2005). Great location, nice room, good staff and very comfortable bed. Can't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Over a 5 night stay I switched rooms 3 times. Why? The walls are not paper thin. Paper is actually thicker the the walls at the La Concha. You will (not can) hear entire conversations from the rooms next to yours. I heard entire conversations, snoring, coughing, laughing EVERYTHING, regardless of the room. It became a joke with everyone in the lobby. Oh Ya, dont think of having internet access in your room. The only internet access is a week wireless conection in the lobby. Stay anywhere...anywhere but the La Concha!!! The staff was great, food was great, nice service!!! All good except for the rooms. (Even the front desk managers own parents will not stay at the hotel because of the lowsy rooms) I even heard the guests in each room peeing (sitting down and standing up) Run from the Laconcha..Run as fast as you can,,,anywhere is better than this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “That is not my job.”
Reviews.Author: DTNPROMAN
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is wonderful. It is right in the center of things on Duval. I am a non-smoker, however, the only rooms with a balcony are smoking. I usually never take a chance on a smoking room because of the stale smell, however, on check in I told them that I was a non-smoker, and the fellow was kind to tell me that people go out on the balconies to smoke, so I would probably find the room to smell fresh and if not, to call him. When I got to the room I was pleasantly surprised that it was fresh for a smoking room and I was so glad that I opted for the balcony because the room had french doors that I left open during the day when in my room the entire stay and the balcony was huge. All balcony rooms are on the second level overlooking Duval. The King bed in my room was very comfortable. The room is dated, but I found it a bit charming. As others have said, it is small. If you have kids, you will be cramped. It is OK for one or two people. Here is the problem I had. Without going into alot of detail, I could not get them to clean my room and when I asked Crowne Plaza staff, one of the staffers said, "That is not my job." He offered no help or solution. Later I asked another who assured me it would be taken care of while I was out for an hour but I came back after 2 hours and it still wasn't taken care of. That staff member said, "I did what I was supposed to do." It was late in the day before someone FINALLY cleaned the room. Had the staff at this hotel been more accomodating, I would have had a nice stay. The next time I come to Key West and have my wife and two children with me, I will seek out a larger room to accomodate us comfortably and a hotel that has a "That IS my job," attitude. It was the negative attitude of the staff I dealt with that really turned me off to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located but......”
Reviews.Author: childrens1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza over Christmas. We paid $199 for a room that was extremely small. That was in addition to the $18/night we paid for self-parking. The hotel itself is located right on Duval Street. If you are looking for a quiet getaway this is not the place to go. The earplugs and eye masks left on the bed by the hotel should have clued us in. Not only did we experience a lot of street noise late into the night but the walls are paper thin. We felt like we knew our neighbors intimately. The hotel is old, but fairly well maintained. The comfort zone bed was soft and slopped in the middle and left my husband with a backache. It had been about 15 years since I had been to Key West. It is no longer a quaint town with some eccentric locals. We found it to be a bit tacky. More like Mardi Gras than Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Stay at La Concha”
Reviews.Author: dsterbd
Reviews.Content: We were lucky and got upgraded to a suite. Very clean and the service was very nice. It's an older hotel, but our room seemed new and had a lot of character. High ceilings and pedestal sink in the large bathroom. The hotel roof is the highest on the key so you had a great view all around. Highly recommended for the suite, but I don't know about the smaller rooms.

Reviews.Title: “LaConcha is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Dpaina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our first anniversary here at the Crowne Plaza 9/23-9/25. Ordinarily the prices here would be a bit high for us but we used our Priority Club points to book the room and were upgraded to a suite. We could not have been happier with the room, the view, the staff, the pool and the location. The sunset at the rooftop is spectacular. It's difficult to find a NICE place to stay in Key West. This is one of the few.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff--great memory”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel (15 rooms) and The Top for our wedding reception. The hotel and staff were perfect in every way. Our room was large (suite) and had a beautiful view. The hotel is in the middle of everything on Duval Street, so you can walk everywhere. The catering, etc. was wonderful and our reception was great and went off without a hitch. We were catered to.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: NJLady
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the La Concha from 8/20-8/25/05 We were able to check in early (around 1pm) and enjoyed our five nights there. The beds were SOOOO comfy! Had no problem with street noise since we had a side room and the LOCATION of the hotel was KEY! We walked or took scooters everywhere. We ate at the restaurant for breakfast one morning and my blueberry pancakes were delicious. We really loved the view from "the top" for Sunset. All in all a great stay. Would recommend the hotel for singles and couples (not sure about families since the pool isn't really too exciting for children) but It did its job cooling me off while sipping Pina coladas :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Haunted Hotel in the Middle of Duval Street”
Reviews.Author: Michina
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Concha Hotel on the 20th of August of this year and loved it. The hotel has a wonderful decor lobby and pleasant clerks working the front desk. The concierge was quick to give us tips of how to get around the key. This hotel is rated as 4 star and indeed it is... is right on Duval just steps from many stores/ bars / and restaurants... One doesn't need a car to get around.. At most rent a moped or a small golf cart to get you around but everything is within walking distance. Our room was perfect, facing Duval street. We had a king size bed and the decor was very soothing. The bed and linens were phenomenal it felt like if you were sleeping at home. The also offer a cd to relax and soothe you while you sleep.... the room had all the amenities needed for a comfortable stay. The bathroom was spacious and overall the room was very clean and smelled fresh. The best part is that this is one of the haunted hotels on Key West and we were told that our room was visited by ghost every so often.... If you leave loose change around, you will find that they get rearranged.. well we did just that and up to the minute we went to sleep they had not been touched, however, in the morning it was a different story.. don't know what happened and we guess we never will.... Oh.. also try the Ghost Tour.. is really nice and the stories are funny.... bare in mind there is a lot of walking so wear comfortable shoes..... this key caters to Adults.... there is much partying happening every night.. I didn't see anything for children.... While in the Keys visit the Hard Rock Cafe.. a great spot to grab a drink and guess what you are able to take your drinks out and walk to the next bar... We also found a cute little Cuban restaurant by Mallory Square.. try it the food was plentiful and delicious.... By the way... while at the Hotel try the bar on the top floor, the drinks are great and the view is to die for.. the pool at this hotel looks nothing like the website.. this pool is very small, but there is plenty of lounge chairs to take in the sun.. oh and it has a bar tooo...... the beach is rocky so bring your aqua shoes, but the water is clear and very warm..... oh and there is also a parking fee of $18.00 per day.. Ouchhhh!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: lovetolaugh40s
Reviews.Content: I arrived the the Crowne Plaza Hotel On July 23rd at 1:oo pm. The room wasn't ready, which I expected. I decided to go to the pool bar. The pool itself looked nice but was very small & crowded. The speaker system at the pool bar reminded me of a 1960's AM transistor radio. It was distrorted and crackling. Quite a few guests even made a comments about it, mostly to shut it off. I can't beleive that a so-called 4 star hotel can't pay $100.00 for a half way decent speaker system. I periodically called downstairs to see if my room was ready. I kept getting "call back in a 1/2 hour". In the mean time I met a couple of people who said that they called last minute, and was able to check in at 12:00pm. I reserved my room over a month before my arrival. I wasn't a happy camper. Finally 5:30 pm...1 1/2 hours after check in time, they said my room was ready. I went downstairs and the reservationist said that it wasn't ready. I explained I just called & they said it was. He played around with the computer & said oh yes...queen non-smoking. I said NO..king smoking. He proceeded to grin and hand me a key. I went into the room & it was a queen handicapped room. I WAS LIVID! Among other things...Ice machine didn't work, the staff did not seem to care about their guests, the food was not that great, and they tried to put a charge on my bill that was not mine. I checked out 2 days earlier than I was supposed to...that's how happy I was with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Parents Beware”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Parents Beware! We flew down to FL with our toddler for our first vacation as a family and we did not want to lug a heavy pack and play with us. Therefore, we requested a crib or pack and play to be provided by La Concha. At no time were we given any indication this would be a problem during the four (4) times we made the request: once when we reserved the room, once early in the morning of the day we were to check in, at check-in, and again before we left the hotel @ 5:45 pm to go to dinner. When we returned from dinner at 8:00 pm, there was no crib in the room. When I went to the front desk to complain, I was told that there was no crib to be had and that a crib request was just a â€œrequestâ€� not a guarantee. We had already unpacked and returned our rental car since there was no need for it in Key West; at that time of night, we were stuck. We couldn't just pick up and go to another hotel, which the man on duty at the front desk told us we could do. We had an exhausted toddler and nowhere to put him to sleep. When I asked to speak with the General Manager on duty, the person at the front desk was quite unpleasant. The General Manager on duty then told me that he was going to â€œhave someone go buy a crib from K-Mart and put it together within an hour.â€� It was after 8 PM on a Sunday night! There was no way that was going to happen! Finally, someone at the hotel figured out that if they called another hotel, they could borrow a crib from them. We did get a pack and play (which was just fine) over an hour later, but the whole situation was very poorly handled and dampened our spirits on what was supposed to be an enjoyable family vacation. Obviously the staff needs some training in how to better treat their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Unfortunatley, my fiance and I only stayed here 1 night, June 21, 2005. We were driving through the keys and south Florida and of course, Key West was one of our stops. I wasn't sure I should write a review since we only stayed one night, but I was so impressed that I had to share our experience. We did not have reservations and when we arrived in Key West we first stopped at a Courtyard which was about 2-3 miles from Duval street, which is the where the action is. I thought we would get a good rate there because of the distacne to Duval St. However, they wanted over $200/nt. So we drove on. We went down Duval and decided to try the Crown Plaza. The lobby was very nice and had a historic feel. The front desk was very helpful and within minutes had us booked for the night for a very reasonable rate. The concierge immediatley approached us and welcomed us the the hotel. She then gave us a large list of restaurants/bars that are in the area and how to get there. The hallways to the rooms made is seem like you were in a past time zone. The room itself was just average size, but was very clean and had very nice decor. The hotel and a resaurant/bar attached to it that had some entertainment. We sat in there for a while and it was comfortable. The Location of the hotel is the best part. It is located right on Duval street and in the middle of all the action. All you have to do is walk out of the hotel in any direction and immediatley you are experiencing Key West. There are many, many bars/restaurants located within a couple blocks of the hotel. We decied to eat at a place I believe was called the Raw Bar which was located right on the waterfront. I was fantastic. Especially if you are an Oyster person. Many different kinds of oysters and even an oyster shot if you are up to it. This was only a 10-15min walk from the hotel. We were both very satisfied with the Crown Plaza. I wish we would have stayed another night in Key West. The friendliness of the staff combined with the location of the hotel makes this a must stay at hotel. I have written 10-15 reviews on trip advisor, and this is only the second property I have awarded a 5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “This is the perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: missile801
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this hotel last week and just loved it. It in the perfect location on Duval street. The rooms are on the small side compared to newer hotels, but are clean, cozy and well appointed. The hotel staff was very helpful. I'd recommend this to anyone and I hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Listen to Bad Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: TopGun_1_1998
Reviews.Content: Don't listen to the bad reviews about this hotel. My spouse and I and another couple stayed here May 24 thru May 26th. They had a balcony room and the noise did not bother them at all and they loved the view of Duval. My spouse and I had a double/double overlooking the flowers on the wall leading to the parking area and it was quiet and very comfortable. The staff at the hotel from housekeeping to front desk was very responsive to all our needs. If you stay here, remember they are on an ecology based linen change and so advise housekeeping if you want the linens changed daily. Shop around on the web for the best prices. We will use this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced room not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: davcio
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the end of April; paid a "discounted" price of $296.80 + tax per night; not worth the price at all! As in preview reviews, my room had no fridge, a small cupboard and view over the car park. Terrible breakfast service (twice asked for bacon and was given sausages) and was charged twice for a bottle of water! Saw lots of hotels in similar location and next time will go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Location and Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the La Concha Crowne Plaza Hotel in Key West Florida. What a wonderful hotel! Our room was old fashioned but clean clean clean and what great linens on the bed and in the bathroom!! This is really a great location because you can walk to all the restaurants and shops. The pool is a little small for me but it's pretty and charming as is the entire hotel. We had a great dinner of Filet Mignon in the restaurant although I think the food is probably hit and miss. The best thing about this hotel is the SERVICE!! The friendliest and hardest working staff I've seen in any hotel, especially after staying in the carribean! We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is quite nice but....”
Reviews.Author: Lovethekeys
Reviews.Content: We staid one night at La Concha. Unfortunately, our room was probably one of the lowest standard (#314) : no refrigerator, no closet. It had a nice view on the courtyard though. The hotel is quite beautiful but the elevator near the reception area was extremely smelly. We had to hold our breath during our trips up and down. We took the elevator several times during our stay and it was always smelling. I even caught a housekeeping lady spraying the elevator cabin with airfreshener (and that made it even worse !). This situation does not fit at all with the high standard of this hotel and we were disappointed. We do recommend to see the view on the top floor, it is great !

Reviews.Title: “No soundproofing at all - don't go during peak season”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many different hotels in key west and enjoy the city. We happend to (stupidly) come during spring break season and the hotel was a complete zoo. The college kids next door came back at 4am and started screaming and wailing. It was totally insane - we might as well have not had doors at all there was absolutely no soundproofing. We left and, to their credit, got our money back. If you are going when the hotel is busy be prepared to hear everything everywhere because there appears to be no insulation at all. However, if you went there when it wasn't too busy would probably be nice because it has a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Dario+Family
Reviews.Content: Recently refurbished, it's good value for money if you can get one of the rockbottom internet rate. Helpful and polite personnel, great location: few blocks from Mallory Square, few minutes from Fort Zachary Taylor Beach. Bear in mind that the swimming pool it's more like a large Jacuzzi. The hotel parking ($18) fills up quickly, if you plan to arrive late, try to reserve a spot. Terrific view from the rooftop terrace: 360 degrees of Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel was OK. Rooms a bit small for the price, but the location is really what they're selling. The problem is when I received my Credit Card statement I was overcharged $994.00. I've made numerous attempts to contact accounts receivable and on one occasion even spoke with a woman named Linda. I was told by her that she would look into it and get back to me. After not hearing from her for two days I started making more calls. I've left a message on every attempt and still have not heard from anyone. I feel this is unprofessional and down right criminal. If you're looking to be treated with respect and courtesy then you may want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Hated It. Never Again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location was great and other Crown Plaza Hotels I've stayed in have been pretty nice so why not? What a mistake. The so called pool is no bigger than a large hot tub. The air conditioning got the room down to about 85 degrees before giving up. The lobby was really cheesy looking with the fake palm trees and cheap plastic flowers . The room itself was cramped and noisy. Every flushed commode was heard all through the night. The bar was generic and so was this entire overpriced mess of a hotel. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: cajuntraveler16
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. We celebrated our 20th anniversary in Key West. Crowne Plaza was great. We walked everywhere we needed to and the staff was extremely pleasant. The outside noise was a little bothersome at first, but we got used to it. We stayed in a junior suite which was perfect. Capt. Tony's and Irish Kevin's were our favorite night spots and Caroline's had the best food for the price. Loved Key West.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Good : As other reviews have said, the location here is great. The hotel is close to almost all of the places you might want to go on Duval Street. Great view of the sunset from the Top. The Bad : The rooms are small for the price. Our A/C worked too well - if it was on the temp. would be in the 50's no matter what we had the thermostat set to. You can hear the noise from the street (a price for being in the center of things) even on the 6th floor. The Ugly: Whe we checked out they tried to bill us an extra $18 a day for parking (we had no car). They also tried to charge us for room service which we ordered but never received and drinks which we paid cash for. We asked to see the drink receipts that they claimed we signed for and they weren't able to produce them. I don't know if someone else just gave our room number or if this was just something they were trying to pull. ASK TO SEE YOUR BILL BEFORE YOU GIVE YOUR CREDIT CARD.

HotelInfo.Name: Crowne Plaza Key West La Concha
HotelInfo.Address: 430 Duval Street, Key West, FL 33040
